verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सोमा॑य व्यश्व॒वत्पव॑मानाय गायत म॒हे स॒हस्र॑चक्षसे
verses.transliteration: prá sómāya vyaśvavát  pávamānāya gāyata  mahé sahásracakṣase

translation.text: Sing forth your songs, as Vyaṣva sang, to Soma Pavamâna, to, The Mighty One with thousand eyes;

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ वर्णं॑ मधु॒श्चुतं॒ हरिं॑ हि॒न्वन्त्यद्रि॑भिः इन्दु॒मिन्द्रा॑य पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: yásya várṇam madhuścútaṃ  háriṃ hinvánty ádribhiḥ  índum índrāya pītáye

translation.text: Whose coloured sap they drive with stones, the yellow meath-distilling juice, Indu for Indra, for his drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्य॑ ते वा॒जिनो॑ व॒यं विश्वा॒ धना॑नि जि॒ग्युषः॑ स॒खि॒त्वमा वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: tásya te vājíno vayáṃ  víśvā dhánāni jigyúṣaḥ  sakhitvám ā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: We seek to gain the friendly love of thee that Strong and Mighty One, Of thee the winner of all wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॑ पवस्व॒ धार॑या म॒रुत्व॑ते च मत्स॒रः विश्वा॒ दधा॑न॒ ओज॑सा
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā pavasva dhā́rayā  marútvate ca matsaráḥ  víśvā dádhāna ójasā

translation.text: Flow onward with thy stream, a Steer, inspiriting the Maruts' Lord, Winning all riches by thy might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ ध॒र्तार॑मो॒ण्यो॒३॒॑ः पव॑मान स्व॒र्दृश॑म् हि॒न्वे वाजे॑षु वा॒जिन॑म्
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā dhartā́ram oṇyòḥ  pávamāna svardŕ̥śam  hinvé vā́jeṣu vājínam

translation.text: I send thee forth to battle from the press, O Pavamâna, Strong, Sustainer, looker on the light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒या चि॒त्तो वि॒पानया॒ हरिः॑ पवस्व॒ धार॑या युजं॒ वाजे॑षु चोदय
verses.transliteration: ayā́ cittó vipā́náyā  háriḥ pavasva dhā́rayā  yújaṃ vā́jeṣu codaya

translation.text: Acknowledged by this song of mine, flow, tawny-coloured, with thy stream Incite to battle thine ally.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ न॑ इन्दो म॒हीमिषं॒ पव॑स्व वि॒श्वद॑र्शतः अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ सोम गातु॒वित्
verses.transliteration: ā́ na indo mahī́m íṣam  pávasva viśvádarśataḥ  asmábhyaṃ soma gātuvít

translation.text: O Indu, visible to all pour out for us abundant food: Soma, be thou our prosperer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ क॒लशा॑ अनूष॒तेन्दो॒ धारा॑भि॒रोज॑सा एन्द्र॑स्य पी॒तये॑ विश
verses.transliteration: ā́ kaláśā anūṣata-  -índo dhā́rābhir ójasā  éndrasya pītáye viśa

translation.text: The pitchers, Indu, with thy streams have sung aloud in vigorous might Enter them, and let Indra drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ ते॒ मद्यं॒ रसं॑ ती॒व्रं दु॒हन्त्यद्रि॑भिः स प॑वस्वाभिमाति॒हा
verses.transliteration: yásya te mádyaṃ rásaṃ  tīvráṃ duhánty ádribhiḥ  sá pavasvābhimātihā́

translation.text: O thou whose potent gladdening juice they milk out with the stones, flow on, Destroyer of our enemies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: राजा॑ मे॒धाभि॑रीयते॒ पव॑मानो म॒नावधि॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षेण॒ यात॑वे
verses.transliteration: rā́jā medhā́bhir īyate  pávamāno manā́v ádhi  antárikṣeṇa yā́tave

translation.text: King Pavamâna is implored with holy songs, on man's behalf, To travel through the firmament.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ न॑ इन्दो शत॒ग्विनं॒ गवां॒ पोषं॒ स्वश्व्य॑म् वहा॒ भग॑त्तिमू॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ na indo śatagvínaṃ  gávām póṣaṃ sváśvyam  váhā bhágattim ūtáye

translation.text: Bring us, O Indu, hundredfold increase of kine, and noble steeds, The gift of fortune for our help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नः॑ सोम॒ सहो॒ जुवो॑ रू॒पं न वर्च॑से भर सु॒ष्वा॒णो दे॒ववी॑तये
verses.transliteration: ā́ naḥ soma sáho júvo  rūpáṃ ná várcase bhara  suṣvāṇó devávītaye

translation.text: Pressed for the banquet of the Gods, O Soma, bring us might, and speed, Like beauty for a brilliant show.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्षा॑ सोम द्यु॒मत्त॑मो॒ऽभि द्रोणा॑नि॒ रोरु॑वत् सीद॑ञ्छ्ये॒नो न योनि॒मा
verses.transliteration: árṣā soma dyumáttamo  -abhí dróṇāni róruvat  sī́dañ chyenó ná yónim ā́

translation.text: Soma, flow on exceeding bright with loud roar to the wooden vats, Falcon-like resting in thine home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒प्सा इन्द्रा॑य वा॒यवे॒ वरु॑णाय म॒रुद्भ्यः॑ सोमो॑ अर्षति॒ विष्ण॑वे
verses.transliteration: apsā́ índrāya vāyáve  váruṇāya marúdbhyaḥ-  sómo arṣati víṣṇave

translation.text: Soma, the Water-winner flows to Indra, Vâyu, Varuṇa, To Vishṇu and the Marut host.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इषं॑ तो॒काय॑ नो॒ दध॑द॒स्मभ्यं॑ सोम वि॒श्वतः॑ आ प॑वस्व सह॒स्रिण॑म्
verses.transliteration: íṣaṃ tokā́ya no dádhad  -asmábhyaṃ soma viśvátaḥ  ā́ pavasva sahasríṇam

translation.text: Soma , bestowing food upon our progeny, from every sides, Pour on us riches thousandfold

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये सोमा॑सः परा॒वति॒ ये अ॑र्वा॒वति॑ सुन्वि॒रे ये वा॒दः श॑र्य॒णाव॑ति
verses.transliteration: yé sómāsaḥ parāváti  yé arvāváti sunviré  yé vādáḥ śaryaṇā́vati

translation.text: The Soma juices which have been expressed afar or near at hand, Or there on Saryanavan's bank,

verses.sanskrit_deva: य आ॑र्जी॒केषु॒ कृत्व॑सु॒ ये मध्ये॑ प॒स्त्या॑नाम् ये वा॒ जने॑षु प॒ञ्चसु॑
verses.transliteration: yá ārjīkéṣu kŕ̥tvasu  yé mádhye pastyā̀nām  yé vā jáneṣu pañcásu

translation.text: Those pressed among Ârjîkas, pressed among the active, in men's homes, Or pressed among the Races Five-

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते नो॑ वृ॒ष्टिं दि॒वस्परि॒ पव॑न्ता॒मा सु॒वीर्य॑म् सु॒वा॒ना दे॒वास॒ इन्द॑वः
verses.transliteration: té no vr̥ṣṭíṃ divás pári  pávantām ā́ suvī́ryam  suvānā́ devā́sa índavaḥ

translation.text: May these celestial drops, expressed, pour forth upon us, as they flow, Rain from the heavens apd hero strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑ते हर्य॒तो हरि॑र्गृणा॒नो ज॒मद॑ग्निना हि॒न्वा॒नो गोरधि॑ त्व॒चि
verses.transliteration: pávate haryató hárir  gr̥ṇānó jamádagninā  hinvānó gór ádhi tvací

translation.text: Urged forward o'er the ox-hide flows the Lovely One of tawny hue, Lauded by Jamadagni's song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र शु॒क्रासो॑ वयो॒जुवो॑ हिन्वा॒नासो॒ न सप्त॑यः श्री॒णा॒ना अ॒प्सु मृ॑ञ्जत
verses.transliteration: prá śukrā́so vayojúvo  hinvānā́so ná sáptayaḥ  śrīṇānā́ apsú mr̥ñjata

translation.text: Like horses urged to speed, the drops, bright, stirring vital power, when blent With milk, are beautified in streams.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ सु॒तेष्वा॒भुवो॑ हिन्वि॒रे दे॒वता॑तये स प॑वस्वा॒नया॑ रु॒चा
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā sutéṣv ābhúvo  hinviré devátātaye  sá pavasvānáyā rucā́

translation.text: So they who toil with juices send thee forward for the Gods' repast: So with this splendour flow thou on.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ते॒ दक्षं॑ मयो॒भुवं॒ वह्नि॑म॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे पान्त॒मा पु॑रु॒स्पृह॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ te dákṣam mayobhúvaṃ  váhnim adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe  pā́ntam ā́ puruspŕ̥ham

translation.text: We choose to-day that chariot-steed of thine, the Strong, that brings us bliss, The Guardian, the desire of all,

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ म॒न्द्रमा वरे॑ण्य॒मा विप्र॒मा म॑नी॒षिण॑म् पान्त॒मा पु॑रु॒स्पृह॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ mandrám ā́ váreṇyam  ā́ vípram ā́ manīṣíṇam  pā́ntam ā́ puruspŕ̥ham

translation.text: The Excellent, the Gladdener, the Sage with heart that understands, The Guardian, the desire of all;

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ र॒यिमा सु॑चे॒तुन॒मा सु॑क्रतो त॒नूष्वा पान्त॒मा पु॑रु॒स्पृह॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ rayím ā́ sucetúnam  ā́ sukrato tanū́ṣv ā́  pā́ntam ā́ puruspŕ̥ham

translation.text: Who for ourselves, O thou Most Wise, is wealth and fair intelligence, The Guardian, the desire of all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व विश्वचर्षणे॒ऽभि विश्वा॑नि॒ काव्या॑ सखा॒ सखि॑भ्य॒ ईड्यः॑
verses.transliteration: pávasva viśvacarṣaṇe  abhí víśvāni kā́vyā  sákhā sákhibhya ī́ḍyaḥ

translation.text: FOR holy lore of every sort, flow onward thou whom all men love. A Friend to be besought by friends.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताभ्यां॒ विश्व॑स्य राजसि॒ ये प॑वमान॒ धाम॑नी प्र॒ती॒ची सो॑म त॒स्थतुः॑
verses.transliteration: tā́bhyāṃ víśvasya rājasi  yé pavamāna dhā́manī  pratīcī́ soma tasthátuḥ

translation.text: O'er all thou rulest with these Two which, Soma Pavamâna, stand, Turned, as thy stations, hitherward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ धामा॑नि॒ यानि॑ ते॒ त्वं सो॑मासि वि॒श्वतः॑ पव॑मान ऋ॒तुभिः॑ कवे
verses.transliteration: pári dhā́māni yā́ni te  tváṃ somāsi viśvátaḥ  pávamāna r̥túbhiḥ kave

translation.text: Wise Soma Pavamâna, thou encompassest on every side Thy stations as the seasons come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व ज॒नय॒न्निषो॒ऽभि विश्वा॑नि॒ वार्या॑ सखा॒ सखि॑भ्य ऊ॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: pávasva janáyann íṣo  abhí víśvāni vā́ryā-  sákhā sákhibhya ūtáye

translation.text: Flow onward, generating food, for precious boons of every kind, A Friend for friends, to be our help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॑ शु॒क्रासो॑ अ॒र्चयो॑ दि॒वस्पृ॒ष्ठे वि त॑न्वते प॒वित्रं॑ सोम॒ धाम॑भिः
verses.transliteration: táva śukrā́so arcáyo  divás pr̥ṣṭhé ví tanvate  pavítraṃ soma dhā́mabhiḥ

translation.text: Upon the lofty ridge of heaven thy bright rays with their essences, Soma, spread purifying power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तवे॒मे स॒प्त सिन्ध॑वः प्र॒शिषं॑ सोम सिस्रते तुभ्यं॑ धावन्ति धे॒नवः॑
verses.transliteration: távemé saptá síndhavaḥ  praśíṣaṃ soma sisrate  túbhyaṃ dhāvanti dhenávaḥ

translation.text: O Soma, these Seven Rivers flow, as being thine, to give command: The Streams of milk run forth to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सो॑म याहि॒ धार॑या सु॒त इन्द्रा॑य मत्स॒रः दधा॑नो॒ अक्षि॑ति॒ श्रवः॑
verses.transliteration: prá soma yāhi dhā́rayā  sutá índrāya matsaráḥ  dádhāno ákṣiti śrávaḥ

translation.text: Flow onward, Soma in a stream, effused to gladden Indra's heart, Bringing imperishable fame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समु॑ त्वा धी॒भिर॑स्वरन्हिन्व॒तीः स॒प्त जा॒मयः॑ विप्र॑मा॒जा वि॒वस्व॑तः
verses.transliteration: sám u tvā dhībhír asvaran  hinvatī́ḥ saptá jāmáyaḥ  vípram ājā́ vivásvataḥ

translation.text: Driving thee in Vivasvan's course, the Seven Sisters with their hymns Made melody round thee the Sage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मृ॒जन्ति॑ त्वा॒ सम॒ग्रुवोऽव्ये॑ जी॒रावधि॒ ष्वणि॑ रे॒भो यद॒ज्यसे॒ वने॑
verses.transliteration: mr̥jánti tvā sám agrúvaḥ-  -ávye jīrā́v ádhi ṣváṇi  rebhó yád ajyáse váne

translation.text: The virgins deck thee o'er fresh streams to drive thee to the sieve when thou, A singer, bathest in the wood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑मानस्य ते कवे॒ वाजि॒न्त्सर्गा॑ असृक्षत अर्व॑न्तो॒ न श्र॑व॒स्यवः॑
verses.transliteration: pávamānasya te kave  vā́jin sárgā asr̥kṣata  -árvanto ná śravasyávaḥ

translation.text: The streams of Pavamâna, thine, Sage, Mighty One, have pouredthem forth. Like coursers eager for renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॒ कोशं॑ मधु॒श्चुत॒मसृ॑ग्रं॒ वारे॑ अ॒व्यये॑ अवा॑वशन्त धी॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: áchā kóśam madhuścútam  ásr̥graṃ vā́re avyáye  ávāvaśanta dhītáyo

translation.text: They have been poured upon the fleece towards the meath-distilling vat: The holy songs have sounded forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॑ समु॒द्रमिन्द॒वोऽस्तं॒ गावो॒ न धे॒नवः॑ अग्म॑न्नृ॒तस्य॒ योनि॒मा
verses.transliteration: áchā samudrám índavaḥ-  -ástaṃ gā́vo ná dhenávaḥ  ágmann r̥tásya yónim ā́

translation.text: Like milch-kine coming home, the drops of Soma juice have reached the lake, Have reached the place of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ण॑ इन्दो म॒हे रण॒ आपो॑ अर्षन्ति॒ सिन्ध॑वः यद्गोभि॑र्वासयि॒ष्यसे॑
verses.transliteration: prá ṇa indo mahé ráṇe-  ā́po arṣanti síndhavaḥ  yád góbhir vāsayiṣyáse

translation.text: O Indu, to our great delight the running waters flow to us, When thou wilt robe thyself in milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्य॑ ते स॒ख्ये व॒यमिय॑क्षन्त॒स्त्वोत॑यः इन्दो॑ सखि॒त्वमु॑श्मसि
verses.transliteration: ásya te sakhyé vayáṃ  íyakṣantas tvótayaḥ  índo sakhitvám uśmasi

translation.text: In this thy friendship, and with thee to help us, fain to sacrifice, Indu, we crave thy friendly love.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प॑वस्व॒ गवि॑ष्टये म॒हे सो॑म नृ॒चक्ष॑से एन्द्र॑स्य ज॒ठरे॑ विश
verses.transliteration: ā́ pavasva gáviṣṭaye  mahé soma nr̥cákṣase  éndrasya jaṭháre viśa

translation.text: Flow on, O Soma, for the great Viewer of men, for gain of Idne Enter thou into Indra's throat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हाँ अ॑सि सोम॒ ज्येष्ठ॑ उ॒ग्राणा॑मिन्द॒ ओजि॑ष्ठः युध्वा॒ सञ्छश्व॑ज्जिगेथ
verses.transliteration: mahā́m̐ asi soma jyéṣṭhaḥ-  ugrā́ṇām inda ójiṣṭhaḥ  yúdhvā sáñ cháśvaj jigetha

translation.text: Best art thou, Soma, of the great, Strongest of strong ones, Indu: thou As Warrior ever hast prevailed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य उ॒ग्रेभ्य॑श्चि॒दोजी॑या॒ञ्छूरे॑भ्यश्चि॒च्छूर॑तरः भू॒रि॒दाभ्य॑श्चि॒न्मंही॑यान्
verses.transliteration: yá ugrébhyaś cid ójīyāñ  -śū́rebhyaś cic chū́rataraḥ  bhūridā́bhyaś cin máṃhīyān

translation.text: Mightier even than the strong, more valiant even than the brave, More libpral than the bountiful,

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं सो॑म॒ सूर॒ एष॑स्तो॒कस्य॑ सा॒ता त॒नूना॑म् वृ॒णी॒महे॑ स॒ख्याय॑ वृणी॒महे॒ युज्या॑य
verses.transliteration: tváṃ soma sū́ra éṣas  tokásya sātā́ tanū́nām  vr̥ṇīmáhe sakhyā́ya  vr̥ṇīmáhe yújyāya

translation.text: Soma, as Sura, bring us food, win offspring of our bodies: we Elect thee for our friendship, we elect thee for companionship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्न॒ आयूं॑षि पवस॒ आ सु॒वोर्ज॒मिषं॑ च नः आ॒रे बा॑धस्व दु॒च्छुना॑म्
verses.transliteration: ágna ā́yūṃṣi pavase-  ā́ suvórjam íṣaṃ ca naḥ  āré bādhasva duchúnām

translation.text: Agni, thou pourest life; send down upon us food and vigorous strength; Drive thou misfortune far away,

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्ऋषिः॒ पव॑मानः॒ पाञ्च॑जन्यः पु॒रोहि॑तः तमी॑महे महाग॒यम्
verses.transliteration: agnír ŕ̥ṣiḥ pávamānaḥ  pā́ñcajanyaḥ puróhitaḥ  tám īmahe mahāgayám

translation.text: Agni is Pavamâna, Sage, Chief Priest of all the Races Five: To him whose wealth is great we pray.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ पव॑स्व॒ स्वपा॑ अ॒स्मे वर्चः॑ सु॒वीर्य॑म् दध॑द्र॒यिं मयि॒ पोष॑म्
verses.transliteration: ágne pávasva svápāḥ-  asmé várcaḥ suvī́ryam  dádhad rayím máyi póṣam

translation.text: Skilled in thy task, O Agni, pour splendour with hero strength on us, Granting me wealth that nourishes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑मानो॒ अति॒ स्रिधो॒ऽभ्य॑र्षति सुष्टु॒तिम् सूरो॒ न वि॒श्वद॑र्शतः
verses.transliteration: pávamāno áti srídho  -abhy àrṣati suṣṭutím  sū́ro ná viśvádarśataḥ

translation.text: Beyond his enemies away to sweet praise Pavamâna flows, Like Sûrya visible to all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स म॑र्मृजा॒न आ॒युभिः॒ प्रय॑स्वा॒न्प्रय॑से हि॒तः इन्दु॒रत्यो॑ विचक्ष॒णः
verses.transliteration: sá marmr̥jāná āyúbhir  práyasvān práyase hitáḥ  índur átyo vicakṣaṇáḥ

translation.text: Adorned by living men, set forth for entertainment, rich in food, Far-sighted Indu is a Steed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑मान ऋ॒तं बृ॒हच्छु॒क्रं ज्योति॑रजीजनत् कृ॒ष्णा तमां॑सि॒ जङ्घ॑नत्
verses.transliteration: pávamāna r̥tám br̥hác  -śukráṃ jyótir ajījanat  kr̥ṣṇā́ támāṃsi jáṅghanat

translation.text: He, Pavamâna, hath produced the lofty Law, the brilliant light, Destroying darkness black of hue.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑मानस्य॒ जङ्घ्न॑तो॒ हरे॑श्च॒न्द्रा अ॑सृक्षत जी॒रा अ॑जि॒रशो॑चिषः
verses.transliteration: pávamānasya jáṅghnato  háreś candrā́ asr̥kṣata  jīrā́ ajiráśociṣaḥ

translation.text: From tawny Pavamâna, the Destroyer, radiant streams have sprung, Quick streams from him whose gleams are swift.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑मानो र॒थीत॑मः शु॒भ्रेभिः॑ शु॒भ्रश॑स्तमः हरि॑श्चन्द्रो म॒रुद्ग॑णः
verses.transliteration: pávamāno rathī́tamaḥ  śubhrébhiḥ śubhráśastamaḥ  háriścandro marúdgaṇaḥ

translation.text: Best rider of the chariot, praised with fairest praise mid beauteous ones, Gold-gleaming with the Marut host,

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑मानो॒ व्य॑श्नवद्र॒श्मिभि॑र्वाज॒सात॑मः दध॑त्स्तो॒त्रे सु॒वीर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: pávamāno vy àśnavad  raśmíbhir vājasā́tamaḥ  dádhat stotré suvī́ryam

translation.text: May Pavamâna, best to win the booty, penetrate with rays, Giving the singer hero strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सु॑वा॒न इन्दु॑रक्षाः प॒वित्र॒मत्य॒व्यय॑म् पु॒ना॒न इन्दु॒रिन्द्र॒मा
verses.transliteration: prá suvāná índur akṣāḥ  pavítram áty avyáyam  punāná índur índram ā́

translation.text: Over the fleecy sieve hath flowed the drop effused: to Indra comes Indu while he is purified

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष सोमो॒ अधि॑ त्व॒चि गवां॑ क्रीळ॒त्यद्रि॑भिः इन्द्रं॒ मदा॑य॒ जोहु॑वत्
verses.transliteration: eṣá sómo ádhi tvací  gávāṃ krīḷaty ádribhiḥ  índram mádāya jóhuvat

translation.text: This Soma, through the pressing-stones, is sporting on the oxhide, and Summoning Indra to the draught.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ ते द्यु॒म्नव॒त्पयः॒ पव॑मा॒नाभृ॑तं दि॒वः तेन॑ नो मृळ जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yásya te dyumnávat páyaḥ  pávamānā́bhr̥taṃ diváḥ  téna no mr̥ḷa jīváse

translation.text: O Pavamâna, bless us, so that we may live, with that bright milk Of thine which hath been brought from heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं सो॑मासि धार॒युर्म॒न्द्र ओजि॑ष्ठो अध्व॒रे पव॑स्व मंह॒यद्र॑यिः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ somāsi dhārayúr  mandrá ójiṣṭho adhvaré  pávasva maṃhayádrayiḥ

translation.text: THOU, Soma, hast a running stream, joyous, most strong at sacrifice: Flow bounteously bestowing wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं सु॒तो नृ॒माद॑नो दध॒न्वान्म॑त्स॒रिन्त॑मः इन्द्रा॑य सू॒रिरन्ध॑सा
verses.transliteration: tváṃ sutó nr̥mā́dano  dadhanvā́n matsaríntamaḥ  índrāya sūrír ándhasā

translation.text: Effused as cheerer of the men, flowing best gladdener, thou art A Prince to Indra with thy juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं सु॑ष्वा॒णो अद्रि॑भिर॒भ्य॑र्ष॒ कनि॑क्रदत् द्यु॒मन्तं॒ शुष्म॑मुत्त॒मम्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ suṣvāṇó ádribhir  -abhy àrṣa kánikradat  dyumántaṃ śúṣmam uttamám

translation.text: Poured forth by pressing-stones, do thou with loud roar send us in a stream Most excellent illustrious might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्दु॑र्हिन्वा॒नो अ॑र्षति ति॒रो वारा॑ण्य॒व्यया॑ हरि॒र्वाज॑मचिक्रदत्
verses.transliteration: -índur hinvānó arṣati  tiró vā́rāṇy avyáyā  hárir vā́jam acikradat

translation.text: Indu, urged forward, floweth through the fleecy cloth: the Tawny One With his loud roar hath brought as strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्दो॒ व्यव्य॑मर्षसि॒ वि श्रवां॑सि॒ वि सौभ॑गा वि वाजा॑न्त्सोम॒ गोम॑तः
verses.transliteration: índo vy ávyam arṣasi  ví śrávāṃsi ví saúbhagā  ví vā́jān soma gómataḥ

translation.text: Indu, thou flowest through the fleece, bringing felicities and fame, And, Soma, spoil and wealth in kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ न॑ इन्दो शत॒ग्विनं॑ र॒यिं गोम॑न्तम॒श्विन॑म् भरा॑ सोम सह॒स्रिण॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ na indo śatagvínaṃ  rayíṃ gómantam aśvínam  bhárā soma sahasríṇam

translation.text: Hither, O Indu, bring us wealth in steeds and cattle hundredfold: Bring wealth, O Soma, thousandfold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑मानास॒ इन्द॑वस्ति॒रः प॒वित्र॑मा॒शवः॑ इन्द्रं॒ यामे॑भिराशत
verses.transliteration: pávamānāsa índavaḥ  tiráḥ pavítram āśávaḥ  índraṃ yā́mebhir āśata

translation.text: In purifying, through the sieve the rapid drops of'Soma juice Come nigh to Indra in their course.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒कु॒हः सो॒म्यो रस॒ इन्दु॒रिन्द्रा॑य पू॒र्व्यः आ॒युः प॑वत आ॒यवे॑
verses.transliteration: kakuháḥ somyó rásaḥ-  índur índrāya pūrvyáḥ  āyúḥ pavata āyáve

translation.text: For Indra floweth excellent Indu, the noblest Soma juice The Living for the Living One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒न्वन्ति॒ सूर॒मुस्र॑यः॒ पव॑मानं मधु॒श्चुत॑म् अ॒भि गि॒रा सम॑स्वरन्
verses.transliteration: hinvánti sū́ram úsrayaḥ  pávamānam madhuścútam  abhí girā́ sám asvaran

translation.text: The glittering maids send Sura forth they with their song have sung aloud To Pavamâna dropping meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वि॒ता नो॑ अ॒जाश्वः॑ पू॒षा याम॑नियामनि आ भ॑क्षत्क॒न्या॑सु नः
verses.transliteration: avitā́ no ajā́śvaḥ  pūṣā́ yā́mani-yāmani  ā́ bhakṣat kanyā̀su naḥ

translation.text: May Pûshan, drawn by goats, be our protector, and on all his paths Bestow on us our share of maids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं सोमः॑ कप॒र्दिने॑ घृ॒तं न प॑वते॒ मधु॑ आ भ॑क्षत्क॒न्या॑सु नः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ sómaḥ kapardíne  ghr̥táṃ ná pavate mádhu  ā́ bhakṣat kanyā̀su naḥ

translation.text: This Soma flows like gladdening oil for him who wears the braided locks: He shall give us our share of maids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं त॑ आघृणे सु॒तो घृ॒तं न प॑वते॒ शुचि॑ आ भ॑क्षत्क॒न्या॑सु नः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ ta āghr̥ṇe sutó  ghr̥táṃ ná pavate śúci  ā́ bhakṣat kanyā̀su naḥ

translation.text: This Soma juice, O glowing God, flows like pure oil, effused for thee: He shall give us our share of maids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒चो ज॒न्तुः क॑वी॒नां पव॑स्व सोम॒ धार॑या दे॒वेषु॑ रत्न॒धा अ॑सि
verses.transliteration: vācó jantúḥ kavīnā́m  pávasva soma dhā́rayā  devéṣu ratnadhā́ asi

translation.text: Flow onward, Soma, in thy stream, begetter of the sages' speech: Wealth-giver among Gods art thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ क॒लशे॑षु धावति श्ये॒नो वर्म॒ वि गा॑हते अ॒भि द्रोणा॒ कनि॑क्रदत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ kaláśeṣu dhāvati  śyenó várma ví gāhate  abhí dróṇā kánikradat

translation.text: The Falcon dips within the jars: he wrap.him in his robe and goes Loud roaring to the vats of wood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ प्र सो॑म ते॒ रसोऽस॑र्जि क॒लशे॑ सु॒तः श्ये॒नो न त॒क्तो अ॑र्षति
verses.transliteration: pári prá soma te rásaḥ-  -ásarji kaláśe sutáḥ  śyenó ná taktó arṣati

translation.text: Soma, thy juice hath been effused and poured into the pitcher: like A rapid hawk it rushes on.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व सोम म॒न्दय॒न्निन्द्रा॑य॒ मधु॑मत्तमः
verses.transliteration: pávasva soma mandáyann  índrāya mádhumattamaḥ

translation.text: For Indra flow most rich in sweets, O Soma, bringing him delight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असृ॑ग्रन्दे॒ववी॑तये वाज॒यन्तो॒ रथा॑ इव
verses.transliteration: ásr̥gran devávītaye-  vājayánto ráthā iva

translation.text: They were sent forth to feast the Gods, like chariots that display their strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते सु॒तासो॑ म॒दिन्त॑माः शु॒क्रा वा॒युम॑सृक्षत
verses.transliteration: té sutā́so madíntamāḥ  śukrā́ vāyúm asr̥kṣata

translation.text: Brilliant, best givers of delight, these juices have sent Vâyu forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग्राव्णा॑ तु॒न्नो अ॒भिष्टु॑तः प॒वित्रं॑ सोम गच्छसि दध॑त्स्तो॒त्रे सु॒वीर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: grā́vṇā tunnó abhíṣṭutaḥ  pavítraṃ soma gachasi  dádhat stotré suvī́ryam

translation.text: Bruised by the press-stones and extolled, Soma, thou goest to the sieve, Giving the worshipper hero strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष तु॒न्नो अ॒भिष्टु॑तः प॒वित्र॒मति॑ गाहते र॒क्षो॒हा वार॑म॒व्यय॑म्
verses.transliteration: eṣá tunnó abhíṣṭutaḥ  pavítram áti gāhate  rakṣohā́ vā́ram avyáyam

translation.text: This juice bruised by the pressing-stones and lauded passes through the sieve, Slayer of demons, through the fleece.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदन्ति॒ यच्च॑ दूर॒के भ॒यं वि॒न्दति॒ मामि॒ह पव॑मान॒ वि तज्ज॑हि
verses.transliteration: yád ánti yác ca dūraké  bhayáṃ vindáti mā́m ihá  pávamāna ví táj jahi

translation.text: O Pavamâna, drive away the danger, whether near at hand Or far remote, that finds me here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑मानः॒ सो अ॒द्य नः॑ प॒वित्रे॑ण॒ विच॑र्षणिः यः पो॒ता स पु॑नातु नः
verses.transliteration: pávamānaḥ só adyá naḥ  pavítreṇa vícarṣaṇiḥ  yáḥ potā́ sá punātu naḥ

translation.text: This day may Pavamâna cleanse us with his purifying power, Most active purifying Priest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॑ प॒वित्र॑म॒र्चिष्यग्ने॒ वित॑तम॒न्तरा ब्रह्म॒ तेन॑ पुनीहि नः
verses.transliteration: yát te pavítram arcíṣi-  ágne vítatam antár ā́  bráhma téna punīhi naḥ

translation.text: O Agni, with the cleansing light diffused through all thy fiery glow, Purify thou this prayer of ours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॑ प॒वित्र॑मर्चि॒वदग्ने॒ तेन॑ पुनीहि नः ब्र॒ह्म॒स॒वैः पु॑नीहि नः
verses.transliteration: yát te pavítram arcivád  ágne téna punīhi naḥ  brahmasavaíḥ punīhi naḥ

translation.text: Cleanse us with thine own cleansing power, O Agni, that is bright with flame, And by libations poured to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भाभ्यां॑ देव सवितः प॒वित्रे॑ण स॒वेन॑ च मां पु॑नीहि वि॒श्वतः॑
verses.transliteration: ubhā́bhyāṃ deva savitaḥ  pavítreṇa savéna ca  mā́m punīhi viśvátaḥ

translation.text: Savitar, God, by both of these, libation, purifying power, Purify me on every side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒भिष्ट्वं दे॑व सवित॒र्वर्षि॑ष्ठैः सोम॒ धाम॑भिः अग्ने॒ दक्षैः॑ पुनीहि नः
verses.transliteration: tribhíṣ ṭváṃ deva savitar  várṣiṣṭhaiḥ soma dhā́mabhiḥ  ágne dákṣaiḥ punīhi naḥ

translation.text: Cleanse us, God Savitar, with Three, O Soma, with sublimest forms, Agni, with forms of power and might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒नन्तु॒ मां दे॑वज॒नाः पु॒नन्तु॒ वस॑वो धि॒या विश्वे॑ देवाः पुनी॒त मा॒ जात॑वेदः पुनी॒हि मा॑
verses.transliteration: punántu mā́ṃ devajanā́ḥ  punántu vásavo dhiyā́  víśve devāḥ punītá mā  jā́tavedaḥ punīhí mā

translation.text: May the Gods' company make me clean, and Vasus make rue pure by song. Purify me, ye General Gods; O Jâtavedas, make me pure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र प्या॑यस्व॒ प्र स्य॑न्दस्व॒ सोम॒ विश्वे॑भिरं॒शुभिः॑ दे॒वेभ्य॑ उत्त॒मं ह॒विः
verses.transliteration: prá pyāyasva prá syandasva  sóma víśvebhir aṃśúbhiḥ  devébhya uttamáṃ havíḥ

translation.text: Fill thyself full of juice, flow forth, O Soma, thou with all thy stalks, The best oblation to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ प्रि॒यं पनि॑प्नतं॒ युवा॑नमाहुती॒वृध॑म् अग॑न्म॒ बिभ्र॑तो॒ नमः॑
verses.transliteration: úpa priyám pánipnataṃ  yúvānam āhutīvŕ̥dham  áganma bíbhrato námaḥ

translation.text: We with our homage have approached the Friend who seeks our wondering praise, Young, strengthener of the solemn rite.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒लाय्य॑स्य पर॒शुर्न॑नाश॒ तमा प॑वस्व देव सोम आ॒खुं चि॑दे॒व दे॑व सोम
verses.transliteration: alā́yyasya paraśúr nanāśa  tám ā́ pavasva deva soma  ākhúṃ cid evá deva soma

translation.text: Lost is Alâyya's axe. O Soma, God do thou send it back hither in thy flow Even, Soma, God, if 'twere a mole.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः पा॑वमा॒नीर॒ध्येत्यृषि॑भिः॒ सम्भृ॑तं॒ रस॑म् सर्वं॒ स पू॒तम॑श्नाति स्वदि॒तं मा॑त॒रिश्व॑ना
verses.transliteration: yáḥ pāvamānī́r adhyéti-  ŕ̥ṣibhiḥ sámbhr̥taṃ rásam  sárvaṃ sá pūtám aśnāti  svaditám mātaríśvanā

translation.text: The man who reads the essence stored by saints, the Pâvamânî hymns, Tastes food completely purified, made sweet by Mâtariṣvan's touch.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पा॒व॒मा॒नीर्यो अ॒ध्येत्यृषि॑भिः॒ सम्भृ॑तं॒ रस॑म् तस्मै॒ सर॑स्वती दुहे क्षी॒रं स॒र्पिर्मधू॑द॒कम्
verses.transliteration: pāvamānī́r yó adhyéti-  ŕ̥ṣibhiḥ sámbhr̥taṃ rásam  tásmai sárasvatī duhe  kṣīráṃ sarpír mádhūdakám

translation.text: Whoever reads the essence stored by saints, the Pâvamânî hymns, Sarasvatî draws forth for him water and butter, milk and meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र दे॒वमच्छा॒ मधु॑मन्त॒ इन्द॒वोऽसि॑ष्यदन्त॒ गाव॒ आ न धे॒नवः॑ ब॒र्हि॒षदो॑ वच॒नाव॑न्त॒ ऊध॑भिः परि॒स्रुत॑मु॒स्रिया॑ नि॒र्णिजं॑ धिरे
verses.transliteration: prá devám áchā mádhumanta índavaḥ-  -ásiṣyadanta gā́va ā́ ná dhenávaḥ  barhiṣádo vacanā́vanta ū́dhabhiḥ  parisrútam usríyā nirṇíjaṃ dhire

translation.text: THE drops of Soma juice like cows who yield their milk have flowed forth, rich in meath, unto the Shining One, And, seated on the grass, raising their voice, assumed the milk, the covering robe wherewith the udders stream.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स रोरु॑वद॒भि पूर्वा॑ अचिक्रददुपा॒रुहः॑ श्र॒थय॑न्त्स्वादते॒ हरिः॑ ति॒रः प॒वित्रं॑ परि॒यन्नु॒रु ज्रयो॒ नि शर्या॑णि दधते दे॒व आ वर॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá róruvad abhí pū́rvā acikradad  upārúhaḥ śratháyan svādate háriḥ  tiráḥ pavítram pariyánn urú jráyo  ní śáryāṇi dadhate devá ā́ váram

translation.text: He bellows with a roar arourd the highest twigs: the Tawny One is sweetened as he breaks them up. Then passing through the sieve into the ample room, the God throws off the dregs according to his wish.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि यो म॒मे य॒म्या॑ संय॒ती मदः॑ साकं॒वृधा॒ पय॑सा पिन्व॒दक्षि॑ता म॒ही अ॑पा॒रे रज॑सी वि॒वेवि॑ददभि॒व्रज॒न्नक्षि॑तं॒ पाज॒ आ द॑दे
verses.transliteration: ví yó mamé yamyā̀ saṃyatī́ mádaḥ  sākaṃvŕ̥dhā páyasā pinvad ákṣitā  mahī́ apāré rájasī vivévidad  abhivrájann ákṣitam pā́ja ā́ dade

translation.text: The gladdening drink that measured out the meeting Twins fills full with milk the Eternal Everwaxing Pair. Bringing to light the Two great Regions limitless, moving above them he gained sheen that never fades.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स मा॒तरा॑ वि॒चर॑न्वा॒जय॑न्न॒पः प्र मेधि॑रः स्व॒धया॑ पिन्वते प॒दम् अं॒शुर्यवे॑न पिपिशे य॒तो नृभिः॒ सं जा॒मिभि॒र्नस॑ते॒ रक्ष॑ते॒ शिरः॑
verses.transliteration: sá mātárā vicáran vājáyann apáḥ  prá médhiraḥ svadháyā pinvate padám  aṃśúr yávena pipiśe yató nŕ̥bhiḥ  sáṃ jāmíbhir násate rákṣate śíraḥ

translation.text: Wandering through, the Parents, strengthening the floods, the Sage makes his place swell with his own native might. The stalk is mixed with grain: he comes led by the men together with the sisters, and preserves the Head.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं दक्षे॑ण॒ मन॑सा जायते क॒विर्ऋ॒तस्य॒ गर्भो॒ निहि॑तो य॒मा प॒रः यूना॑ ह॒ सन्ता॑ प्रथ॒मं वि ज॑ज्ञतु॒र्गुहा॑ हि॒तं जनि॑म॒ नेम॒मुद्य॑तम्
verses.transliteration: sáṃ dákṣeṇa mánasā jāyate kavír  r̥tásya gárbho níhito yamā́ paráḥ  yū́nā ha sántā prathamáṃ ví jajñatur  gúhā hitáṃ jánima némam údyatam

translation.text: With energetic intellect the Sage is born, deposited as germ of Law, far from the Twins. They being young at first showed visibly distinct the Creature that is half-concealed and halfexposed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒न्द्रस्य॑ रू॒पं वि॑विदुर्मनी॒षिणः॑ श्ये॒नो यदन्धो॒ अभ॑रत्परा॒वतः॑ तं म॑र्जयन्त सु॒वृधं॑ न॒दीष्वाँ उ॒शन्त॑मं॒शुं प॑रि॒यन्त॑मृ॒ग्मिय॑म्
verses.transliteration: mandrásya rūpáṃ vividur manīṣíṇaḥ  śyenó yád ándho ábharat parāvátaḥ  tám marjayanta suvŕ̥dhaṃ nadī́ṣv ā́m̐  uśántam aṃśúm pariyántam r̥gmíyam

translation.text: The sages knew the form of him the Gladdener, what time the Falcon brought the plant from far away. Him who assures success they beautified in streams, the stalk who yearned therefor, mighty and meet for praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां मृ॑जन्ति॒ दश॒ योष॑णः सु॒तं सोम॒ ऋषि॑भिर्म॒तिभि॑र्धी॒तिभि॑र्हि॒तम् अव्यो॒ वारे॑भिरु॒त दे॒वहू॑तिभि॒र्नृभि॑र्य॒तो वाज॒मा द॑र्षि सा॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: tvā́m mr̥janti dáśa yóṣaṇaḥ sutáṃ  sóma ŕ̥ṣibhir matíbhir dhītíbhir hitám  ávyo vā́rebhir utá deváhūtibhir  nŕ̥bhir yató vā́jam ā́ darṣi sātáye

translation.text: Together with the R̥ishis, with their prayers and hymns ten women deck thee, Soma, friendly when effused. Led by the men, with invocations of the Gods, through the fleece, thou hast given us strength to win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रि॒प्र॒यन्तं॑ व॒य्यं॑ सुषं॒सदं॒ सोमं॑ मनी॒षा अ॒भ्य॑नूषत॒ स्तुभः॑ यो धार॑या॒ मधु॑माँ ऊ॒र्मिणा॑ दि॒व इय॑र्ति॒ वाचं॑ रयि॒षाळम॑र्त्यः
verses.transliteration: pariprayántaṃ vayyàṃ suṣaṃsádaṃ  sómam manīṣā́ abhy ànūṣata stúbhaḥ  yó dhā́rayā mádhumām̐ ūrmíṇā diváḥ-  íyarti vā́caṃ rayiṣā́ḷ ámartyaḥ

translation.text: Songs resonant with praise have celebrated him. Soma, Friend, springing forth with his fair company. Even him who rich in meath, with undulating stream, Winnner of Wealth, Immortal, sends his voice from heaven,

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं दि॒व इ॑यर्ति॒ विश्व॒मा रजः॒ सोमः॑ पुना॒नः क॒लशे॑षु सीदति अ॒द्भिर्गोभि॑र्मृज्यते॒ अद्रि॑भिः सु॒तः पु॑ना॒न इन्दु॒र्वरि॑वो विदत्प्रि॒यम्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ divá iyarti víśvam ā́ rájaḥ  sómaḥ punānáḥ kaláśeṣu sīdati  adbhír góbhir mr̥jyate ádribhiḥ sutáḥ  punāná índur várivo vidat priyám

translation.text: He sends it into all the region forth from heaven. Soma, while he is filtcred, settles in the jars. With milk and waters is he decked when pressed with stones: Indu, when purified, shall find sweet rest and room.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा नः॑ सोम परिषि॒च्यमा॑नो॒ वयो॒ दध॑च्चि॒त्रत॑मं पवस्व अ॒द्वे॒षे द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी हु॑वेम॒ देवा॑ ध॒त्त र॒यिम॒स्मे सु॒वीर॑म्
verses.transliteration: evā́ naḥ soma pariṣicyámāno  váyo dádhac citrátamam pavasva  adveṣé dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ huvema  dévā dhattá rayím asmé suvī́ram

translation.text: Even thus poured forth How on thy way, O Soma, vouchsafing us most manifold lively vigour. We will invoke benevolent Earth and Heaven. Give us, ye Gods, riches with noble heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इषु॒र्न धन्व॒न्प्रति॑ धीयते म॒तिर्व॒त्सो न मा॒तुरुप॑ स॒र्ज्यूध॑नि उ॒रुधा॑रेव दुहे॒ अग्र॑ आय॒त्यस्य॑ व्र॒तेष्वपि॒ सोम॑ इष्यते
verses.transliteration: íṣur ná dhánvan práti dhīyate matír  vatsó ná mātúr úpa sarjy ū́dhani  urúdhāreva duhe ágra āyatī́-  ásya vratéṣv ápi sóma iṣyate

translation.text: LAID like an arrow on the bow the hymn hath been loosed like a young calf to the udder of its dam. As one who cometh first with full stream she is milked the Soma is impelled to this man's holy rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपो॑ म॒तिः पृ॒च्यते॑ सि॒च्यते॒ मधु॑ म॒न्द्राज॑नी चोदते अ॒न्तरा॒सनि॑ पव॑मानः संत॒निः प्र॑घ्न॒तामि॑व॒ मधु॑मान्द्र॒प्सः परि॒ वार॑मर्षति
verses.transliteration: úpo matíḥ pr̥cyáte sicyáte mádhu  mandrā́janī codate antár āsáni  pávamānaḥ saṃtaníḥ praghnatā́m iva  mádhumān drapsáḥ pári vā́ram arṣati

translation.text: The thought is deeply fixed; the savoury juice is shed; the tongue with joyous sound is stirring in the mouth; And Pavamâna, like the shout of combatants, the drop rising in sweet juice, is flowing through the fleece.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव्ये॑ वधू॒युः प॑वते॒ परि॑ त्व॒चि श्र॑थ्नी॒ते न॒प्तीरदि॑तेर्ऋ॒तं य॒ते हरि॑रक्रान्यज॒तः सं॑य॒तो मदो॑ नृ॒म्णा शिशा॑नो महि॒षो न शो॑भते
verses.transliteration: ávye vadhūyúḥ pavate pári tvací  śrathnīté naptī́r áditer r̥táṃ yaté  hárir akrān yajatáḥ saṃyató mádo  nr̥mṇā́ śíśāno mahiṣó ná śobhate

translation.text: He flows about the sheep-skin, longing for a bride: he looses Aditi's Daughters for the worshipper. The sacred drink hath come, gold-tinted, well-restrained: like a strong Bull he shines, whetting his manly might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्षा मि॑माति॒ प्रति॑ यन्ति धे॒नवो॑ दे॒वस्य॑ दे॒वीरुप॑ यन्ति निष्कृ॒तम् अत्य॑क्रमी॒दर्जु॑नं॒ वार॑म॒व्यय॒मत्कं॒ न नि॒क्तं परि॒ सोमो॑ अव्यत
verses.transliteration: ukṣā́ mimāti práti yanti dhenávo  devásya devī́r úpa yanti niṣkr̥tám  áty akramīd árjunaṃ vā́ram avyáyam  átkaṃ ná niktám pári sómo avyata

translation.text: The Bull is bellowing; the Cows are coming nigh: the Goddesses approach the God's own restingplace. Onward hath Soma passed through the sheep's fair bright fleece, and hath, as 'twere, endued a garment newly washed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अमृ॑क्तेन॒ रुश॑ता॒ वास॑सा॒ हरि॒रम॑र्त्यो निर्णिजा॒नः परि॑ व्यत दि॒वस्पृ॒ष्ठं ब॒र्हणा॑ नि॒र्णिजे॑ कृतोप॒स्तर॑णं च॒म्वो॑र्नभ॒स्मय॑म्
verses.transliteration: ámr̥ktena rúśatā vā́sasā hárir  ámartyo nirṇijānáḥ pári vyata  divás pr̥ṣṭhám barháṇā nirṇíje kr̥ta-  -upastáraṇaṃ camvòr nabhasmáyam

translation.text: The golden-hued, Immortal, newly bathed, puts on a brightly shining vesture that is never harmed. He made the ridge of heaven to be his radiant robe, by sprinkling of the bowls from moisture of the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सूर्य॑स्येव र॒श्मयो॑ द्रावयि॒त्नवो॑ मत्स॒रासः॑ प्र॒सुपः॑ सा॒कमी॑रते तन्तुं॑ त॒तं परि॒ सर्गा॑स आ॒शवो॒ नेन्द्रा॑दृ॒ते प॑वते॒ धाम॒ किं च॒न
verses.transliteration: sū́ryasyeva raśmáyo drāvayitnávo  matsarā́saḥ prasúpaḥ sākám īrate  tántuṃ tatám pári sárgāsa āśávo  néndrād r̥té pavate dhā́ma kíṃ caná

translation.text: Even as the beams of Sûrya, urging men to speed, that cheer and send to sleep, together rush they forth, These swift outpourings in long course of holy rites: no form save only Indra shows itself so pure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सिन्धो॑रिव प्रव॒णे नि॒म्न आ॒शवो॒ वृष॑च्युता॒ मदा॑सो गा॒तुमा॑शत शं नो॑ निवे॒शे द्वि॒पदे॒ चतु॑ष्पदे॒ऽस्मे वाजाः॑ सोम तिष्ठन्तु कृ॒ष्टयः॑
verses.transliteration: síndhor iva pravaṇé nimná āśávo  vŕ̥ṣacyutā mádāso gātúm āśata  śáṃ no niveśé dvipáde cátuṣpade  -asmé vā́jāḥ soma tiṣṭhantu kr̥ṣṭáyaḥ

translation.text: As down the steep slope of a river to the vale, drawn from the Steer the swift strong draughts have found a way. Well be it with the men and cattle in our home. May powers, O Soma, may the people stay with us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नः॑ पवस्व॒ वसु॑म॒द्धिर॑ण्यव॒दश्वा॑व॒द्गोम॒द्यव॑मत्सु॒वीर्य॑म् यू॒यं हि सो॑म पि॒तरो॒ मम॒ स्थन॑ दि॒वो मू॒र्धानः॒ प्रस्थि॑ता वय॒स्कृतः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ naḥ pavasva vásumad dhíraṇyavad  áśvāvad gómad yávamat suvī́ryam  yūyáṃ hí soma pitáro máma sthána  divó mūrdhā́naḥ prásthitā vayaskŕ̥taḥ

translation.text: Pour out upon us wealth in goods, in gold, in steeds, in cattle and in corn, and great heroic strength. Ye, Soma, are my Fathers, lifted up on high as heads of heaven and makers of the strength of life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते सोमाः॒ पव॑मानास॒ इन्द्रं॒ रथा॑ इव॒ प्र य॑युः सा॒तिमच्छ॑ सु॒ताः प॒वित्र॒मति॑ य॒न्त्यव्यं॑ हि॒त्वी व॒व्रिं ह॒रितो॑ वृ॒ष्टिमच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: eté sómāḥ pávamānāsa índraṃ  ráthā iva prá yayuḥ sātím ácha  sutā́ḥ pavítram áti yanty ávyaṃ  hitvī́ vavríṃ haríto vr̥ṣṭím ácha

translation.text: These Pavamânas here, these drops of Soma, to Indra have sped forth like cars to booty. Effused, they pass the cleansing fleece, while, gold-hued, they cast their covering off to pour the rain down.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द॒विन्द्रा॑य बृह॒ते प॑वस्व सुमृळी॒को अ॑नव॒द्यो रि॒शादाः॑ भरा॑ च॒न्द्राणि॑ गृण॒ते वसू॑नि दे॒वैर्द्या॑वापृथिवी॒ प्राव॑तं नः
verses.transliteration: índav índrāya br̥haté pavasva  sumr̥ḷīkó anavadyó riśā́dāḥ  bhárā candrā́ṇi gr̥ṇaté vásūni  devaír dyāvāpr̥thivī prā́vataṃ naḥ

translation.text: O Indu, flow thou on for lofty Indra, flow blameless, very gracious, foe-destroyer. Bring splendid treasures to the man who lauds thee. O Heaven and Earth, with all the Gods protect. us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिर॑स्मै स॒प्त धे॒नवो॑ दुदुह्रे स॒त्यामा॒शिरं॑ पू॒र्व्ये व्यो॑मनि च॒त्वार्य॒न्या भुव॑नानि नि॒र्णिजे॒ चारू॑णि चक्रे॒ यदृ॒तैरव॑र्धत
verses.transliteration: trír asmai saptá dhenávo duduhre  satyā́m āśíram pūrvyé vyòmani  catvā́ry anyā́ bhúvanāni nirṇíje  cā́rūṇi cakre yád r̥taír ávardhata

translation.text: THE three times seven Milch-kine in the eastern heaven have for this Soma poured the genuine milky draught. Four other beauteous Creatures hath he made for his adornment, when he waxed in strength through holy rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स भिक्ष॑माणो अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ चारु॑ण उ॒भे द्यावा॒ काव्ये॑ना॒ वि श॑श्रथे तेजि॑ष्ठा अ॒पो मं॒हना॒ परि॑ व्यत॒ यदी॑ दे॒वस्य॒ श्रव॑सा॒ सदो॑ वि॒दुः
verses.transliteration: sá bhíkṣamāṇo amŕ̥tasya cā́ruṇaḥ-  ubhé dyā́vā kā́vyenā ví śaśrathe  téjiṣṭhā apó maṃhánā pári vyata  yádī devásya śrávasā sádo vidúḥ

translation.text: Longing for lovely Amrit, by his wisdom he divided, each apart from other, earth and heaven. He gladly wrapped himself in the most lucid floods, when through their glory they found the God's resting-place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते अ॑स्य सन्तु के॒तवोऽमृ॑त्य॒वोऽदा॑भ्यासो ज॒नुषी॑ उ॒भे अनु॑ येभि॑र्नृ॒म्णा च॑ दे॒व्या॑ च पुन॒त आदिद्राजा॑नं म॒नना॑ अगृभ्णत
verses.transliteration: té asya santu ketávó 'mr̥tyavaḥ-  -ádābhyāso janúṣī ubhé ánu  yébhir nr̥mṇā́ ca devyā̀ ca punaté-  ā́d íd rā́jānam manánā agr̥bhṇata

translation.text: May those his brilliant rays he ever free from death, inviolate, for both classes of created things,– Rays wherewith powers of men and Gods are purified. Yea, even for this have sageswelcomed him as King.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स मृ॒ज्यमा॑नो द॒शभिः॑ सु॒कर्म॑भिः॒ प्र म॑ध्य॒मासु॑ मा॒तृषु॑ प्र॒मे सचा॑ व्र॒तानि॑ पा॒नो अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ चारु॑ण उ॒भे नृ॒चक्षा॒ अनु॑ पश्यते॒ विशौ॑
verses.transliteration: sá mr̥jyámāno daśábhiḥ sukármabhiḥ  prá madhyamā́su mātŕ̥ṣu pramé sácā  vratā́ni pānó amŕ̥tasya cā́ruṇaḥ-  ubhé nr̥cákṣā ánu paśyate víśau

translation.text: He, while he is adorned by the ten skilful ones, that he too in the Midmost Mothers may create, While he is watching o'er the lovely Amrit's ways, looks on both races as Beholder of mankind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स म॑र्मृजा॒न इ॑न्द्रि॒याय॒ धाय॑स॒ ओभे अ॒न्ता रोद॑सी हर्षते हि॒तः वृषा॒ शुष्मे॑ण बाधते॒ वि दु॑र्म॒तीरा॒देदि॑शानः शर्य॒हेव॑ शु॒रुधः॑
verses.transliteration: sá marmr̥jāná indriyā́ya dhā́yase-  óbhé antā́ ródasī harṣate hitáḥ  vŕ̥ṣā śúṣmeṇa bādhate ví durmatī́r  ādédiśānaḥ śaryahéva śurúdhaḥ

translation.text: He, while he is adorned to stream forth mighty strength, rejoices in his place between the earth and heaven. The Steer dispels the evil-hearted with his might, aiming at offerings as an archer at the game.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स मा॒तरा॒ न ददृ॑शान उ॒स्रियो॒ नान॑ददेति म॒रुता॑मिव स्व॒नः जा॒नन्नृ॒तं प्र॑थ॒मं यत्स्व॑र्णरं॒ प्रश॑स्तये॒ कम॑वृणीत सु॒क्रतुः॑
verses.transliteration: sá mātárā ná dádr̥śāna usríyo  nā́nadad eti marútām iva svanáḥ  jānánn r̥tám prathamáṃ yát svàrṇaram  práśastaye kám avr̥ṇīta sukrátuḥ

translation.text: Beholding, as it were, Two Mother Cows, the Steer goes roaring on his way even as the Maruts roar. Knowing Eternal Law, the earliest light of heaven, he, passing wise, was chosen out to tell it forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रु॒वति॑ भी॒मो वृ॑ष॒भस्त॑वि॒ष्यया॒ शृङ्गे॒ शिशा॑नो॒ हरि॑णी विचक्ष॒णः आ योनिं॒ सोमः॒ सुकृ॑तं॒ नि षी॑दति ग॒व्ययी॒ त्वग्भ॑वति नि॒र्णिग॒व्ययी॑
verses.transliteration: ruváti bhīmó vr̥ṣabhás taviṣyáyā  śŕ̥ṅge śíśāno háriṇī vicakṣaṇáḥ  ā́ yóniṃ sómaḥ súkr̥taṃ ní ṣīdati  gavyáyī tvág bhavati nirṇíg avyáyī

translation.text: The fearful Bull is bellowing with violent might, far-sighted, sharpening his yellowcoloured horns. Soma assumes his seat in the well-fashioned place: the cowhide and the sheepskin are his ornament.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुचिः॑ पुना॒नस्त॒न्व॑मरे॒पस॒मव्ये॒ हरि॒र्न्य॑धाविष्ट॒ सान॑वि जुष्टो॑ मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णाय वा॒यवे॑ त्रि॒धातु॒ मधु॑ क्रियते सु॒कर्म॑भिः
verses.transliteration: śúciḥ punānás tanvàm arepásam  ávye hárir ny àdhāviṣṭa sā́navi  júṣṭo mitrā́ya váruṇāya vāyáve  tridhā́tu mádhu kriyate sukármabhiḥ

translation.text: Bright, making pure his body free from spot and stain, on the sheep's back the Golden-coloured hath flowed down. Acceptable to Mitra, Vâyu, Varuṇa, he is prepared as threefold meal by skilful men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व सोम दे॒ववी॑तये॒ वृषेन्द्र॑स्य॒ हार्दि॑ सोम॒धान॒मा वि॑श पु॒रा नो॑ बा॒धाद्दु॑रि॒ताति॑ पारय क्षेत्र॒विद्धि दिश॒ आहा॑ विपृच्छ॒ते
verses.transliteration: pávasva soma devávītaye vŕ̥ṣā-  -índrasya hā́rdi somadhā́nam ā́ viśa  purā́ no bādhā́d duritā́ti pāraya  kṣetravíd dhí díśa ā́hā vipr̥chaté

translation.text: Flow on for the God's banquet, Soma, as a Steer, and enter Indra's heart, the Soma's reservoir. Bear us beyond misfortune ere we be oppres. sed. the man who knows the land directs the man who asks.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒तो न सप्ति॑र॒भि वाज॑म॒र्षेन्द्र॑स्येन्दो ज॒ठर॒मा प॑वस्व ना॒वा न सिन्धु॒मति॑ पर्षि वि॒द्वाञ्छूरो॒ न युध्य॒न्नव॑ नो नि॒दः स्पः॑
verses.transliteration: hitó ná sáptir abhí vā́jam arṣa-  -índrasyendo jaṭháram ā́ pavasva  nāvā́ ná síndhum áti parṣi vidvā́ñ  -śū́ro ná yúdhyann áva no nidá spaḥ

translation.text: Urged like a car-steed flow to strength, O Soma: Indu, flow onward to the throat of Indra. Skilled, bear us past, as in a boat o'er water: as battling Hero save us from the foeman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ दक्षि॑णा सृज्यते शु॒ष्म्या॒३॒॑सदं॒ वेति॑ द्रु॒हो र॒क्षसः॑ पाति॒ जागृ॑विः हरि॑रोप॒शं कृ॑णुते॒ नभ॒स्पय॑ उप॒स्तिरे॑ च॒म्वो॒३॒॑र्ब्रह्म॑ नि॒र्णिजे॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ dákṣiṇā sr̥jyate śuṣmy ā̀sádaṃ  véti druhó rakṣásaḥ pāti jā́gr̥viḥ  hárir opaśáṃ kr̥ṇute nábhas páyaḥ-  upastíre camvòr bráhma nirṇíje

translation.text: THE guerdon is bestowed: the Mighty takes his Seat, and, ever-Watchful, guards from fiend and evil sprite. Gold-hued, he makes the cloud his diadem, the milk his carpet in both worlds, and prayer his robe of state.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र कृ॑ष्टि॒हेव॑ शू॒ष ए॑ति॒ रोरु॑वदसु॒र्यं१॒॑ वर्णं॒ नि रि॑णीते अस्य॒ तम् जहा॑ति व॒व्रिं पि॒तुरे॑ति निष्कृ॒तमु॑प॒प्रुतं॑ कृणुते नि॒र्णिजं॒ तना॑
verses.transliteration: prá kr̥ṣṭihéva śūṣá eti róruvad  asuryàṃ várṇaṃ ní riṇīte asya tám  jáhāti vavrím pitúr eti niṣkr̥tám  upaprútaṃ kr̥ṇute nirṇíjaṃ tánā

translation.text: Strong, bellowing, he goes, like one who slays the folk; he lets this hue of Asuras flow off from him, Throws off his covering, seeks his father's meeting-place, and thus makes for himself the bright robe he assumes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अद्रि॑भिः सु॒तः प॑वते॒ गभ॑स्त्योर्वृषा॒यते॒ नभ॑सा॒ वेप॑ते म॒ती स मो॑दते॒ नस॑ते॒ साध॑ते गि॒रा ने॑नि॒क्ते अ॒प्सु यज॑ते॒ परी॑मणि
verses.transliteration: ádribhiḥ sutáḥ pavate gábhastyor  vr̥ṣāyáte nábhasā vépate matī́  sá modate násate sā́dhate girā́  nenikté apsú yájate párīmaṇi

translation.text: Onward he flows, from both the hands, pressed out with stones: excited by the prayer, the water makes him wild. He frolics and draws near, completes his work with song, and bathes in streams to satisfy the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ द्यु॒क्षं सह॑सः पर्वता॒वृधं॒ मध्वः॑ सिञ्चन्ति ह॒र्म्यस्य॑ स॒क्षणि॑म् आ यस्मि॒न्गावः॑ सुहु॒ताद॒ ऊध॑नि मू॒र्धञ्छ्री॒णन्त्य॑ग्रि॒यं वरी॑मभिः
verses.transliteration: pári dyukṣáṃ sáhasaḥ parvatāvŕ̥dham  mádhvaḥ siñcanti harmyásya sakṣáṇim  ā́ yásmin gā́vaḥ suhutā́da ū́dhani  mūrdháñ chrīṇánty agriyáṃ várīmabhiḥ

translation.text: They pour out meath around the Master of the house, Celestial Strengthener of the mountain that gives might; In whom, through his great powers, oblation-eating cows in their uplifted udder mix their choicest milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समी॒ रथं॒ न भु॒रिजो॑रहेषत॒ दश॒ स्वसा॑रो॒ अदि॑तेरु॒पस्थ॒ आ जिगा॒दुप॑ ज्रयति॒ गोर॑पी॒च्यं॑ प॒दं यद॑स्य म॒तुथा॒ अजी॑जनन्
verses.transliteration: sám ī ráthaṃ ná bhuríjor aheṣata  dáśa svásāro áditer upástha ā́  jígād úpa jrayati gór apīcyàm  padáṃ yád asya matúthā ájījanan

translation.text: They, the ten sisters, on the lap of Aditi, have sent him forward like a car from both the arms. He wanders and comes near the Cow's mysterious place, even the place which his inventions have produced.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्ये॒नो न योनिं॒ सद॑नं धि॒या कृ॒तं हि॑र॒ण्यय॑मा॒सदं॑ दे॒व एष॑ति ए रि॑णन्ति ब॒र्हिषि॑ प्रि॒यं गि॒राश्वो॒ न दे॒वाँ अप्ये॑ति य॒ज्ञियः॑
verses.transliteration: śyenó ná yóniṃ sádanaṃ dhiyā́ kr̥táṃ  hiraṇyáyam āsádaṃ devá éṣati  é riṇanti barhíṣi priyáṃ girā́-  -áśvo ná devā́m̐ ápy eti yajñíyaḥ

translation.text: Like as a falcon to his home, so speeds the God to his own golden wisely-tashioned place to rest. With song they urge the darling to the sacred grass: the Holy One goes like a courser to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॒ व्य॑क्तो अरु॒षो दि॒वः क॒विर्वृषा॑ त्रिपृ॒ष्ठो अ॑नविष्ट॒ गा अ॒भि स॒हस्र॑णीति॒र्यतिः॑ परा॒यती॑ रे॒भो न पू॒र्वीरु॒षसो॒ वि रा॑जति
verses.transliteration: párā vyàkto aruṣó diváḥ kavír  vŕ̥ṣā tripr̥ṣṭhó anaviṣṭa gā́ abhí  sahásraṇītir yátiḥ parāyátiḥ-  rebhó ná pūrvī́r uṣáso ví rājati

translation.text: From far away, from heaven, the redhued noted Sage, Steer of the triple height, hath sung unto the kine. With thousand guidings he, leading this way and that, shines, as a singer, splendidly through many a morn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे॒षं रू॒पं कृ॑णुते॒ वर्णो॑ अस्य॒ स यत्राश॑य॒त्समृ॑ता॒ सेध॑ति स्रि॒धः अ॒प्सा या॑ति स्व॒धया॒ दैव्यं॒ जनं॒ सं सु॑ष्टु॒ती नस॑ते॒ सं गोअ॑ग्रया
verses.transliteration: tveṣáṃ rūpáṃ kr̥ṇute várṇo asya sá  yátrā́śayat sámr̥tā sédhati sridháḥ  apsā́ yāti svadháyā daívyaṃ jánaṃ  sáṃ suṣṭutī́ násate sáṃ góagrayā

translation.text: His covering assumes a radiant hue; where'er he comes into the fight he drives the foe afar. The Winner of the Floods, with food he seeks the host of heaven, he comes to praises glorified with milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्षेव॑ यू॒था प॑रि॒यन्न॑रावी॒दधि॒ त्विषी॑रधित॒ सूर्य॑स्य दि॒व्यः सु॑प॒र्णोऽव॑ चक्षत॒ क्षां सोमः॒ परि॒ क्रतु॑ना पश्यते॒ जाः
verses.transliteration: ukṣéva yūthā́ pariyánn arāvīd  ádhi tvíṣīr adhita sū́ryasya  divyáḥ suparṇó 'va cakṣata kṣā́ṃ  sómaḥ pári krátunā paśyate jā́ḥ

translation.text: Like a bull roaming round the herds he bellows: he hath assumed the brilliancy of Sûrya. Down to the earth hath looked the heavenly Falcon: Soma with wisdom views all living creatures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हरिं॑ मृजन्त्यरु॒षो न यु॑ज्यते॒ सं धे॒नुभिः॑ क॒लशे॒ सोमो॑ अज्यते उद्वाच॑मी॒रय॑ति हि॒न्वते॑ म॒ती पु॑रुष्टु॒तस्य॒ कति॑ चित्परि॒प्रियः॑
verses.transliteration: hárim mr̥janty aruṣó ná yujyate  sáṃ dhenúbhiḥ kaláśe sómo ajyate  úd vā́cam īráyati hinváte matī́  puruṣṭutásya káti cit paripríyaḥ

translation.text: THEY cleanse the Gold-hued: like a red Steed is he yoked, and Soma in the jar is mingled with the milk. He sendeth out his voice, and many loving friends of him the highly lauded hasten with their songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒कं व॑दन्ति ब॒हवो॑ मनी॒षिण॒ इन्द्र॑स्य॒ सोमं॑ ज॒ठरे॒ यदा॑दु॒हुः यदी॑ मृ॒जन्ति॒ सुग॑भस्तयो॒ नरः॒ सनी॑ळाभिर्द॒शभिः॒ काम्यं॒ मधु॑
verses.transliteration: sākáṃ vadanti bahávo manīṣíṇaḥ-  índrasya sómaṃ jaṭháre yád āduhúḥ  yádī mr̥jánti súgabhastayo náraḥ  sánīḷābhir daśábhiḥ kā́myam mádhu

translation.text: The many sages utter words in unison, while into Indra's throat they pour the Soma juice, When, with the ten that dwell together closely joined, the men whose hands are skilful cleanse the lovely meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर॑ममाणो॒ अत्ये॑ति॒ गा अ॒भि सूर्य॑स्य प्रि॒यं दु॑हि॒तुस्ति॒रो रव॑म् अन्व॑स्मै॒ जोष॑मभरद्विनंगृ॒सः सं द्व॒यीभिः॒ स्वसृ॑भिः क्षेति जा॒मिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: áramamāṇo áty eti gā́ abhí  sū́ryasya priyáṃ duhitús tiró rávam  ánv asmai jóṣam abharad vinaṃgr̥sáḥ  sáṃ dvayī́bhiḥ svásr̥bhiḥ kṣeti jāmíbhiḥ

translation.text: He goes upon his way, unresting, to the cows, over the roaring sound which Sarya's Daughter loves. The Falcon brought it to him for his own delight: now with the twofold kindred sisters is his home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नृधू॑तो॒ अद्रि॑षुतो ब॒र्हिषि॑ प्रि॒यः पति॒र्गवां॑ प्र॒दिव॒ इन्दु॑र्ऋ॒त्वियः॑ पुरं॑धिवा॒न्मनु॑षो यज्ञ॒साध॑नः॒ शुचि॑र्धि॒या प॑वते॒ सोम॑ इन्द्र ते
verses.transliteration: nŕ̥dhūto ádriṣuto barhíṣi priyáḥ  pátir gávām pradíva índur r̥tvíyaḥ  púraṃdhivān mánuṣo yajñasā́dhanaḥ  śúcir dhiyā́ pavate sóma indra te

translation.text: Washed by the men, stone-pressed, dear on the holy grass, faithful to seasons, Lord of cattle from of old, Most liberal, completing sacrifice for men, O Indra, pure bright Soma, Indu, flows for thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नृबा॒हुभ्यां॑ चोदि॒तो धार॑या सु॒तो॑ऽनुष्व॒धं प॑वते॒ सोम॑ इन्द्र ते आप्राः॒ क्रतू॒न्त्सम॑जैरध्व॒रे म॒तीर्वेर्न द्रु॒षच्च॒म्वो॒३॒॑रास॑द॒द्धरिः॑
verses.transliteration: nŕ̥bāhúbhyāṃ coditó dhā́rayā sutáḥ-  -ánuṣvadhám pavate sóma indra te  ā́prāḥ krátūn sám ajair adhvaré matī́r  vér ná druṣác camvòr ā́sadad dháriḥ

translation.text: O Indra, urged by arms of men and poured in streams, Soma flows on for thee after.his Godlike kind. Plans thou fulfillest, gatherest thoughts for sacrifice: in the bowls sits the Gold-hued like a roosting bird.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अं॒शुं दु॑हन्ति स्त॒नय॑न्त॒मक्षि॑तं क॒विं क॒वयो॒ऽपसो॑ मनी॒षिणः॑ समी॒ गावो॑ म॒तयो॑ यन्ति सं॒यत॑ ऋ॒तस्य॒ योना॒ सद॑ने पुन॒र्भुवः॑
verses.transliteration: aṃśúṃ duhanti stanáyantam ákṣitaṃ  kavíṃ kaváyo 'páso manīṣíṇaḥ  sám ī gā́vo matáyo yanti saṃyátaḥ-  r̥tásya yónā sádane punarbhúvaḥ

translation.text: Sages well-skilled in work, intelligent, drain out the stalk that roars, the Sage, the Everlasting One. The milk, the hymns unite them with him in the place of sacrifice, his seat who is produced anew.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्या ध॒रुणो॑ म॒हो दि॒वो॒३॒॑ऽपामू॒र्मौ सिन्धु॑ष्व॒न्तरु॑क्षि॒तः इन्द्र॑स्य॒ वज्रो॑ वृष॒भो वि॒भूव॑सुः॒ सोमो॑ हृ॒दे प॑वते॒ चारु॑ मत्स॒रः
verses.transliteration: nā́bhā pr̥thivyā́ dharúṇo mahó diváḥ-  -apā́m ūrmaú síndhuṣv antár ukṣitáḥ  índrasya vájro vr̥ṣabhó vibhū́vasuḥ  sómo hr̥dé pavate cā́ru matsaráḥ

translation.text: Earth's central point, sustainer of the mighty heavens, distilled into the streams, into the waters' wave, As Indra's thunderbolt, Steer with farspreading wealth, Soma is flowing on to make the heart rejoice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स तू प॑वस्व॒ परि॒ पार्थि॑वं॒ रजः॑ स्तो॒त्रे शिक्ष॑न्नाधून्व॒ते च॑ सुक्रतो मा नो॒ निर्भा॒ग्वसु॑नः सादन॒स्पृशो॑ र॒यिं पि॒शङ्गं॑ बहु॒लं व॑सीमहि
verses.transliteration: sá tū́ pavasva pári pā́rthivaṃ rájaḥ-  stotré śíkṣann ādhūnvaté ca sukrato  mā́ no nír bhāg vásunaḥ sādanaspŕ̥śo  rayím piśáṅgam bahuláṃ vasīmahi

translation.text: Over the earthly region flow thou on thy way, helping the praiser and the pourer, thou Most Wise. Let us not lack rich treasure reaching to our home, and may we clothe ourselves in manifold bright wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ तू न॑ इन्दो श॒तदा॒त्वश्व्यं॑ स॒हस्र॑दातु पशु॒मद्धिर॑ण्यवत् उप॑ मास्व बृह॒ती रे॒वती॒रिषोऽधि॑ स्तो॒त्रस्य॑ पवमान नो गहि
verses.transliteration: ā́ tū́ na indo śatádātv áśvyaṃ  sahásradātu paśumád dhíraṇyavat  úpa māsva br̥hatī́ revátīr íṣaḥ-  -ádhi stotrásya pavamāna no gahi

translation.text: Hither, O Indu, unto us a hundred gifts of steeds, a thousand gifts of cattle and of gold, Measure thou forth, yea, splendid ample strengthening food do thou, O Pavamâna, heed this laud of ours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्रक्वे॑ द्र॒प्सस्य॒ धम॑तः॒ सम॑स्वरन्नृ॒तस्य॒ योना॒ सम॑रन्त॒ नाभ॑यः त्रीन्त्स मू॒र्ध्नो असु॑रश्चक्र आ॒रभे॑ स॒त्यस्य॒ नावः॑ सु॒कृत॑मपीपरन्
verses.transliteration: srákve drapsásya dhámataḥ sám asvarann  r̥tásya yónā sám aranta nā́bhayaḥ  trī́n sá mūrdhnó ásuraś cakra ārábhe  satyásya nā́vaḥ sukŕ̥tam apīparan

translation.text: THEY from the spouting drop have sounded at the rim: naves speed together to the place of sacrifice. That Asura hath formed, to seize, three lofty heights. The ships of truth have borne the pious man across.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒म्यक्स॒म्यञ्चो॑ महि॒षा अ॑हेषत॒ सिन्धो॑रू॒र्मावधि॑ वे॒ना अ॑वीविपन् मधो॒र्धारा॑भिर्ज॒नय॑न्तो अ॒र्कमित्प्रि॒यामिन्द्र॑स्य त॒न्व॑मवीवृधन्
verses.transliteration: samyák samyáñco mahiṣā́ aheṣata  síndhor ūrmā́v ádhi venā́ avīvipan  mádhor dhā́rābhir janáyanto arkám ít  priyā́m índrasya tanvàm avīvr̥dhan

translation.text: The strong Steers, gathering, have duly stirred themselves,and over the stream's wave the friends sent forth the song. Engendering the hymn, with flowing streams of meath, Indra's dear body have they caused to wax in strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒वित्र॑वन्तः॒ परि॒ वाच॑मासते पि॒तैषां॑ प्र॒त्नो अ॒भि र॑क्षति व्र॒तम् म॒हः स॑मु॒द्रं वरु॑णस्ति॒रो द॑धे॒ धीरा॒ इच्छे॑कुर्ध॒रुणे॑ष्वा॒रभ॑म्
verses.transliteration: pavítravantaḥ pári vā́cam āsate  pitaíṣām pratnó abhí rakṣati vratám  maháḥ samudráṃ váruṇas tiró dadhe  dhī́rā íc chekur dharúṇeṣv ārábham

translation.text: With sanctifying gear they sit around the song: their ancient Father guards their holy work from harm. Varuṇa hath o'erspread the mighty sea of air. Sages had power to hold him in sustaining floods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्र॑धा॒रेऽव॒ ते सम॑स्वरन्दि॒वो नाके॒ मधु॑जिह्वा अस॒श्चतः॑ अस्य॒ स्पशो॒ न नि मि॑षन्ति॒ भूर्ण॑यः प॒देप॑दे पा॒शिनः॑ सन्ति॒ सेत॑वः
verses.transliteration: sahásradhāré 'va té sám asvaran  divó nā́ke mádhujihvā asaścátaḥ  ásya spáśo ná ní miṣanti bhū́rṇayaḥ  padé-pade pāśínaḥ santi sétavaḥ

translation.text: Sweet-tongued, exhaustless, they have sent their voices down togetlier, in heaven's vault that pours a thousand streams. His wildly-restless warders never close an eye: in every place are found the bonds that bind man last.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒तुर्मा॒तुरध्या ये स॒मस्व॑रन्नृ॒चा शोच॑न्तः सं॒दह॑न्तो अव्र॒तान् इन्द्र॑द्विष्टा॒मप॑ धमन्ति मा॒यया॒ त्वच॒मसि॑क्नीं॒ भूम॑नो दि॒वस्परि॑
verses.transliteration: pitúr mātúr ádhy ā́ yé samásvarann  r̥cā́ śócantaḥ saṃdáhanto avratā́n  índradviṣṭām ápa dhamanti māyáyā  tvácam ásiknīm bhū́mano divás pári

translation.text: O'er Sire and Mother they have roared in unison bright with the verse of praise, burning up riteless men, Blowing away with supernatural might from earth and from the heavens the swarthy skin which Indra hates.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒त्नान्माना॒दध्या ये स॒मस्व॑र॒ञ्छ्लोक॑यन्त्रासो रभ॒सस्य॒ मन्त॑वः अपा॑न॒क्षासो॑ बधि॒रा अ॑हासत ऋ॒तस्य॒ पन्थां॒ न त॑रन्ति दु॒ष्कृतः॑
verses.transliteration: pratnā́n mā́nād ádhy ā́ yé samásvarañ  -ślókayantrāso rabhasásya mántavaḥ  ápānakṣā́so badhirā́ ahāsata  r̥tásya pánthāṃ ná taranti duṣkŕ̥taḥ

translation.text: Those which, as guides of song and counsellors of speed, were manifested from their ancient dwelling place,– From these the eyeless and the deaf have turned aside: the wicked travel not the pathway of the Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्र॑धारे॒ वित॑ते प॒वित्र॒ आ वाचं॑ पुनन्ति क॒वयो॑ मनी॒षिणः॑ रु॒द्रास॑ एषामिषि॒रासो॑ अ॒द्रुहः॒ स्पशः॒ स्वञ्चः॑ सु॒दृशो॑ नृ॒चक्ष॑सः
verses.transliteration: sahásradhāre vítate pavítra~ā́  vā́cam punanti kaváyo manīṣíṇaḥ  rudrā́sa eṣām iṣirā́so adrúhaḥ-  spáśaḥ sváñcaḥ sudŕ̥śo nr̥cákṣasaḥ

translation.text: What time the filter with a thousand streams is stretched, the thoughtful sages purify their song therein. Bright-coloured are their spies, vigorous, void of guile, excellent, fair to see, beholders of mankind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॑ गो॒पा न दभा॑य सु॒क्रतु॒स्त्री ष प॒वित्रा॑ हृ॒द्य१॒॑न्तरा द॑धे वि॒द्वान्त्स विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒भि प॑श्य॒त्यवाजु॑ष्टान्विध्यति क॒र्ते अ॑व्र॒तान्
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya gopā́ ná dábhāya sukrátus  trī́ ṣá pavítrā hr̥dy àntár ā́ dadhe  vidvā́n sá víśvā bhúvanābhí paśyati-  ávā́juṣṭān vidhyati karté avratā́n

translation.text: Guardian of Law, most wise, he may not be deceived: three Purifiers hath he set within his heart. With wisdom he beholds all creatures that exist: he drives into the pit the hated riteliess ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॒ तन्तु॒र्वित॑तः प॒वित्र॒ आ जि॒ह्वाया॒ अग्रे॒ वरु॑णस्य मा॒यया॑ धीरा॑श्चि॒त्तत्स॒मिन॑क्षन्त आश॒तात्रा॑ क॒र्तमव॑ पदा॒त्यप्र॑भुः
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya tántur vítataḥ pavítra~ā́  jihvā́yā ágre váruṇasya māyáyā  dhī́rāś cit tát samínakṣanta āśata-  -átrā kartám áva padāty áprabhuḥ

translation.text: The thread of sacrifice spun in the cleansing sieve, on Varuṇa's tongue-tip, by supernatural might,– This, by their striving, have the prudent ones attained: he who hath not this power shall sink into the pit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शिशु॒र्न जा॒तोऽव॑ चक्रद॒द्वने॒ स्व१॒॑र्यद्वा॒ज्य॑रु॒षः सिषा॑सति दि॒वो रेत॑सा सचते पयो॒वृधा॒ तमी॑महे सुम॒ती शर्म॑ स॒प्रथः॑
verses.transliteration: śíśur ná jātó 'va cakradad váne  svàr yád vājy àruṣáḥ síṣāsati  divó rétasā sacate payovŕ̥dhā  tám īmahe sumatī́ śárma sapráthaḥ

translation.text: BORN like a youngling he hath clamoured in the wood, when he, the Red, the Strong, would win the light of heaven. He comes with heavenly seed that makes the water swell: him for wide-spreading shelter we implore with prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो यः स्क॒म्भो ध॒रुणः॒ स्वा॑तत॒ आपू॑र्णो अं॒शुः प॒र्येति॑ वि॒श्वतः॑ सेमे म॒ही रोद॑सी यक्षदा॒वृता॑ समीची॒ने दा॑धार॒ समिषः॑ क॒विः
verses.transliteration: divó yá skambhó dharúṇaḥ svā̀tataḥ-  ā́pūrṇo aṃśúḥ paryéti viśvátaḥ  sémé mahī́ ródasī yakṣad āvŕ̥tā  samīcīné dādhāra sám íṣaḥ kavíḥ

translation.text: A far-extended pillar that supports the sky the Soma-stalk, filled full, moves itself every way. He shall bring both these great worlds while the rite proceeds: the Sage holds these who move! together and all food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: महि॒ प्सरः॒ सुकृ॑तं सो॒म्यं मधू॒र्वी गव्यू॑ति॒रदि॑तेर्ऋ॒तं य॒ते ईशे॒ यो वृ॒ष्टेरि॒त उ॒स्रियो॒ वृषा॒पां ने॒ता य इ॒तऊ॑तिर्ऋ॒ग्मियः॑
verses.transliteration: máhi psáraḥ súkr̥taṃ somyám mádhu-  -urvī́ gávyūtir áditer r̥táṃ yaté  ī́śe yó vr̥ṣṭér itá usríyo vŕ̥ṣā-  -apā́ṃ netā́ yá itáūtir r̥gmíyaḥ

translation.text: Wide space hath he who follows Aditi's right path, and mighty, well-made food, meath blent with Soma juice; He who from hence commands the rain, Steer of the kine, Leader of floods, who helps us hence, who claims our laud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒त्म॒न्वन्नभो॑ दुह्यते घृ॒तं पय॑ ऋ॒तस्य॒ नाभि॑र॒मृतं॒ वि जा॑यते स॒मी॒ची॒नाः सु॒दान॑वः प्रीणन्ति॒ तं नरो॑ हि॒तमव॑ मेहन्ति॒ पेर॑वः
verses.transliteration: ātmanván nábho duhyate ghr̥tám páyaḥ-  r̥tásya nā́bhir amŕ̥taṃ ví jāyate  samīcīnā́ḥ sudā́navaḥ prīṇanti táṃ  náro hitám áva mehanti péravaḥ

translation.text: Butter and milk are drawn from animated cloud; thence Amrit is produced, centre of sacrifice. Hini the Most Bounteous Ones, ever united, love; him as ouir Friend the Men who make all swell rain down.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरा॑वीदं॒शुः सच॑मान ऊ॒र्मिणा॑ देवा॒व्यं१॒॑ मनु॑षे पिन्वति॒ त्वच॑म् दधा॑ति॒ गर्भ॒मदि॑तेरु॒पस्थ॒ आ येन॑ तो॒कं च॒ तन॑यं च॒ धाम॑हे
verses.transliteration: árāvīd aṃśúḥ sácamāna ūrmíṇā  devāvyàm mánuṣe pinvati tvácam  dádhāti gárbham áditer upástha~ā́  yéna tokáṃ ca tánayaṃ ca dhā́mahe

translation.text: The Soma-stalk hath roared, following with the wave: he swells with sap for man the skin which Gods enjoy. Upon the lap of Aditi he lays the germ, by means whereof we gain children and progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्र॑धा॒रेऽव॒ ता अ॑स॒श्चत॑स्तृ॒तीये॑ सन्तु॒ रज॑सि प्र॒जाव॑तीः चत॑स्रो॒ नाभो॒ निहि॑ता अ॒वो दि॒वो ह॒विर्भ॑रन्त्य॒मृतं॑ घृत॒श्चुतः॑
verses.transliteration: sahásradhāré 'va tā́ asaścátas  tr̥tī́ye santu rájasi prajā́vatīḥ  cátasro nā́bho níhitā avó divó  havír bharanty amŕ̥taṃ ghr̥taścútaḥ

translation.text: In the third region which distils a thousand streams, may the Exhaustless Ones descend with procreant power. The kindred Four have been sent downward from the heavens: dropping with oil they bring Amrit and sacred gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्वे॒तं रू॒पं कृ॑णुते॒ यत्सिषा॑सति॒ सोमो॑ मी॒ढ्वाँ असु॑रो वेद॒ भूम॑नः धि॒या शमी॑ सचते॒ सेम॒भि प्र॒वद्दि॒वस्कव॑न्ध॒मव॑ दर्षदु॒द्रिण॑म्
verses.transliteration: śvetáṃ rūpáṃ kr̥ṇute yát síṣāsati  sómo mīḍhvā́m̐ ásuro veda bhū́manaḥ  dhiyā́ śámī sacate sém abhí pravád  divás kávandham áva darṣad udríṇam

translation.text: Soma assumes white colour when he strives to gain: the bounteous Asura knows full many a precious boon. Down the steep slope, through song, he comes to sacrifice, and he will burst the water-holding cask of heaven,

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॑ श्वे॒तं क॒लशं॒ गोभि॑र॒क्तं कार्ष्म॒न्ना वा॒ज्य॑क्रमीत्सस॒वान् आ हि॑न्विरे॒ मन॑सा देव॒यन्तः॑ क॒क्षीव॑ते श॒तहि॑माय॒ गोना॑म्
verses.transliteration: ádha śvetáṃ kaláśaṃ góbhir aktám  kā́rṣmann ā́ vājy àkramīt sasavā́n  ā́ hinvire mánasā devayántaḥ  kakṣī́vate śatáhimāya gónām

translation.text: Yea, to the shining milk-anointed beaker, as to his goal, hath stepped the conquering Courser. Pious-souled men have sent their giffi of cattle unto Kakshîvân of the hundred winters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द्भिः सो॑म पपृचा॒नस्य॑ ते॒ रसोऽव्यो॒ वारं॒ वि प॑वमान धावति स मृ॒ज्यमा॑नः क॒विभि॑र्मदिन्तम॒ स्वद॒स्वेन्द्रा॑य पवमान पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: adbhíḥ soma papr̥cānásya te rásaḥ-  -ávyo vā́raṃ ví pavamāna dhāvati  sá mr̥jyámānaḥ kavíbhir madintama  svádasvéndrāya pavamāna pītáye

translation.text: Soma, thy juice when thou art blended with the streams, flows, Pavamâna, through the long wool of the sheep. So, cleansed by sages. O best giver of delight, grow sweet for Indra, Pavamâna! for his drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि प्रि॒याणि॑ पवते॒ चनो॑हितो॒ नामा॑नि य॒ह्वो अधि॒ येषु॒ वर्ध॑ते आ सूर्य॑स्य बृह॒तो बृ॒हन्नधि॒ रथं॒ विष्व॑ञ्चमरुहद्विचक्ष॒णः
verses.transliteration: abhí priyā́ṇi pavate cánohito  nā́māni yahvó ádhi yéṣu várdhate  ā́ sū́ryasya br̥ható br̥hánn ádhi  ráthaṃ víṣvañcam aruhad vicakṣaṇáḥ

translation.text: GRACIOUSLY-MINDED he is flowing on his way to win dear names o'er which the Youthful One grows great. The Mighty and Far-seeing One hath mounted now the mighty Sûrya's car which moves to every side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॑ जि॒ह्वा प॑वते॒ मधु॑ प्रि॒यं व॒क्ता पति॑र्धि॒यो अ॒स्या अदा॑भ्यः दधा॑ति पु॒त्रः पि॒त्रोर॑पी॒च्यं१॒॑ नाम॑ तृ॒तीय॒मधि॑ रोच॒ने दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya jihvā́ pavate mádhu priyáṃ  vaktā́ pátir dhiyó asyā́ ádābhyaḥ  dádhāti putráḥ pitrór apīcyàṃ  nā́ma tr̥tī́yam ádhi rocané diváḥ

translation.text: The Speaker, unassailable Master of this hymn, the Tongue of sacrifice pours forth the pleasant meath. Within the lustrous region of the heavens the Son makes the third secret name of Mother and of Sire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑ द्युता॒नः क॒लशाँ॑ अचिक्रद॒न्नृभि॑र्येमा॒नः कोश॒ आ हि॑र॒ण्यये॑ अ॒भीमृ॒तस्य॑ दो॒हना॑ अनूष॒ताधि॑ त्रिपृ॒ष्ठ उ॒षसो॒ वि रा॑जति
verses.transliteration: áva dyutānáḥ kaláśām̐ acikradat-  nŕ̥bhir yemānáḥ kóśa ā́ hiraṇyáye  abhī́m r̥tásya dohánā anūṣata  -ádhi tripr̥ṣṭhá uṣáso ví rājati

translation.text: Sending forth flashes he hath bellowed to the jars, led by the men into the golden reservoir. The milky streams of sacrifice have sung to him: he of the triple height shines brightly through the morns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अद्रि॑भिः सु॒तो म॒तिभि॒श्चनो॑हितः प्ररो॒चय॒न्रोद॑सी मा॒तरा॒ शुचिः॑ रोमा॒ण्यव्या॑ स॒मया॒ वि धा॑वति॒ मधो॒र्धारा॒ पिन्व॑माना दि॒वेदि॑वे
verses.transliteration: ádribhiḥ sutó matíbhiś cánohitaḥ  prarocáyan ródasī mātárā śúciḥ  rómāṇy ávyā samáyā ví dhāvati  mádhor dhā́rā pínvamānā divé-dive

translation.text: Pressed by the stones, with hymns, and graciously inclined, illuminating both the Parents, Heaven and Earth, He flows in ordered season onward through the flee, a current of sweet juice still swelling day by day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ सोम॒ प्र ध॑न्वा स्व॒स्तये॒ नृभिः॑ पुना॒नो अ॒भि वा॑सया॒शिर॑म् ये ते॒ मदा॑ आह॒नसो॒ विहा॑यस॒स्तेभि॒रिन्द्रं॑ चोदय॒ दात॑वे म॒घम्
verses.transliteration: pári soma prá dhanvā svastáye  nŕ̥bhiḥ punānó abhí vāsayāśíram  yé te mádā āhanáso víhāyasas  tébhir índraṃ codaya dā́tave maghám

translation.text: Flow onward, Soma, flow to bring prosperity: cleansed by the men, invest thee with the milky draught. What gladdening drinks thou hast, foaming, exceeding strong, even with these incite Indra to give us wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ध॒र्ता दि॒वः प॑वते॒ कृत्व्यो॒ रसो॒ दक्षो॑ दे॒वाना॑मनु॒माद्यो॒ नृभिः॑ हरिः॑ सृजा॒नो अत्यो॒ न सत्व॑भि॒र्वृथा॒ पाजां॑सि कृणुते न॒दीष्वा
verses.transliteration: dhartā́ diváḥ pavate kŕ̥tvyo ráso  dákṣo devā́nām anumā́dyo nŕ̥bhiḥ  háriḥ sr̥jānó átyo ná sátvabhir  vŕ̥thā pā́jāṃsi kr̥ṇute nadī́ṣv ā́

translation.text: ON flows the potent juice, sustainer of the heavens, the strength of Gods, whom men must hail with shouts of joy. The Gold-hued, started like a courser by brave men, impetuously winneth splendour in the streams.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शूरो॒ न ध॑त्त॒ आयु॑धा॒ गभ॑स्त्योः॒ स्व१॒॑ः सिषा॑सन्रथि॒रो गवि॑ष्टिषु इन्द्र॑स्य॒ शुष्म॑मी॒रय॑न्नप॒स्युभि॒रिन्दु॑र्हिन्वा॒नो अ॑ज्यते मनी॒षिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: śū́ro ná dhatta ā́yudhā gábhastyoḥ  svàḥ síṣāsan rathiró gáviṣṭiṣu  índrasya śúṣmam īráyann apasyúbhir  índur hinvānó ajyate manīṣíbhiḥ

translation.text: He takes his weapons, like a hero, in his hands, fain to win light, car-borne, in forays for the kine. Indu, while stimulating India's might, is urged forward and balmed by sages skilful in their task.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑स्य सोम॒ पव॑मान ऊ॒र्मिणा॑ तवि॒ष्यमा॑णो ज॒ठरे॒ष्वा वि॑श प्र णः॑ पिन्व वि॒द्युद॒भ्रेव॒ रोद॑सी धि॒या न वाजाँ॒ उप॑ मासि॒ शश्व॑तः
verses.transliteration: índrasya soma pávamāna ūrmíṇā  taviṣyámāṇo jaṭháreṣv ā́ viśa  prá ṇaḥ pinva vidyúd abhréva ródasī  dhiyā́ ná vā́jām̐ úpa māsi śáśvataḥ

translation.text: Soma, as thou art purified with flowing wave, exhibiting thy strength enter thou Indra's throat. Make both worlds stream for us, as lightning doth the clouds: mete out exhaustless powers for us, as 'twere through song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्व॑स्य॒ राजा॑ पवते स्व॒र्दृश॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ धी॒तिमृ॑षि॒षाळ॑वीवशत् यः सूर्य॒स्यासि॑रेण मृ॒ज्यते॑ पि॒ता म॑ती॒नामस॑मष्टकाव्यः
verses.transliteration: víśvasya rā́jā pavate svardŕ̥śaḥ-  r̥tásya dhītím r̥ṣiṣā́ḷ avīvaśat  yáḥ sū́ryasyā́sireṇa mr̥jyáte  pitā́ matīnā́m ásamaṣṭakāvyaḥ

translation.text: Onward he flows, the King of all that sees the light: the R̥ishis' Lord hath raised the song of sacrifice; Even he who is adorned with Sûrya's arrowy beam, Father of hymns, whose wisdom is beyond our reach.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषे॑व यू॒था परि॒ कोश॑मर्षस्य॒पामु॒पस्थे॑ वृष॒भः कनि॑क्रदत् स इन्द्रा॑य पवसे मत्स॒रिन्त॑मो॒ यथा॒ जेषा॑म समि॒थे त्वोत॑यः
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣeva yūthā́ pári kóśam arṣasi-  apā́m upásthe vr̥ṣabháḥ kánikradat  sá índrāya pavase matsaríntamo  yáthā jéṣāma samithé tvótayaḥ

translation.text: Like as a bull to herds, thou flowest to the pail, bellowing as a steer upon the water's lap. So, best of Cheerers, thou for Indra flowest on that we, with thy protection, may o'ercome in fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष प्र कोशे॒ मधु॑माँ अचिक्रद॒दिन्द्र॑स्य॒ वज्रो॒ वपु॑षो॒ वपु॑ष्टरः अ॒भीमृ॒तस्य॑ सु॒दुघा॑ घृत॒श्चुतो॑ वा॒श्रा अ॑र्षन्ति॒ पय॑सेव धे॒नवः॑
verses.transliteration: eṣá prá kóśe mádhumām̐ acikradad  índrasya vájro vápuṣo vápuṣṭaraḥ  abhī́m r̥tásya sudúghā ghr̥taścúto  vāśrā́ arṣanti páyaseva dhenávaḥ

translation.text: MORE beauteous than the beautiful, as Indra's bolt, this Soma, rich in sweets, hath clamoured in the vat. Dropping with oil, abundant, streams of sacrifice flow unto him like milch-kine, lowing, with their milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स पू॒र्व्यः प॑वते॒ यं दि॒वस्परि॑ श्ये॒नो म॑था॒यदि॑षि॒तस्ति॒रो रजः॑ स मध्व॒ आ यु॑वते॒ वेवि॑जान॒ इत्कृ॒शानो॒रस्तु॒र्मन॒साह॑ बि॒भ्युषा॑
verses.transliteration: sá pūrvyáḥ pavate yáṃ divás pári  śyenó mathāyád iṣitás tiró rájaḥ  sá mádhva ā́ yuvate vévijāna ít  kr̥śā́nor ástur mánasā́ha bibhyúṣā

translation.text: On flows that Ancient One whom, hitherward, from heaven, sped through the region of the air, the Falcon snatched. He, quivering with alarm and terrified in heart before bow-armed Kr̥iṣânu, holdeth fast the sweet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते नः॒ पूर्वा॑स॒ उप॑रास॒ इन्द॑वो म॒हे वाजा॑य धन्वन्तु॒ गोम॑ते ई॒क्षे॒ण्या॑सो अ॒ह्यो॒३॒॑ न चार॑वो॒ ब्रह्म॑ब्रह्म॒ ये जु॑जु॒षुर्ह॒विर्ह॑विः
verses.transliteration: té naḥ pū́rvāsa úparāsa índavo  mahé vā́jāya dhanvantu gómate  īkṣeṇyā̀so ahyò ná cā́ravo  bráhma-brahma yé jujuṣúr havír-haviḥ

translation.text: May those first freshest drops of Soma juice effused flow on, their way to bring us mighty strength in kine. Beauteous as serpents, worthy to be looked upon, they whom each sacred gift and all our prayers have pleased.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं नो॑ वि॒द्वान्व॑नवद्वनुष्य॒त इन्दुः॑ स॒त्राचा॒ मन॑सा पुरुष्टु॒तः इ॒नस्य॒ यः सद॑ने॒ गर्भ॑माद॒धे गवा॑मुरु॒ब्जम॒भ्यर्ष॑ति व्र॒जम्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ no vidvā́n vanavad vanuṣyatáḥ-  índuḥ satrā́cā mánasā puruṣṭutáḥ  inásya yáḥ sádane gárbham ādadhé  gávām urubjám abhy árṣati vrajám

translation.text: May that much-lauded Indu, with a heart inclined to us, well-knowing, fight against our enemies. He who hath brought the germ beside the Strong One's seat moves onward to the widely-opcned stall of kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चक्रि॑र्दि॒वः प॑वते॒ कृत्व्यो॒ रसो॑ म॒हाँ अद॑ब्धो॒ वरु॑णो हु॒रुग्य॒ते असा॑वि मि॒त्रो वृ॒जने॑षु य॒ज्ञियोऽत्यो॒ न यू॒थे वृ॑ष॒युः कनि॑क्रदत्
verses.transliteration: cákrir diváḥ pavate kŕ̥tvyo ráso  mahā́m̐ ádabdho váruṇo hurúg yaté  ásāvi mitró vr̥jáneṣu yajñíyaḥ-  -átyo ná yūthé vr̥ṣayúḥ kánikradat

translation.text: The active potent juice of heaven is flowing on, great Varuṇa whom the forward man can ne'er deceive. Mitra, the Holy, hath been pressed for troubled times, neighing like an impatient horse amid the herd,

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र राजा॒ वाचं॑ ज॒नय॑न्नसिष्यदद॒पो वसा॑नो अ॒भि गा इ॑यक्षति गृ॒भ्णाति॑ रि॒प्रमवि॑रस्य॒ तान्वा॑ शु॒द्धो दे॒वाना॒मुप॑ याति निष्कृ॒तम्
verses.transliteration: prá rā́jā vā́caṃ janáyann asiṣyadad  apó vásāno abhí gā́ iyakṣati  gr̥bhṇā́ti riprám ávir asya tā́nvā  śuddhó devā́nām úpa yāti niṣkr̥tám

translation.text: RAISING his voice the King hath flowed upon his way: invested with the waters he would win the kine. The fleece retains his solid parts as though impure, and bright and cleansed he seeks the special place of Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य सोम॒ परि॑ षिच्यसे॒ नृभि॑र्नृ॒चक्षा॑ ऊ॒र्मिः क॒विर॑ज्यसे॒ वने॑ पू॒र्वीर्हि ते॑ स्रु॒तयः॒ सन्ति॒ यात॑वे स॒हस्र॒मश्वा॒ हर॑यश्चमू॒षदः॑
verses.transliteration: índrāya soma pári ṣicyase nŕ̥bhir  nr̥cákṣā ūrmíḥ kavír ajyase váne  pūrvī́r hí te srutáyaḥ sánti yā́tave  sahásram áśvā hárayaś camūṣádaḥ

translation.text: Thou, Soma, art effused for Indra by the men, balmed in the wood as wave, Sage, Viewer of mankind. Full many are the paths whereon thou mayest go: a thousand bay steeds hast thou resting in the bowls.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मु॒द्रिया॑ अप्स॒रसो॑ मनी॒षिण॒मासी॑ना अ॒न्तर॒भि सोम॑मक्षरन् ता ईं॑ हिन्वन्ति ह॒र्म्यस्य॑ स॒क्षणिं॒ याच॑न्ते सु॒म्नं पव॑मान॒मक्षि॑तम्
verses.transliteration: samudríyā apsaráso manīṣíṇam  ā́sīnā antár abhí sómam akṣaran  tā́ īṃ hinvanti harmyásya sakṣáṇiṃ  yā́cante sumnám pávamānam ákṣitam

translation.text: Apsarases who dwell in waters of the sea, sitting within, have flowed to Soma wise of heart. They urge the Master of the house upon his way, and to the Eternal Pavamâna pray for bliss.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गो॒जिन्नः॒ सोमो॑ रथ॒जिद्धि॑रण्य॒जित्स्व॒र्जिद॒ब्जित्प॑वते सहस्र॒जित् यं दे॒वास॑श्चक्रि॒रे पी॒तये॒ मदं॒ स्वादि॑ष्ठं द्र॒प्सम॑रु॒णं म॑यो॒भुव॑म्
verses.transliteration: gojín naḥ sómo rathajíd dhiraṇyajít  svarjíd abjít pavate sahasrajít  yáṃ devā́saś cakriré pītáye mádaṃ  svā́diṣṭhaṃ drapsám aruṇám mayobhúvam

translation.text: Soma flows on for u's as winner of the kine, winner of thousands, cars, water, and light, and gold; He whom the Gods have made a gladdening draught to drink, the drop most sweet to taste, wealbringing, red of hue.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तानि॑ सोम॒ पव॑मानो अस्म॒युः स॒त्यानि॑ कृ॒ण्वन्द्रवि॑णान्यर्षसि ज॒हि शत्रु॑मन्ति॒के दू॑र॒के च॒ य उ॒र्वीं गव्यू॑ति॒मभ॑यं च नस्कृधि
verses.transliteration: etā́ni soma pávamāno asmayúḥ  satyā́ni kr̥ṇván dráviṇāny arṣasi  jahí śátrum antiké dūraké ca yáḥ-  urvī́ṃ gávyūtim ábhayaṃ ca nas kr̥dhi

translation.text: Soma, as Pavamâna thou, our faithful Friend, making for us these real treasures, flowest on. Slay thou the enemy both near and,far away: grant us security and ample pasturage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒चो॒दसो॑ नो धन्व॒न्त्विन्द॑वः॒ प्र सु॑वा॒नासो॑ बृ॒हद्दि॑वेषु॒ हर॑यः वि च॒ नश॑न्न इ॒षो अरा॑तयो॒ऽर्यो न॑शन्त॒ सनि॑षन्त नो॒ धियः॑
verses.transliteration: acodáso no dhanvantv índavaḥ  prá suvānā́so br̥háddiveṣu hárayaḥ  ví ca náśan na iṣó árātayo  -aryó naśanta sániṣanta no dhíyaḥ

translation.text: SPONTANEOUS let our drops of Soma juice flow on, pressed, golden-hued, among the Gods of lofty heaven. Perish among us they who give no gifts of food! perish the godless! May our prayers obtain success.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र णो॑ धन्व॒न्त्विन्द॑वो मद॒च्युतो॒ धना॑ वा॒ येभि॒रर्व॑तो जुनी॒मसि॑ ति॒रो मर्त॑स्य॒ कस्य॑ चि॒त्परि॑ह्वृतिं व॒यं धना॑नि वि॒श्वधा॑ भरेमहि
verses.transliteration: prá ṇo dhanvantv índavo madacyúto  dhánā vā yébhir árvato junīmási  tiró mártasya kásya cit párihvr̥tiṃ  vayáṃ dhánāni viśvádhā bharemahi

translation.text: Forward to us the drops, distilling meath, shall flow, like riches for whose sake we urge the horses on. Beyond the crafty hindering of all mortal men may we continually bear precious wealth away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्वस्या॒ अरा॑त्या अ॒रिर्हि ष उ॒तान्यस्या॒ अरा॑त्या॒ वृको॒ हि षः धन्व॒न्न तृष्णा॒ सम॑रीत॒ ताँ अ॒भि सोम॑ ज॒हि प॑वमान दुरा॒ध्यः॑
verses.transliteration: utá svásyā árātyā arír hí ṣá  utā́nyásyā árātyā vŕ̥ko hí ṣáḥ  dhánvan ná tŕ̥ṣṇā sám arīta tā́m̐ abhí  sóma jahí pavamāna durādhyàḥ

translation.text: Yea, yerily, foe of hate shown to himself is he, yea, verity, destroyer too of other hate. As thirst subdueth in the desert, conquer thou, O Soma Pavarnana, men of evil thoughts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वि ते॒ नाभा॑ पर॒मो य आ॑द॒दे पृ॑थि॒व्यास्ते॑ रुरुहुः॒ सान॑वि॒ क्षिपः॑ अद्र॑यस्त्वा बप्सति॒ गोरधि॑ त्व॒च्य१॒॑प्सु त्वा॒ हस्तै॑र्दुदुहुर्मनी॒षिणः॑
verses.transliteration: diví te nā́bhā paramó yá ādadé  pr̥thivyā́s te ruruhuḥ sā́navi kṣípaḥ  ádrayas tvā bapsati gór ádhi tvací-  -apsú tvā hástair duduhur manīṣíṇaḥ

translation.text: Near kin to thee is he, raised loftiest in the heavens: upon the earth's high ridge thy scions have grown forth. The press-stones chew and crunch thee on the ox's hide: sages have milked thee with their hands into the streams.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा त॑ इन्दो सु॒भ्वं॑ सु॒पेश॑सं॒ रसं॑ तुञ्जन्ति प्रथ॒मा अ॑भि॒श्रियः॑ निदं॑निदं पवमान॒ नि ता॑रिष आ॒विस्ते॒ शुष्मो॑ भवतु प्रि॒यो मदः॑
verses.transliteration: evā́ ta indo subhvàṃ supéśasaṃ  rásaṃ tuñjanti prathamā́ abhiśríyaḥ  nídaṃ-nidam pavamāna ní tāriṣaḥ-  āvís te śúṣmo bhavatu priyó mádaḥ

translation.text: So do they hurry on thy strong and beauteous juice, O Indu, as the first ingredient of the draught. Bring low, thou Pavamâna, every single foe, and be thy might shown forth as sweet and gladdening drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोम॑स्य॒ धारा॑ पवते नृ॒चक्ष॑स ऋ॒तेन॑ दे॒वान्ह॑वते दि॒वस्परि॑ बृह॒स्पते॑ र॒वथे॑ना॒ वि दि॑द्युते समु॒द्रासो॒ न सव॑नानि विव्यचुः
verses.transliteration: sómasya dhā́rā pavate nr̥cákṣasaḥ-  r̥téna devā́n havate divás pári  bŕ̥haspáte raváthenā ví didyute  samudrā́so ná sávanāni vivyacuḥ

translation.text: ON flows the stream of Soma who beholds mankind: by everlasting Law he calls the Gods from heaven. He lightens with the roaring of Br aspati: h the lakes have not contained the pourings of juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं त्वा॑ वाजिन्न॒घ्न्या अ॒भ्यनू॑ष॒तायो॑हतं॒ योनि॒मा रो॑हसि द्यु॒मान् म॒घोना॒मायुः॑ प्रति॒रन्महि॒ श्रव॒ इन्द्रा॑य सोम पवसे॒ वृषा॒ मदः॑
verses.transliteration: yáṃ tvā vājinn aghnyā́ abhy ánūṣata-  -áyohataṃ yónim ā́ rohasi dyumā́n  maghónām ā́yuḥ pratirán máhi śrávaḥ-  índrāya soma pavase vŕ̥ṣā mádaḥ

translation.text: Thou, powerful Soma, thou to whom the cows have -lowed, ascendest bright with sheen, thine ironfashioned home. Thou, lengthening our princes' life and high renown, flowest for Indra as his might to gladdening drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एन्द्र॑स्य कु॒क्षा प॑वते म॒दिन्त॑म॒ ऊर्जं॒ वसा॑नः॒ श्रव॑से सुम॒ङ्गलः॑ प्र॒त्यङ्स विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒भि प॑प्रथे॒ क्रीळ॒न्हरि॒रत्यः॑ स्यन्दते॒ वृषा॑
verses.transliteration: éndrasya kukṣā́ pavate madíntamaḥ-  ū́rjaṃ vásānaḥ śrávase sumaṅgálaḥ  pratyáṅ sá víśvā bhúvanābhí paprathe  krī́ḷan hárir átyaḥ syandate vŕ̥ṣā

translation.text: Best giver of delight, he flows to Indra's throat, robing himself in might, Auspicious One, for fame. He spreads himself abroad to meet all things that be: the vigorous Tawny Steed flows sporting on his way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ दे॒वेभ्यो॒ मधु॑मत्तमं॒ नरः॑ स॒हस्र॑धारं दुहते॒ दश॒ क्षिपः॑ नृभिः॑ सोम॒ प्रच्यु॑तो॒ ग्राव॑भिः सु॒तो विश्वा॑न्दे॒वाँ आ प॑वस्वा सहस्रजित्
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā devébhyo mádhumattamaṃ náraḥ  sahásradhāraṃ duhate dáśa kṣípaḥ  nŕ̥bhiḥ soma prácyuto grā́vabhiḥ sutó  víśvān devā́m̐ ā́ pavasvā sahasrajit

translation.text: The men, the ten swift fingers, milk thee out for Gods, even thee most rich in meath, with thousand flowing streams. Soma who winnest thousands, driven by the men, expressed with stones, bring, as thou flowest, all the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ ह॒स्तिनो॒ मधु॑मन्त॒मद्रि॑भिर्दु॒हन्त्य॒प्सु वृ॑ष॒भं दश॒ क्षिपः॑ इन्द्रं॑ सोम मा॒दय॒न्दैव्यं॒ जनं॒ सिन्धो॑रिवो॒र्मिः पव॑मानो अर्षसि
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā hastíno mádhumantam ádribhir  duhánty apsú vr̥ṣabháṃ dáśa kṣípaḥ  índraṃ soma mādáyan daívyaṃ jánaṃ  síndhor ivormíḥ pávamāno arṣasi

translation.text: Deft-handed men with stones, the ten swift fingers, drain thee into waters, thee, the Steer enriched with sweets. Thou, Soma, gladdening Indra, and the Heavenly Host, flowest as Pavamâna like a river's wave.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सोम॑स्य॒ पव॑मानस्यो॒र्मय॒ इन्द्र॑स्य यन्ति ज॒ठरं॑ सु॒पेश॑सः द॒ध्ना यदी॒मुन्नी॑ता य॒शसा॒ गवां॑ दा॒नाय॒ शूर॑मु॒दम॑न्दिषुः सु॒ताः
verses.transliteration: prá sómasya pávamānasyormáyaḥ-  índrasya yanti jaṭháraṃ supéśasaḥ  dadhnā́ yád īm únnītā yaśásā gávāṃ  dānā́ya śū́ram udámandiṣuḥ sutā́ḥ

translation.text: ONWARD to Indra's throat move, beauteously adorned, the waves of Soma as he purifies himself, When they, brought forward with the lovely curd of kine, effused, have cheered the Hero to bestow his gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॒ हि सोमः॑ क॒लशाँ॒ असि॑ष्यद॒दत्यो॒ न वोळ्हा॑ र॒घुव॑र्तनि॒र्वृषा॑ अथा॑ दे॒वाना॑मु॒भय॑स्य॒ जन्म॑नो वि॒द्वाँ अ॑श्नोत्य॒मुत॑ इ॒तश्च॒ यत्
verses.transliteration: áchā hí sómaḥ kaláśām̐ ásiṣyadad  átyo ná vóḷhā raghúvartanir vŕ̥ṣā  áthā devā́nām ubháyasya jánmano  vidvā́m̐ aśnoty amúta itáś ca yát

translation.text: Hither hath Soma flowed unto the beakers, like a chariot-horse, a stallion swift upon his way. Thus, knowing both the generations, he obtains the rights and dues of Gods from yonder and from hence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नः॑ सोम॒ पव॑मानः किरा॒ वस्विन्दो॒ भव॑ म॒घवा॒ राध॑सो म॒हः शिक्षा॑ वयोधो॒ वस॑वे॒ सु चे॒तुना॒ मा नो॒ गय॑मा॒रे अ॒स्मत्परा॑ सिचः
verses.transliteration: ā́ naḥ soma pávamānaḥ kirā vásu-  índo bháva maghávā rā́dhaso maháḥ  śíkṣā vayodho vásave sú cetúnā  mā́ no gáyam āré asmát párā sicaḥ

translation.text: While thou art cleansed, O Soma, scatter wealth on us; Indu, bestow great bounty as a liberal Prince. Giver of life, with wisdom help to opulence; strew not our home possessions far away from us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नः॑ पू॒षा पव॑मानः सुरा॒तयो॑ मि॒त्रो ग॑च्छन्तु॒ वरु॑णः स॒जोष॑सः बृह॒स्पति॑र्म॒रुतो॑ वा॒युर॒श्विना॒ त्वष्टा॑ सवि॒ता सु॒यमा॒ सर॑स्वती
