verses.transliteration: ā́ naḥ pūṣā́ pávamānaḥ surātáyo  mitró gachantu váruṇaḥ sajóṣasaḥ  bŕ̥haspátir marúto vāyúr aśvínā  tváṣṭā savitā́ suyámā sárasvatī

translation.text: Hither let Pûshan Pavamâna come to us, Varuṇa, Mitra, bountiful, of one accord, The Maruts, Aṣvins, Vâyu, and Br̥ihaspati, Savitar, Tvashṭar, tractable Sarasvatî.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भे द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वि॑श्वमि॒न्वे अ॑र्य॒मा दे॒वो अदि॑तिर्विधा॒ता भगो॒ नृशंस॑ उ॒र्व१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षं॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वाः पव॑मानं जुषन्त
verses.transliteration: ubhé dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ viśvaminvé  aryamā́ devó áditir vidhātā́  bhágo nŕ̥śáṃsa urv àntárikṣaṃ  víśve devā́ḥ pávamānaṃ juṣanta

translation.text: Both Heaven and Earth, the all-invigorating Pair, Vidhâtar, Aditi, and Aryaman the God, Bhaga who blesses men, the spacious Firmament,– let all the Gods in Pavamâna take delight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असा॑वि॒ सोमो॑ अरु॒षो वृषा॒ हरी॒ राजे॑व द॒स्मो अ॒भि गा अ॑चिक्रदत् पु॒ना॒नो वारं॒ पर्ये॑त्य॒व्ययं॑ श्ये॒नो न योनिं॑ घृ॒तव॑न्तमा॒सद॑म्
verses.transliteration: ásāvi sómo aruṣó vŕ̥ṣā hárī  rā́jeva dasmó abhí gā́ acikradat  punānó vā́ram páry ety avyáyaṃ  śyenó ná yóniṃ ghr̥távantam āsádam

translation.text: EVEN as a King hath Soma, red and tawny Bull, been pressed: the Wondrous One hath bellowed to the kine. While purified he passes through the filtering fleece to seat him hawk-like on the place that drops with oil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒विर्वे॑ध॒स्या पर्ये॑षि॒ माहि॑न॒मत्यो॒ न मृ॒ष्टो अ॒भि वाज॑मर्षसि अ॒प॒सेध॑न्दुरि॒ता सो॑म मृळय घृ॒तं वसा॑नः॒ परि॑ यासि नि॒र्णिज॑म्
verses.transliteration: kavír vedhasyā́ páry eṣi mā́hinam  átyo ná mr̥ṣṭó abhí vā́jam arṣasi  apasédhan duritā́ soma mr̥ḷaya  ghr̥táṃ vásānaḥ pári yāsi nirṇíjam

translation.text: To glory goest thou, Sage with disposing skill, like a groomed steed thou rusbest forward to the prize. O Soma, be thou gracious, driving off distress: thou goest, clothed in butter, to a robe of state.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒र्जन्यः॑ पि॒ता म॑हि॒षस्य॑ प॒र्णिनो॒ नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्या गि॒रिषु॒ क्षयं॑ दधे स्वसा॑र॒ आपो॑ अ॒भि गा उ॒तास॑र॒न्त्सं ग्राव॑भिर्नसते वी॒ते अ॑ध्व॒रे
verses.transliteration: parjányaḥ pitā́ mahiṣásya parṇíno  nā́bhā pr̥thivyā́ giríṣu kṣáyaṃ dadhe  svásāra ā́po abhí gā́ utā́saran  sáṃ grā́vabhir nasate vīté adhvaré

translation.text: Parjanya is the Father of the Mighty Bird: on mountains, in earth's centre hath he made his home. The waters too have flowed, the Sisters, to the kine: he meets the pressing-stones at the beloved rite.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जा॒येव॒ पत्या॒वधि॒ शेव॑ मंहसे॒ पज्रा॑या गर्भ शृणु॒हि ब्रवी॑मि ते अ॒न्तर्वाणी॑षु॒ प्र च॑रा॒ सु जी॒वसे॑ऽनि॒न्द्यो वृ॒जने॑ सोम जागृहि
verses.transliteration: jāyéva pátyāv ádhi śéva maṃhase  pájrāyā garbha śr̥ṇuhí brávīmi te  antár vā́ṇīṣu prá carā sú jīváse  -anindyó vr̥jáne soma jāgr̥hi

translation.text: Thou givest pleasure as a wife delights her lord. Listen, O Child of Pajri, for to thee I speak. Amid the holy songs go on that we may live: in time of trouble, Soma, watch thou free from blame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॒ पूर्वे॑भ्यः शत॒सा अमृ॑ध्रः सहस्र॒साः प॒र्यया॒ वाज॑मिन्दो ए॒वा प॑वस्व सुवि॒ताय॒ नव्य॑से॒ तव॑ व्र॒तमन्वापः॑ सचन्ते
verses.transliteration: yáthā pū́rvebhyaḥ śatasā́ ámr̥dhraḥ  sahasrasā́ḥ paryáyā vā́jam indo  evā́ pavasva suvitā́ya návyase  táva vratám ánv ā́paḥ sacante

translation.text: As to the men of old thou camest, Indu unharmed, to strengthen, winning hundreds, thousands, So now for new felicity flow onward: the waters follow as thy law ordaineth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒वित्रं॑ ते॒ वित॑तं ब्रह्मणस्पते प्र॒भुर्गात्रा॑णि॒ पर्ये॑षि वि॒श्वतः॑ अत॑प्ततनू॒र्न तदा॒मो अ॑श्नुते शृ॒तास॒ इद्वह॑न्त॒स्तत्समा॑शत
verses.transliteration: pavítraṃ te vítatam brahmaṇas pate  prabhúr gā́trāṇi páry eṣi viśvátaḥ  átaptatanūr ná tád āmó aśnute  śr̥tā́sa íd váhantas tát sám āśata

translation.text: SPREAD is thy cleansing filter, Brahmaṇaspati: as Prince, thou enterest its limbs from every side. The raw, whose mass hath not been heated gains not this: they only which are dressed, which bear, attain to it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तपो॑ष्प॒वित्रं॒ वित॑तं दि॒वस्प॒दे शोच॑न्तो अस्य॒ तन्त॑वो॒ व्य॑स्थिरन् अव॑न्त्यस्य पवी॒तार॑मा॒शवो॑ दि॒वस्पृ॒ष्ठमधि॑ तिष्ठन्ति॒ चेत॑सा
verses.transliteration: tápoṣ pavítraṃ vítataṃ divás padé  śócanto asya tántavo vy àsthiran  ávanty asya pavītā́ram āśávo  divás pr̥ṣṭhám ádhi tiṣṭhanti cétasā

translation.text: High in the seat of heaven is spread the Scorcher's sieve: its threads are standing separate, glittering with light. The Swift Ones favour him who purifieth this: with consciousness they stand upon the height of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरू॑रुचदु॒षसः॒ पृश्नि॑रग्रि॒य उ॒क्षा बि॑भर्ति॒ भुव॑नानि वाज॒युः मा॒या॒विनो॑ ममिरे अस्य मा॒यया॑ नृ॒चक्ष॑सः पि॒तरो॒ गर्भ॒मा द॑धुः
verses.transliteration: árūrucad uṣásaḥ pŕ̥śnir agriyáḥ-  ukṣā́ bibharti bhúvanāni vājayúḥ  māyāvíno mamire asya māyáyā  nr̥cákṣasaḥ pitáro gárbham ā́ dadhuḥ

translation.text: The foremost spotted Steer hath made the Mornings shine, and yearning after strength sustains all things that be. By his high wisdom have the mighty Sages wrought: the Fathers who behold mankind laid down the germ,

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग॒न्ध॒र्व इ॒त्था प॒दम॑स्य रक्षति॒ पाति॑ दे॒वानां॒ जनि॑मा॒न्यद्भु॑तः गृ॒भ्णाति॑ रि॒पुं नि॒धया॑ नि॒धाप॑तिः सु॒कृत्त॑मा॒ मधु॑नो भ॒क्षमा॑शत
verses.transliteration: gandharvá itthā́ padám asya rakṣati  pā́ti devā́nāṃ jánimāny ádbhutaḥ  gr̥bhṇā́ti ripúṃ nidháyā nidhā́patiḥ  sukŕ̥ttamā mádhuno bhakṣám āśata

translation.text: Gandharva verily protects his dwellingplace; Wondrous, he guards the generations of the Gods. Lord of the snare, he takes the foeman with the snare: those who are most devout have gained a share of meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह॒विर्ह॑विष्मो॒ महि॒ सद्म॒ दैव्यं॒ नभो॒ वसा॑नः॒ परि॑ यास्यध्व॒रम् राजा॑ प॒वित्र॑रथो॒ वाज॒मारु॑हः स॒हस्र॑भृष्टिर्जयसि॒ श्रवो॑ बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: havír haviṣmo máhi sádma daívyaṃ  nábho vásānaḥ pári yāsy adhvarám  rā́jā pavítraratho vā́jam ā́ruhaḥ  sahásrabhr̥ṣṭir jayasi śrávo br̥hát

translation.text: Rich in oblations! robed in cloud, thou corapassest oblation, sacrifice, the mighty seat of Gods. King, on thy chariot-sieve thou goest up to war, and with a thousand weapons winnest lofty fame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व देव॒माद॑नो॒ विच॑र्षणिर॒प्सा इन्द्रा॑य॒ वरु॑णाय वा॒यवे॑ कृ॒धी नो॑ अ॒द्य वरि॑वः स्वस्ति॒मदु॑रुक्षि॒तौ गृ॑णीहि॒ दैव्यं॒ जन॑म्
verses.transliteration: pávasva devamā́dano vícarṣaṇir  apsā́ índrāya váruṇāya vāyáve  kr̥dhī́ no adyá várivaḥ svastimád  urukṣitaú gr̥ṇīhi daívyaṃ jánam

translation.text: FLOW, cheering Gods, most active, winner of the flood, for Indra, and for Vâyu, and for Varuṇa. Bestow on us to-day wide room with happiness, and in thine ample dwelling laud the Host of Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यस्त॒स्थौ भुव॑ना॒न्यम॑र्त्यो॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ सोमः॒ परि॒ तान्य॑र्षति कृ॒ण्वन्त्सं॒चृतं॑ वि॒चृत॑म॒भिष्ट॑य॒ इन्दुः॑ सिषक्त्यु॒षसं॒ न सूर्यः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ yás tasthaú bhúvanāny ámartyo  víśvāni sómaḥ pári tā́ny arṣati  kr̥ṇván saṃcŕ̥taṃ vicŕ̥tam abhíṣṭaye-  índuḥ siṣakty uṣásaṃ ná sū́ryaḥ

translation.text: He who hath come anear to creatures that have life, Immortal Soma flows onward to all of them. Effecting, for our aid, both union and release, Indu, like Sûrya, follows closely after Dawn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यो गोभिः॑ सृ॒ज्यत॒ ओष॑धी॒ष्वा दे॒वानां॑ सु॒म्न इ॒षय॒न्नुपा॑वसुः आ वि॒द्युता॑ पवते॒ धार॑या सु॒त इन्द्रं॒ सोमो॑ मा॒दय॒न्दैव्यं॒ जन॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yó góbhiḥ sr̥jyáta óṣadhīṣv~ā́  devā́nāṃ sumná iṣáyann úpāvasuḥ  ā́ vidyútā pavate dhā́rayā sutáḥ-  índraṃ sómo mādáyan daívyaṃ jánam

translation.text: He who is poured with milk, he who within the plants hastes bringing treasure for the happiness of Gods, He, poured forth in a stream flows with the lightning's flash, Soma who gladdens Indra and the Host of Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्य सोमः॑ पवते सहस्र॒जिद्धि॑न्वा॒नो वाच॑मिषि॒रामु॑ष॒र्बुध॑म् इन्दुः॑ समु॒द्रमुदि॑यर्ति वा॒युभि॒रेन्द्र॑स्य॒ हार्दि॑ क॒लशे॑षु सीदति
verses.transliteration: eṣá syá sómaḥ pavate sahasrajíd  -hinvānó vā́cam iṣirā́m uṣarbúdham  índuḥ samudrám úd iyarti vāyúbhir  éndrasya hā́rdi kaláśeṣu sīdati

translation.text: Winner of thousands, he, this Soma, flows along, raising a vigorous voice that wakens with the dawn. Indu with winds drives on the ocean of the air, he sinks within the jars, he rests in Indra's heart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्यं गावः॒ पय॑सा पयो॒वृधं॒ सोमं॑ श्रीणन्ति म॒तिभिः॑ स्व॒र्विद॑म् ध॒नं॒ज॒यः प॑वते॒ कृत्व्यो॒ रसो॒ विप्रः॑ क॒विः काव्ये॑ना॒ स्व॑र्चनाः
verses.transliteration: abhí tyáṃ gā́vaḥ páyasā payovŕ̥dhaṃ  sómaṃ śrīṇanti matíbhiḥ svarvídam  dhanaṃjayáḥ pavate kŕ̥tvyo ráso  vípraḥ kavíḥ kā́vyenā svàrcanāḥ

translation.text: The kine with milk dress him who makes the milk increase, Soma, amid the songs, who finds the light of heaven. Winner of wealth, the effectual juice is flowing on, Singer and Sage by wisdom, dear as heaven itself.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य सोम॒ सुषु॑तः॒ परि॑ स्र॒वापामी॑वा भवतु॒ रक्ष॑सा स॒ह मा ते॒ रस॑स्य मत्सत द्वया॒विनो॒ द्रवि॑णस्वन्त इ॒ह स॒न्त्विन्द॑वः
verses.transliteration: índrāya soma súṣutaḥ pári srava-  -ápā́mīvā bhavatu rákṣasā sahá  mā́ te rásasya matsata dvayāvíno  dráviṇasvanta ihá santv índavaḥ

translation.text: FLOW on to Indra, Soma, carefully effused: let sickness stay afar together with the fiends. Let not the double-tongued delight them with thy juice. here be thy flowing drops laden with opulence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मान्त्स॑म॒र्ये प॑वमान चोदय॒ दक्षो॑ दे॒वाना॒मसि॒ हि प्रि॒यो मदः॑ ज॒हि शत्रूँ॑र॒भ्या भ॑न्दनाय॒तः पिबे॑न्द्र॒ सोम॒मव॑ नो॒ मृधो॑ जहि
verses.transliteration: asmā́n samaryé pavamāna codaya  dákṣo devā́nām ási hí priyó mádaḥ  jahí śátrūm̐r abhy ā́ bhandanāyatáḥ  píbendra sómam áva no mŕ̥dho jahi

translation.text: O Pavamâna, urge us forward in the fight thou art the vigour of the Gods, the well-loved drink. Smite thou our enemies who raise the shout of joy: Indra, drink Soma juice, and drive away our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अद॑ब्ध इन्दो पवसे म॒दिन्त॑म आ॒त्मेन्द्र॑स्य भवसि धा॒सिरु॑त्त॒मः अ॒भि स्व॑रन्ति ब॒हवो॑ मनी॒षिणो॒ राजा॑नम॒स्य भुव॑नस्य निंसते
verses.transliteration: ádabdha indo pavase madíntamaḥ-  ātméndrasya bhavasi dhāsír uttamáḥ  abhí svaranti bahávo manīṣíṇo  rā́jānam asyá bhúvanasya niṃsate

translation.text: Unharmed, best Cheerer, thou, O Indu, flowest on: thou, even thou thyself, art Indra's noblest food. Full many a wise man lifts to thee the song of praise, and hails thee with a kiss as Sovran of this world.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्र॑णीथः श॒तधा॑रो॒ अद्भु॑त॒ इन्द्रा॒येन्दुः॑ पवते॒ काम्यं॒ मधु॑ जय॒न्क्षेत्र॑म॒भ्य॑र्षा॒ जय॑न्न॒प उ॒रुं नो॑ गा॒तुं कृ॑णु सोम मीढ्वः
verses.transliteration: sahásraṇīthaḥ śatádhāro ádbhutaḥ-  índrāyénduḥ pavate kā́myam mádhu  jáyan kṣétram abhy àrṣā jáyann apáḥ-  urúṃ no gātúṃ kr̥ṇu soma mīḍhvaḥ

translation.text: Wondrous, with hundred streams, hymned in a thousand songs, Indu pours out for Indra his delightrul meath. Winning us land and waters, flow thou hitherward: Rainer of bounties, Soma, make broad way for us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कनि॑क्रदत्क॒लशे॒ गोभि॑रज्यसे॒ व्य१॒॑व्ययं॑ स॒मया॒ वार॑मर्षसि म॒र्मृ॒ज्यमा॑नो॒ अत्यो॒ न सा॑न॒सिरिन्द्र॑स्य सोम ज॒ठरे॒ सम॑क्षरः
verses.transliteration: kánikradat kaláśe góbhir ajyase  vy àvyáyaṃ samáyā vā́ram arṣasi  marmr̥jyámāno átyo ná sānasír  índrasya soma jaṭháre sám akṣaraḥ

translation.text: Roaring within the beaker thou art balmed with milk: thou passest through the fleecy filter all at once. Carefully cleansed and decked like a prizewinning steed, O Soma, thou hast flowed down within Indra's throat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वा॒दुः प॑वस्व दि॒व्याय॒ जन्म॑ने स्वा॒दुरिन्द्रा॑य सु॒हवी॑तुनाम्ने स्वा॒दुर्मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णाय वा॒यवे॒ बृह॒स्पत॑ये॒ मधु॑माँ॒ अदा॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: svādúḥ pavasva divyā́ya jánmane  svādúr índrāya suhávītunāmne  svādúr mitrā́ya váruṇāya vāyáve  bŕ̥haspátaye mádhumām̐ ádābhyaḥ

translation.text: Flow onward sweet of flavour for the Heavenly Race, for Indra sweet, whose name is easily invoked: Flow sweet for Mitra, Varuṇa, and Vâyu, rich in meath, inviolable for Br̥ihaspati.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्यं॑ मृजन्ति क॒लशे॒ दश॒ क्षिपः॒ प्र विप्रा॑णां म॒तयो॒ वाच॑ ईरते पव॑माना अ॒भ्य॑र्षन्ति सुष्टु॒तिमेन्द्रं॑ विशन्ति मदि॒रास॒ इन्द॑वः
verses.transliteration: átyam mr̥janti kaláśe dáśa kṣípaḥ  prá víprāṇām matáyo vā́ca īrate  pávamānā abhy àrṣanti suṣṭutím  éndraṃ viśanti madirā́sa índavaḥ

translation.text: Ten rapid fingers deck the Courser in the jar: with hymns the holy singers send their voices forth. The filtering juices hasten to their eulogy, the drops that gladden find their way to Indra's heart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑मानो अ॒भ्य॑र्षा सु॒वीर्य॑मु॒र्वीं गव्यू॑तिं॒ महि॒ शर्म॑ स॒प्रथः॑ माकि॑र्नो अ॒स्य परि॑षूतिरीश॒तेन्दो॒ जये॑म॒ त्वया॒ धनं॑धनम्
verses.transliteration: pávamāno abhy àrṣā suvī́ryam  urvī́ṃ gávyūtim máhi śárma sapráthaḥ  mā́kir no asyá páriṣūtir īśata-  -índo jáyema tváyā dhánaṃ-dhanam

translation.text: While thou art purified pour on us hero strength, great, far-extended shelter, spacious pasturage. Let no oppression master this our holy work: may we, O Indu, gain all opulence through thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधि॒ द्याम॑स्थाद्वृष॒भो वि॑चक्ष॒णोऽरू॑रुच॒द्वि दि॒वो रो॑च॒ना क॒विः राजा॑ प॒वित्र॒मत्ये॑ति॒ रोरु॑वद्दि॒वः पी॒यूषं॑ दुहते नृ॒चक्ष॑सः
verses.transliteration: ádhi dyā́m asthād vr̥ṣabhó vicakṣaṇó  -árūrucad ví divó rocanā́ kavíḥ  rā́jā pavítram áty eti róruvad  diváḥ pīyū́ṣaṃ duhate nr̥cákṣasaḥ

translation.text: The Steer who sees afar hath risen above the sky: the Sage hath caused the lights of heaven to give their shine. The. King is passing through the filter with a roar: they drain the milk of heaven from him who looks on men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो नाके॒ मधु॑जिह्वा अस॒श्चतो॑ वे॒ना दु॑हन्त्यु॒क्षणं॑ गिरि॒ष्ठाम् अ॒प्सु द्र॒प्सं वा॑वृधा॒नं स॑मु॒द्र आ सिन्धो॑रू॒र्मा मधु॑मन्तं प॒वित्र॒ आ
verses.transliteration: divó nā́ke mádhujihvā asaścátaḥ  venā́ duhanty ukṣáṇaṃ giriṣṭhā́m  apsú drapsáṃ vāvr̥dhānáṃ samudrá~ā́  síndhor ūrmā́ mádhumantam pavítra ā́

translation.text: High in the vault of heaven, unceasing, honey-tongued, the Loving Ones drain out the mountainhaunting Steer,– The drop that hath grown great in waters, in the lake meath-rich, in the stream's wave and in the cleansing sieve.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नाके॑ सुप॒र्णमु॑पपप्ति॒वांसं॒ गिरो॑ वे॒नाना॑मकृपन्त पू॒र्वीः शिशुं॑ रिहन्ति म॒तयः॒ पनि॑प्नतं हिर॒ण्ययं॑ शकु॒नं क्षाम॑णि॒ स्थाम्
verses.transliteration: nā́ke suparṇám upapaptivā́ṃsaṃ  gíro venā́nām akr̥panta pūrvī́ḥ  śíśuṃ rihanti matáyaḥ pánipnataṃ  hiraṇyáyaṃ śakunáṃ kṣā́maṇi sthā́m

translation.text: The Loving Ones besought with many voices the Eagle who had flown away to heaven. Hymns kiss the Youngling worthy of laudation, resting on earth, the Bird of golden colour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वो ग॑न्ध॒र्वो अधि॒ नाके॑ अस्था॒द्विश्वा॑ रू॒पा प्र॑ति॒चक्षा॑णो अस्य भा॒नुः शु॒क्रेण॑ शो॒चिषा॒ व्य॑द्यौ॒त्प्रारू॑रुच॒द्रोद॑सी मा॒तरा॒ शुचिः॑
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvó gandharvó ádhi nā́ke asthād  víśvā rūpā́ praticákṣāṇo asya  bhānúḥ śukréṇa śocíṣā vy àdyaut  prā́rūrucad ródasī mātárā śúciḥ

translation.text: High to heaven's vault hath the Gandharva risen, beholding all his varied forms and figures. His ray hath shone abroad with gleaming splendour: pure, he hath lighted both the worlds, the Parents.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र त॑ आ॒शवः॑ पवमान धी॒जवो॒ मदा॑ अर्षन्ति रघु॒जा इ॑व॒ त्मना॑ दि॒व्याः सु॑प॒र्णा मधु॑मन्त॒ इन्द॑वो म॒दिन्त॑मासः॒ परि॒ कोश॑मासते
verses.transliteration: prá ta āśávaḥ pavamāna dhījávo  mádā arṣanti raghujā́ iva tmánā  divyā́ḥ suparṇā́ mádhumanta índavo  madíntamāsaḥ pári kóśam āsate

translation.text: THY gladdening draughts, O Pavamâna, urged by song flow swiftly of themselves like sons of fleetfoot mares. The drops of Soma juice, those eagles of the heavens, most cheering, rich in meath, rest in the reservoir.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॒ मदा॑सो मदि॒रास॑ आ॒शवोऽसृ॑क्षत॒ रथ्या॑सो॒ यथा॒ पृथ॑क् धे॒नुर्न व॒त्सं पय॑सा॒भि व॒ज्रिण॒मिन्द्र॒मिन्द॑वो॒ मधु॑मन्त ऊ॒र्मयः॑
verses.transliteration: prá te mádāso madirā́sa āśávaḥ-  -ásr̥kṣata ráthyāso yáthā pŕ̥thak  dhenúr ná vatsám páyasābhí vajríṇam  índram índavo mádhumanta ūrmáyaḥ

translation.text: As rapid chariot-steeds, so turned in several ways have thine exhilarating juices darted forth, Soma-drops rich in meath, waves, to the Thunder-armed, to Indra, like milch-kine who seek their calf with milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्यो॒ न हि॑या॒नो अ॒भि वाज॑मर्ष स्व॒र्वित्कोशं॑ दि॒वो अद्रि॑मातरम् वृषा॑ प॒वित्रे॒ अधि॒ सानो॑ अ॒व्यये॒ सोमः॑ पुना॒न इ॑न्द्रि॒याय॒ धाय॑से
verses.transliteration: átyo ná hiyānó abhí vā́jam arṣa  svarvít kóśaṃ divó ádrimātaram  vŕ̥ṣā pavítre ádhi sā́no avyáye  sómaḥ punāná indriyā́ya dhā́yase

translation.text: Like a steed urged to battle, finder of the light; speed onward to the cloud-born reservoir of heaven, A Steer that o'er the woolly surface seeks the sieve, Soma while purified for Indra's nourishment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र त॒ आश्वि॑नीः पवमान धी॒जुवो॑ दि॒व्या अ॑सृग्र॒न्पय॑सा॒ धरी॑मणि प्रान्तर्ऋष॑यः॒ स्थावि॑रीरसृक्षत॒ ये त्वा॑ मृ॒जन्त्यृ॑षिषाण वे॒धसः॑
verses.transliteration: prá ta ā́śvinīḥ pavamāna dhījúvo  divyā́ asr̥gran páyasā dhárīmaṇi  prā́ntár ŕ̥ṣaya sthā́virīr asr̥kṣata  yé tvā mr̥jánty r̥ṣiṣāṇa vedhásaḥ

translation.text: Fleet as swift steeds, thy drops, divine, thought-swift, have been, O Pavamâna, poured with milk into the vat. The R̥ishis have poured in continuous Soma drops, ordainers who adorn thee, Friend whom R̥ishis love.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॒ धामा॑नि विश्वचक्ष॒ ऋभ्व॑सः प्र॒भोस्ते॑ स॒तः परि॑ यन्ति के॒तवः॑ व्या॒न॒शिः प॑वसे सोम॒ धर्म॑भिः॒ पति॒र्विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य राजसि
verses.transliteration: víśvā dhā́māni viśvacakṣa ŕ̥bhvasaḥ  prabhós te satáḥ pári yanti ketávaḥ  vyānaśíḥ pavase soma dhármabhiḥ  pátir víśvasya bhúvanasya rājasi

translation.text: O thou who seest all things, Sovran as thou art and passing strong, thy rays encompass all abodes. Pervading with thy natural powers thou flowest on, and as the whole world's Lord, O Soma, thou art King.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भ॒यतः॒ पव॑मानस्य र॒श्मयो॑ ध्रु॒वस्य॑ स॒तः परि॑ यन्ति के॒तवः॑ यदी॑ प॒वित्रे॒ अधि॑ मृ॒ज्यते॒ हरिः॒ सत्ता॒ नि योना॑ क॒लशे॑षु सीदति
verses.transliteration: ubhayátaḥ pávamānasya raśmáyo  dhruvásya satáḥ pári yanti ketávaḥ  yádī pavítre ádhi mr̥jyáte háriḥ  sáttā ní yónā kaláśeṣu sīdati

translation.text: The beams of Pavamâna, sent from earth and heaven, his ensigns who is ever steadfast, travel round. When on the sieve the Golden-hued is cleansed, he rests within the vats as one who seats him in his place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुः प॑वते स्वध्व॒रः सोमो॑ दे॒वाना॒मुप॑ याति निष्कृ॒तम् स॒हस्र॑धारः॒ परि॒ कोश॑मर्षति॒ वृषा॑ प॒वित्र॒मत्ये॑ति॒ रोरु॑वत्
verses.transliteration: yajñásya ketúḥ pavate svadhvaráḥ  sómo devā́nām úpa yāti niṣkr̥tám  sahásradhāraḥ pári kóśam arṣati  vŕ̥ṣā pavítram áty eti róruvat

translation.text: Served with fair rites he flows, ensign of sacrifice: Soma advances to the special place of Gods. He speeds with thousand currents to the reservoir, and passes through the filter bellowing as a bull.

verses.sanskrit_deva: राजा॑ समु॒द्रं न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ वि गा॑हते॒ऽपामू॒र्मिं स॑चते॒ सिन्धु॑षु श्रि॒तः अध्य॑स्था॒त्सानु॒ पव॑मानो अ॒व्ययं॒ नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्या ध॒रुणो॑ म॒हो दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: rā́jā samudráṃ nadyò ví gāhate  -apā́m ūrmíṃ sacate síndhuṣu śritáḥ  ádhy asthāt sā́nu pávamāno avyáyaṃ  nā́bhā pr̥thivyā́ dharúṇo mahó diváḥ-

translation.text: The Sovran dips him in the seain and the streams, and set in rivers with the waters' wave moves on. High heaven's Sustainer at the central point of earth, raised on the fleecy surface Pavamâna stands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो न सानु॑ स्त॒नय॑न्नचिक्रद॒द्द्यौश्च॒ यस्य॑ पृथि॒वी च॒ धर्म॑भिः इन्द्र॑स्य स॒ख्यं प॑वते वि॒वेवि॑द॒त्सोमः॑ पुना॒नः क॒लशे॑षु सीदति
verses.transliteration: divó ná sā́nu stanáyann acikradat  dyaúś ca yásya pr̥thivī́ ca dhármabhiḥ  índrasya sakhyám pavate vivévidat  sómaḥ punānáḥ kaláśeṣu sīdati

translation.text: He on whose high decree the heavens and earth depend nath roared and thundered like the summit of the sky. Soma flows on obtaining Indra's friendly love, and, as they purify him, settles in the jars.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज्योति॑र्य॒ज्ञस्य॑ पवते॒ मधु॑ प्रि॒यं पि॒ता दे॒वानां॑ जनि॒ता वि॒भूव॑सुः दधा॑ति॒ रत्नं॑ स्व॒धयो॑रपी॒च्यं॑ म॒दिन्त॑मो मत्स॒र इ॑न्द्रि॒यो रसः॑
verses.transliteration: jyótir yajñásya pavate mádhu priyám  pitā́ devā́nāṃ janitā́ vibhū́vasuḥ  dádhāti rátnaṃ svadháyor apīcyàm  madíntamo matsará indriyó rásaḥ

translation.text: He, light of sacrifice distils delicious meath, most wealthy, Father and begetter of the Gods. He, gladdening, best of Cheerers, juice!hat Indra loves, enriches with mysterious treasure earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि॒क्रन्द॑न्क॒लशं॑ वा॒ज्य॑र्षति॒ पति॑र्दि॒वः श॒तधा॑रो विचक्ष॒णः हरि॑र्मि॒त्रस्य॒ सद॑नेषु सीदति मर्मृजा॒नोऽवि॑भिः॒ सिन्धु॑भि॒र्वृषा॑
verses.transliteration: abhikrándan kaláśaṃ vājy àrṣati  pátir diváḥ śatádhāro vicakṣaṇáḥ  hárir mitrásya sádaneṣu sīdati  marmr̥jānó 'vibhiḥ síndhubhir vŕ̥ṣā

translation.text: The vigorous and far-seeing one, the Lord of heaven, flows, shouting to the beaker, with his thousand streams. Coloured like gold he rests in seats where Mitra dwells, the Steer made beautiful by rivers and by sheep.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्रे॒ सिन्धू॑नां॒ पव॑मानो अर्ष॒त्यग्रे॑ वा॒चो अ॑ग्रि॒यो गोषु॑ गच्छति अग्रे॒ वाज॑स्य भजते महाध॒नं स्वा॑यु॒धः सो॒तृभिः॑ पूयते॒ वृषा॑
verses.transliteration: ágre síndhūnām pávamāno arṣati-  ágre vācó agriyó góṣu gachati  ágre vā́jasya bhajate mahādhanáṃ  svāyudháḥ sotŕ̥bhiḥ pūyate vŕ̥ṣā

translation.text: In forefront of the rivers Pavamâna speeds, in forefront of the hymn, foremost among the kine. He shares the mighty booty in the van of war: the well-armed Steer is purified by worshippers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं म॒तवा॑ञ्छकु॒नो यथा॑ हि॒तोऽव्ये॑ ससार॒ पव॑मान ऊ॒र्मिणा॑ तव॒ क्रत्वा॒ रोद॑सी अन्त॒रा क॑वे॒ शुचि॑र्धि॒या प॑वते॒ सोम॑ इन्द्र ते
verses.transliteration: ayám matávāñ chakunó yáthā hitó  -ávye sasāra pávamāna ūrmíṇā  táva krátvā ródasī antarā́ kave  śúcir dhiyā́ pavate sóma indra te

translation.text: This heedful Pavamâna, like a bird sent forth, hath with his wave flowed onward to the fleecy sieve. O Indra, through thy wisdom, b thy thought, O Sage, Soma flows bright and pure between the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्रा॒पिं वसा॑नो यज॒तो दि॑वि॒स्पृश॑मन्तरिक्ष॒प्रा भुव॑ने॒ष्वर्पि॑तः स्व॑र्जज्ञा॒नो नभ॑सा॒भ्य॑क्रमीत्प्र॒त्नम॑स्य पि॒तर॒मा वि॑वासति
verses.transliteration: drāpíṃ vásāno yajató divispŕ̥śam  antarikṣaprā́ bhúvaneṣv árpitaḥ  svàr jajñānó nábhasābhy àkramīt  pratnám asya pitáram ā́ vivāsati

translation.text: He, clad in mail that reaches heaven, the Holy One, filling the firmament stationed amid the worlds, Knowing. the realm of light, hath come to us in rain: he summons to himself his own primeval Sire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सो अ॑स्य वि॒शे महि॒ शर्म॑ यच्छति॒ यो अ॑स्य॒ धाम॑ प्रथ॒मं व्या॑न॒शे प॒दं यद॑स्य पर॒मे व्यो॑म॒न्यतो॒ विश्वा॑ अ॒भि सं या॑ति सं॒यतः॑
verses.transliteration: só asya viśé máhi śárma yachati  yó asya dhā́ma prathamáṃ vyānaśé  padáṃ yád asya paramé vyòmani-  áto víśvā abhí sáṃ yāti saṃyátaḥ

translation.text: He who was first of all to penetrate his form bestowed upon his race wide shelter and defence. From that high station which he hath in loftiest heaven he comes victorious to all encounters here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रो अ॑यासी॒दिन्दु॒रिन्द्र॑स्य निष्कृ॒तं सखा॒ सख्यु॒र्न प्र मि॑नाति सं॒गिर॑म् मर्य॑ इव युव॒तिभिः॒ सम॑र्षति॒ सोमः॑ क॒लशे॑ श॒तया॑म्ना प॒था
verses.transliteration: pró ayāsīd índur índrasya niṣkr̥táṃ  sákhā sákhyur ná prá mināti saṃgíram  márya iva yuvatíbhiḥ sám arṣati  sómaḥ kaláśe śatáyāmnā pathā́

translation.text: Indu hath started for Indra's special place and slights not as a Friend the promise of his Friend. Soma speeds onward like a youth to youtlitial maids, and gains the beaker by a course of bundred paths.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॒ धियो॑ मन्द्र॒युवो॑ विप॒न्युवः॑ पन॒स्युवः॑ सं॒वस॑नेष्वक्रमुः सोमं॑ मनी॒षा अ॒भ्य॑नूषत॒ स्तुभो॒ऽभि धे॒नवः॒ पय॑सेमशिश्रयुः
verses.transliteration: prá vo dhíyo mandrayúvo vipanyúvaḥ  panasyúvaḥ saṃvásaneṣv akramuḥ  sómam manīṣā́ abhy ànūṣata stúbhaḥ  -abhí dhenávaḥ páyasem aśiśrayuḥ

translation.text: Your songs, exhilarating, tuneful, uttering praise, are come into the placns where the people meet. Worshippers have exalted Soma with their hymns, and milch kine have come near to meet him with their milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नः॑ सोम सं॒यतं॑ पि॒प्युषी॒मिष॒मिन्दो॒ पव॑स्व॒ पव॑मानो अ॒स्रिध॑म् या नो॒ दोह॑ते॒ त्रिरह॒न्नस॑श्चुषी क्षु॒मद्वाज॑व॒न्मधु॑मत्सु॒वीर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ naḥ soma saṃyátam pipyúṣīm íṣam  índo pávasva pávamāno asrídham  yā́ no dóhate trír áhann ásaścuṣī  kṣumád vā́javan mádhumad suvī́ryam

translation.text: O Soma, Indu, while they cleanse thee, pour on us accumulateds Plentiful, nutritious food, Which, ceaseless, thrice a day shall yield us hero power enriched with store of nourishment, and strength, and Meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॑ मती॒नां प॑वते विचक्ष॒णः सोमो॒ अह्नः॑ प्रतरी॒तोषसो॑ दि॒वः क्रा॒णा सिन्धू॑नां क॒लशाँ॑ अवीवश॒दिन्द्र॑स्य॒ हार्द्या॑वि॒शन्म॑नी॒षिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā matīnā́m pavate vicakṣaṇáḥ  sómo áhnaḥ pratarītóṣáso diváḥ  krāṇā́ síndhūnāṃ kaláśām̐ avīvaśad  índrasya hā́rdy āviśán manīṣíbhiḥ

translation.text: Far-seeing Soma flows, the Steer, the Lord of hymns, the Furtherer of day, of morning, and of heaven. Mixt with the streams he caused the beakers to resound, and with the singers' aid they entered Indra's heart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒नी॒षिभिः॑ पवते पू॒र्व्यः क॒विर्नृभि॑र्य॒तः परि॒ कोशाँ॑ अचिक्रदत् त्रि॒तस्य॒ नाम॑ ज॒नय॒न्मधु॑ क्षर॒दिन्द्र॑स्य वा॒योः स॒ख्याय॒ कर्त॑वे
verses.transliteration: manīṣíbhiḥ pavate pūrvyáḥ kavír  nŕ̥bhir yatáḥ pári kóśām̐ acikradat  tritásya nā́ma janáyan mádhu kṣarad  índrasya vāyóḥ sakhyā́ya kártave

translation.text: On, with the prudent singers, flows the ancient Sage and guided by the men hath roared about the vats. Producing Trita's name, may he pour forth the meath, that Vâyu and that Indra may become his Friends.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं पु॑ना॒न उ॒षसो॒ वि रो॑चयद॒यं सिन्धु॑भ्यो अभवदु लोक॒कृत् अ॒यं त्रिः स॒प्त दु॑दुहा॒न आ॒शिरं॒ सोमो॑ हृ॒दे प॑वते॒ चारु॑ मत्स॒रः
verses.transliteration: ayám punāná uṣáso ví rocayad  ayáṃ síndhubhyo abhavad ulokakŕ̥t  ayáṃ tríḥ saptá duduhāná āśíraṃ  sómo hr̥dé pavate cā́ru matsaráḥ

translation.text: He, being purified, hath made the Mornings shine: this, even this is he who gave the rivers room. He made the Three Times Seven pour out the milky flow: Soma, the Cheerer, yields whate'er the heart finds sweet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व सोम दि॒व्येषु॒ धाम॑सु सृजा॒न इ॑न्दो क॒लशे॑ प॒वित्र॒ आ सीद॒न्निन्द्र॑स्य ज॒ठरे॒ कनि॑क्रद॒न्नृभि॑र्य॒तः सूर्य॒मारो॑हयो दि॒वि
verses.transliteration: pávasva soma divyéṣu dhā́masu  sr̥jāná indo kaláśe pavítra ā́  sī́dann índrasya jaṭháre kánikradat-  nŕ̥bhir yatáḥ sū́ryam ā́rohayo diví

translation.text: Flow, onward, Soma, in thine own celestial forms, flow, Indu, poured within the beaker and the sieve. Sinking into the throat of Indra with a roar, led by the men thou madest Sûrya mount to heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अद्रि॑भिः सु॒तः प॑वसे प॒वित्र॒ आँ इन्द॒विन्द्र॑स्य ज॒ठरे॑ष्वावि॒शन् त्वं नृ॒चक्षा॑ अभवो विचक्षण॒ सोम॑ गो॒त्रमङ्गि॑रोभ्योऽवृणो॒रप॑
verses.transliteration: ádribhiḥ sutáḥ pavase pavítra ā́m̐  índav índrasya jaṭháreṣv āviśán  tváṃ nr̥cákṣā abhavo vicakṣaṇa  sóma gotrám áṅgirobhyo 'vr̥ṇor ápa

translation.text: Pressed out with stones thou flowest onward to the sieve, O Indu, entering the depths of Indra's throat. Far-sighted Soma, now thou lookest on mankind: thou didst unbar the cowstall for the Angirases.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां सो॑म॒ पव॑मानं स्वा॒ध्योऽनु॒ विप्रा॑सो अमदन्नव॒स्यवः॑ त्वां सु॑प॒र्ण आभ॑रद्दि॒वस्परीन्दो॒ विश्वा॑भिर्म॒तिभिः॒ परि॑ष्कृतम्
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ soma pávamānaṃ svādhyàḥ-  -ánu víprāso amadann avasyávaḥ  tvā́ṃ suparṇá ā́bharad divás pári-  -índo víśvābhir matíbhiḥ páriṣkr̥tam

translation.text: In thee, O Soma, while thou purifitedst thee, high-thoughted sages, seeking favour, have rejoiced. Down from the heavens the Falcon brought thee hitherward, even thee, O Indu, thee whom all our hymns adorn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव्ये॑ पुना॒नं परि॒ वार॑ ऊ॒र्मिणा॒ हरिं॑ नवन्ते अ॒भि स॒प्त धे॒नवः॑ अ॒पामु॒पस्थे॒ अध्या॒यवः॑ क॒विमृ॒तस्य॒ योना॑ महि॒षा अ॑हेषत
verses.transliteration: ávye punānám pári vā́ra ūrmíṇā  háriṃ navante abhí saptá dhenávaḥ  apā́m upásthe ádhy āyávaḥ kavím  r̥tásya yónā mahiṣā́ aheṣata

translation.text: Seven Milch-kine glorify the Tawny-coloured One while with his wave in wool he purifies himself. The living men, the mighty, have impelled the Sage into the waters' lap, the place of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्दुः॑ पुना॒नो अति॑ गाहते॒ मृधो॒ विश्वा॑नि कृ॒ण्वन्त्सु॒पथा॑नि॒ यज्य॑वे गाः कृ॑ण्वा॒नो नि॒र्णिजं॑ हर्य॒तः क॒विरत्यो॒ न क्रीळ॒न्परि॒ वार॑मर्षति
verses.transliteration: índuḥ punānó áti gāhate mŕ̥dho  víśvāni kr̥ṇván supáthāni yájyave  gā́ḥ kr̥ṇvānó nirṇíjaṃ haryatáḥ kavír  átyo ná krī́ḷan pári vā́ram arṣati

translation.text: Indu, attaining purity, plunges through the foe, making Ilis ways all easy for the pious man. Making the kine his mantle, he, the lovely Sage, runs like a sporting courser onward through the fleece.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स॒श्चतः॑ श॒तधा॑रा अभि॒श्रियो॒ हरिं॑ नव॒न्तेऽव॒ ता उ॑द॒न्युवः॑ क्षिपो॑ मृजन्ति॒ परि॒ गोभि॒रावृ॑तं तृ॒तीये॑ पृ॒ष्ठे अधि॑ रोच॒ने दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: asaścátaḥ śatádhārā abhiśríyo  háriṃ navanté 'va tā́ udanyúvaḥ  kṣípo mr̥janti pári góbhir ā́vr̥taṃ  tr̥tī́ye pr̥ṣṭhé ádhi rocané diváḥ

translation.text: The ceaseless watery fountains with their hundred streams sing, as they hasten near, to him the Golden-hued Him, clad in robes of milk, swift fingers beautify on the third height and in the luminous realm of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तवे॒माः प्र॒जा दि॒व्यस्य॒ रेत॑स॒स्त्वं विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य राजसि अथे॒दं विश्वं॑ पवमान ते॒ वशे॒ त्वमि॑न्दो प्रथ॒मो धा॑म॒धा अ॑सि
verses.transliteration: távemā́ḥ prajā́ divyásya rétasas  tváṃ víśvasya bhúvanasya rājasi  áthedáṃ víśvam pavamāna te váśe  tvám indo prathamó dhāmadhā́ asi

translation.text: These are thy generations of celestial seed thou art the Sovran Lord of all the world of life. This universe, O Pavamâna, owns thy sway; thou, Indu, art the first establisher of Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं स॑मु॒द्रो अ॑सि विश्व॒वित्क॑वे॒ तवे॒माः पञ्च॑ प्र॒दिशो॒ विध॑र्मणि त्वं द्यां च॑ पृथि॒वीं चाति॑ जभ्रिषे॒ तव॒ ज्योतीं॑षि पवमान॒ सूर्यः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ samudró asi viśvavít kave  távemā́ḥ páñca pradíśo vídharmaṇi  tváṃ dyā́ṃ ca pr̥thivī́ṃ cā́ti jabhriṣe  táva jyótīṃṣi pavamāna sū́ryaḥ

translation.text: Thou art the sea, O Sage who bringest alf to light: under thy Law are these five regions of the world. Tlou reachest out beyond the earth, beyond the heavens: thine are the lights, O Pavamâna, thine the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं प॒वित्रे॒ रज॑सो॒ विध॑र्मणि दे॒वेभ्यः॑ सोम पवमान पूयसे त्वामु॒शिजः॑ प्रथ॒मा अ॑गृभ्णत॒ तुभ्ये॒मा विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि येमिरे
verses.transliteration: tvám pavítre rájaso vídharmaṇi  devébhyaḥ soma pavamāna pūyase  tvā́m uśíjaḥ prathamā́ agr̥bhṇata  túbhyemā́ víśvā bhúvanāni yemire

translation.text: Thou in the filter, Soma Pavamâna, art purified to support the region for the Gods. The chief, the longing ones have sought to hold thee fast, and all these living creatures have been turned to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र रे॒भ ए॒त्यति॒ वार॑म॒व्ययं॒ वृषा॒ वने॒ष्वव॑ चक्रद॒द्धरिः॑ सं धी॒तयो॑ वावशा॒ना अ॑नूषत॒ शिशुं॑ रिहन्ति म॒तयः॒ पनि॑प्नतम्
verses.transliteration: prá rebhá ety áti vā́ram avyáyaṃ  vŕ̥ṣā váneṣv áva cakradad dháriḥ  sáṃ dhītáyo vāvaśānā́ anūṣata  śíśuṃ rihanti matáyaḥ pánipnataṃ

translation.text: Onward the Singer travels o'er the fleecy sieve. the Tawny Steer hath bellowed in the wooden vats. Hymns have been sung aloud in resonant harmony, and holy songs kiss him, the Child who claims our praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सूर्य॑स्य र॒श्मिभिः॒ परि॑ व्यत॒ तन्तुं॑ तन्वा॒नस्त्रि॒वृतं॒ यथा॑ वि॒दे नय॑न्नृ॒तस्य॑ प्र॒शिषो॒ नवी॑यसीः॒ पति॒र्जनी॑ना॒मुप॑ याति निष्कृ॒तम्
verses.transliteration: sá sū́ryasya raśmíbhiḥ pári vyata  tántuṃ tanvānás trivŕ̥taṃ yáthā vidé  náyann r̥tásya praśíṣo návīyasīḥ  pátir jánīnām úpa yāti niṣkr̥tám

translation.text: He hath assumed the rays of Sûrya for his robe, spinning, as he knows bow, the triply-twisted thread. He, guiding to the newest rules of Holy Law, comes as the Women's Consort to the special place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: राजा॒ सिन्धू॑नां पवते॒ पति॑र्दि॒व ऋ॒तस्य॑ याति प॒थिभिः॒ कनि॑क्रदत् स॒हस्र॑धारः॒ परि॑ षिच्यते॒ हरिः॑ पुना॒नो वाचं॑ ज॒नय॒न्नुपा॑वसुः
verses.transliteration: rā́jā síndhūnām pavate pátir diváḥ-  r̥tásya yāti pathíbhiḥ kánikradat  sahásradhāraḥ pári ṣicyate háriḥ  punānó vā́caṃ janáyann úpāvasuḥ

translation.text: On flows the King of rivers and the Lord of heaven: he follows with a shout the paths of Holy Law. The Golden-hued is poured forth, with his hundred streams, Wealth-bringer, lifting up his voice while purified.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑मान॒ मह्यर्णो॒ वि धा॑वसि॒ सूरो॒ न चि॒त्रो अव्य॑यानि॒ पव्य॑या गभ॑स्तिपूतो॒ नृभि॒रद्रि॑भिः सु॒तो म॒हे वाजा॑य॒ धन्या॑य धन्वसि
verses.transliteration: pávamāna máhy árṇo ví dhāvasi  sū́ro ná citró ávyayāni pávyayā  gábhastipūto nŕ̥bhir ádribhiḥ sutó  mahé vā́jāya dhányāya dhanvasi

translation.text: Fain to be cleansed, thou, Pavamâna, pourest out, like wondrous Sûrya, through the fleece, an ample sea. Purified with the hands, pressed by the men with stones, thou speedest on to mighty booty-bringing war.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इष॒मूर्जं॑ पवमाना॒भ्य॑र्षसि श्ये॒नो न वंसु॑ क॒लशे॑षु सीदसि इन्द्रा॑य॒ मद्वा॒ मद्यो॒ मदः॑ सु॒तो दि॒वो वि॑ष्ट॒म्भ उ॑प॒मो वि॑चक्ष॒णः
verses.transliteration: íṣam ū́rjam pavamānābhy àrṣasi  śyenó ná váṃsu kaláśeṣu sīdasi  índrāya mádvā mádyo mádaḥ sutó  divó viṣṭambhá upamó vicakṣaṇáḥ

translation.text: Thou, Pavamâna, sendest food and power in streams. thou sittest in the beakers as a hawk on trees, For Indra poured as cheering juice to make him glad, as nearest and farseeing bearer-up of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त स्वसा॑रो अ॒भि मा॒तरः॒ शिशुं॒ नवं॑ जज्ञा॒नं जेन्यं॑ विप॒श्चित॑म् अ॒पां ग॑न्ध॒र्वं दि॒व्यं नृ॒चक्ष॑सं॒ सोमं॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य रा॒जसे॑
verses.transliteration: saptá svásāro abhí mātáraḥ śíśuṃ  návaṃ jajñānáṃ jényaṃ vipaścítam  apā́ṃ gandharváṃ divyáṃ nr̥cákṣasaṃ  sómaṃ víśvasya bhúvanasya rājáse

translation.text: The Sisters Seven, the Mothers, stand around the Babe, the noble, new-born Infant, skilled in holy song, Gandharva of the floods, divine, beholding men, Soma, that he may reign as King of all the world.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒शा॒न इ॒मा भुव॑नानि॒ वीय॑से युजा॒न इ॑न्दो ह॒रितः॑ सुप॒र्ण्यः॑ तास्ते॑ क्षरन्तु॒ मधु॑मद्घृ॒तं पय॒स्तव॑ व्र॒ते सो॑म तिष्ठन्तु कृ॒ष्टयः॑
verses.transliteration: īśāná imā́ bhúvanāni vī́yase  yujāná indo harítaḥ suparṇyàḥ  tā́s te kṣarantu mádhumad ghr̥tám páyas  táva vraté soma tiṣṭhantu kr̥ṣṭáyaḥ

translation.text: As Sovran Lord thereof thou Passest through these worlds, O Indu, harnessing thy tawny wellwinged Mares. May they pour forth for thee milk and oil rich in sweets: O Soma, let the folk abide in thy decree.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नृ॒चक्षा॑ असि सोम वि॒श्वतः॒ पव॑मान वृषभ॒ ता वि धा॑वसि स नः॑ पवस्व॒ वसु॑म॒द्धिर॑ण्यवद्व॒यं स्या॑म॒ भुव॑नेषु जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ nr̥cákṣā asi soma viśvátaḥ  pávamāna vr̥ṣabha tā́ ví dhāvasi  sá naḥ pavasva vásumad dhíraṇyavad  vayáṃ syāma bhúvaneṣu jīváse

translation.text: O Soma, thou beholdest men from every side: O Pavamâna, Steer, thou wanderest through these. Pour out upon us wealth in treasure and in gold: may we have strength to live among the things that be.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गो॒वित्प॑वस्व वसु॒विद्धि॑रण्य॒विद्रे॑तो॒धा इ॑न्दो॒ भुव॑ने॒ष्वर्पि॑तः त्वं सु॒वीरो॑ असि सोम विश्व॒वित्तं त्वा॒ विप्रा॒ उप॑ गि॒रेम आ॑सते
verses.transliteration: govít pavasva vasuvíd dhiraṇyavíd  retodhā́ indo bhúvaneṣv árpitaḥ  tváṃ suvī́ro asi soma viśvavít  táṃ tvā víprā úpa girémá āsate

translation.text: Winner of gold and goods and cattle flow thou on, set as impregner, Indu, mid the worlds of life. Rich in brave men art thou, Soma, who winnest all: these holy singers wait upon thee with the song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उन्मध्व॑ ऊ॒र्मिर्व॒नना॑ अतिष्ठिपद॒पो वसा॑नो महि॒षो वि गा॑हते राजा॑ प॒वित्र॑रथो॒ वाज॒मारु॑हत्स॒हस्र॑भृष्टिर्जयति॒ श्रवो॑ बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: ún mádhva ūrmír vanánā atiṣṭhipad  apó vásāno mahiṣó ví gāhate  rā́jā pavítraratho vā́jam ā́ruhat  sahásrabhr̥ṣṭir jayati śrávo br̥hát

translation.text: The wave of flowing meath hath wakened up desires: the Steer enrobed in milk plunges into the streams. Borne on his chariot-sieve the King hath risen to war, and with a thousand rays hath won him high renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स भ॒न्दना॒ उदि॑यर्ति प्र॒जाव॑तीर्वि॒श्वायु॒र्विश्वाः॑ सु॒भरा॒ अह॑र्दिवि ब्रह्म॑ प्र॒जाव॑द्र॒यिमश्व॑पस्त्यं पी॒त इ॑न्द॒विन्द्र॑म॒स्मभ्यं॑ याचतात्
verses.transliteration: sá bhandánā úd iyarti prajā́vatīr  viśvā́yur víśvāḥ subhárā áhardivi  bráhma prajā́vad rayím áśvapastyam  pītá indav índram asmábhyaṃ yācatāt

translation.text: Dear to all life, he sends triumphant praises forth, abundant, bringing offspring, each succeeding day. From Indra crave for us, Indu, when thou art quaffed, the blessing that gives children, wealth that harbours steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सो अग्रे॒ अह्नां॒ हरि॑र्हर्य॒तो मदः॒ प्र चेत॑सा चेतयते॒ अनु॒ द्युभिः॑ द्वा जना॑ या॒तय॑न्न॒न्तरी॑यते॒ नरा॑ च॒ शंसं॒ दैव्यं॑ च ध॒र्तरि॑
verses.transliteration: só ágre áhnāṃ hárir haryató mádaḥ  prá cétasā cetayate ánu dyúbhiḥ  dvā́ jánā yātáyann antár īyate  nárā ca śáṃsaṃ daívyaṃ ca dhartári

translation.text: When days begin, the strong juice, lovely, golden-hued, is recognized by wisdom more and more each day, He, stirring both the Races, goes between the two, the bearer of the word of men and word of Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ञ्जते॒ व्य॑ञ्जते॒ सम॑ञ्जते॒ क्रतुं॑ रिहन्ति॒ मधु॑ना॒भ्य॑ञ्जते सिन्धो॑रुच्छ्वा॒से प॒तय॑न्तमु॒क्षणं॑ हिरण्यपा॒वाः प॒शुमा॑सु गृभ्णते
verses.transliteration: añjáte vy àñjate sám añjate  krátuṃ rihanti mádhunābhy àñjate  síndhor ucchvāsé patáyantam ukṣáṇaṃ  hiraṇyapāvā́ḥ paśúm āsu gr̥bhṇate

translation.text: They balm him, balm him over balm him thoroughly, caress the mighty strength and balm it with the meath. They seize the flying Steer at the stream's breathing-place: cleansing with gold they grasp the Animal herein.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒प॒श्चिते॒ पव॑मानाय गायत म॒ही न धारात्यन्धो॑ अर्षति अहि॒र्न जू॒र्णामति॑ सर्पति॒ त्वच॒मत्यो॒ न क्रीळ॑न्नसर॒द्वृषा॒ हरिः॑
verses.transliteration: vipaścíte pávamānāya gāyata  mahī́ ná dhā́rā́ty ándho arṣati  áhir ná jūrṇā́m áti sarpati tvácam  átyo ná krī́ḷann asarad vŕ̥ṣā háriḥ

translation.text: Sing forth to Pavamâna skilled in holy song: the juice is flowing onward like a mighty stream. He.glideth like a serpent from his ancient skin, and like a playful horse the Tawny Steer hath run.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्रे॒गो राजाप्य॑स्तविष्यते वि॒मानो॒ अह्नां॒ भुव॑ने॒ष्वर्पि॑तः हरि॑र्घृ॒तस्नुः॑ सु॒दृशी॑को अर्ण॒वो ज्यो॒तीर॑थः पवते रा॒य ओ॒क्यः॑
verses.transliteration: agregó rā́jā́pyas taviṣyate  vimā́no áhnām bhúvaneṣv árpitaḥ  hárir ghr̥tásnuḥ sudŕ̥śīko arṇavó  jyotī́rathaḥ pavate rāyá okyàḥ

translation.text: Dweller in floods, King, foremost, he displays his might, set among living things as measurer of days. Distilling oil he flows, fair, billowy, golden-hued, borne on a car of light, sharing one hom-e with wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस॑र्जि स्क॒म्भो दि॒व उद्य॑तो॒ मदः॒ परि॑ त्रि॒धातु॒र्भुव॑नान्यर्षति अं॒शुं रि॑हन्ति म॒तयः॒ पनि॑प्नतं गि॒रा यदि॑ नि॒र्णिज॑मृ॒ग्मिणो॑ य॒युः
verses.transliteration: ásarji skambhó divá údyato mádaḥ  pári tridhā́tur bhúvanāny arṣati  aṃśúṃ rihanti matáyaḥ pánipnataṃ  girā́ yádi nirṇíjam r̥gmíṇo yayúḥ

translation.text: Loosed is the heavens! support, the uplifted cheering juice: the triply-mingled draught flows round into the worlds. The holy hymns caress the stalk that claims our praise, when singers have approached his beauteous robe with song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॒ धारा॒ अत्यण्वा॑नि मे॒ष्यः॑ पुना॒नस्य॑ सं॒यतो॑ यन्ति॒ रंह॑यः यद्गोभि॑रिन्दो च॒म्वोः॑ सम॒ज्यस॒ आ सु॑वा॒नः सो॑म क॒लशे॑षु सीदसि
verses.transliteration: prá te dhā́rā áty áṇvāni meṣyàḥ  punānásya saṃyáto yanti ráṃhayaḥ  yád góbhir indo camvòḥ samajyáse-  ā́ suvānáḥ soma kaláśeṣu sīdasi

translation.text: Thy strearns that flow forth rapidly collected run over the fine fleece of the sheep as thou art cleansed. When, Indu, thou art. balmed with milk within the bowl, thou sinkest in the jars, O Soma, when expressed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व सोम क्रतु॒विन्न॑ उ॒क्थ्योऽव्यो॒ वारे॒ परि॑ धाव॒ मधु॑ प्रि॒यम् ज॒हि विश्वा॑न्र॒क्षस॑ इन्दो अ॒त्रिणो॑ बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: pávasva soma kratuvín na ukthyàḥ-  -ávyo vā́re pári dhāva mádhu priyám  jahí víśvān rakṣása indo atríṇo  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: Winner of' power, flow, Soma, worthy of our laud: run onward to the fleece as well-beloved meath. Destroy, O Indu, all voracious Raksasas. With brave sons in the assembly let our speech be bold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र तु द्र॑व॒ परि॒ कोशं॒ नि षी॑द॒ नृभिः॑ पुना॒नो अ॒भि वाज॑मर्ष अश्वं॒ न त्वा॑ वा॒जिनं॑ म॒र्जय॒न्तोऽच्छा॑ ब॒र्ही र॑श॒नाभि॑र्नयन्ति
verses.transliteration: prá tú drava pári kóśaṃ ní ṣīda  nŕ̥bhiḥ punānó abhí vā́jam arṣa  áśvaṃ ná tvā vājínam marjáyantaḥ-  -áchā barhī́ raśanā́bhir nayanti

translation.text: RUN onward to the reservoir and seat thee: cleansed by the men speed forward to the battle. Making thee beauteous like an able courser, forth to the sacred grass with reins they lead thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वा॒यु॒धः प॑वते दे॒व इन्दु॑रशस्ति॒हा वृ॒जनं॒ रक्ष॑माणः पि॒ता दे॒वानां॑ जनि॒ता सु॒दक्षो॑ विष्ट॒म्भो दि॒वो ध॒रुणः॑ पृथि॒व्याः
verses.transliteration: svāyudháḥ pavate devá índur  aśastihā́ vr̥jánaṃ rákṣamāṇaḥ  pitā́ devā́nāṃ janitā́ sudákṣo  viṣṭambhó divó dharúṇaḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ

translation.text: Indu, the well-armed God, is flowing onward, who quells the curse and guards from treacherous onslaught, Father, begetter of the Gods, most skilful, the buttress of the heavens and earth's supporter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋषि॒र्विप्रः॑ पुरए॒ता जना॑नामृ॒भुर्धीर॑ उ॒शना॒ काव्ये॑न स चि॑द्विवेद॒ निहि॑तं॒ यदा॑सामपी॒च्यं१॒॑ गुह्यं॒ नाम॒ गोना॑म्
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥ṣir vípraḥ puraetā́ jánānām  r̥bhúr dhī́ra uśánā kā́vyena  sá cid viveda níhitaṃ yád āsām  apīcyàṃ gúhyaṃ nā́ma gónām

translation.text: R̥ishi and Sage, the Champion of the people, cleft and sagacious, Uṣanâ in wisdom, He hath discovered even their hidden nature, the Cows' concealed and most mysterious title.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्य ते॒ मधु॑माँ इन्द्र॒ सोमो॒ वृषा॒ वृष्णे॒ परि॑ प॒वित्रे॑ अक्षाः स॒ह॒स्र॒साः श॑त॒सा भू॑रि॒दावा॑ शश्वत्त॒मं ब॒र्हिरा वा॒ज्य॑स्थात्
verses.transliteration: eṣá syá te mádhumām̐ indra sómo  vŕ̥ṣā vŕ̥ṣṇe pári pavítre akṣāḥ  sahasrasā́ḥ śatasā́ bhūridā́vā  śaśvattamám barhír ā́ vājy àsthāt

translation.text: This thine own Soma rich in meath, O Indra, Steer for the Steer, hath flowed into the filter. The strong Free-giver, winning hundreds, thousands, hath reached the holy grass that never fails him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते सोमा॑ अ॒भि ग॒व्या स॒हस्रा॑ म॒हे वाजा॑या॒मृता॑य॒ श्रवां॑सि प॒वित्रे॑भिः॒ पव॑माना असृग्रञ्छ्रव॒स्यवो॒ न पृ॑त॒नाजो॒ अत्याः॑
verses.transliteration: eté sómā abhí gavyā́ sahásrā  mahé vā́jāyāmŕ̥tāya śrávāṃsi  pavítrebhiḥ pávamānā asr̥grañ  -śravasyávo ná pr̥tanā́jo átyāḥ

translation.text: These Somas are for wealth of countless cattle, renown therefor, and mighty strength immortal. These have been sent forth, urified by strainers, like steeds who rusg to battle fain for glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ हि ष्मा॑ पुरुहू॒तो जना॑नां॒ विश्वास॑र॒द्भोज॑ना पू॒यमा॑नः अथा भ॑र श्येनभृत॒ प्रयां॑सि र॒यिं तुञ्जा॑नो अ॒भि वाज॑मर्ष
verses.transliteration: pári hí ṣmā puruhūtó jánānāṃ  víśvā́sarad bhójanā pūyámānaḥ  áthā́ bhara śyenabhr̥ta práyāṃsi  rayíṃ túñjāno abhí vā́jam arṣa

translation.text: He, while he cleanses him, invoked of many, hath flowed to give the people all enjoyment. Thou whom the Falcon brought, bring, dainty viands, bestir thyself and send us wealth and booty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष सु॑वा॒नः परि॒ सोमः॑ प॒वित्रे॒ सर्गो॒ न सृ॒ष्टो अ॑दधाव॒दर्वा॑ ति॒ग्मे शिशा॑नो महि॒षो न शृङ्गे॒ गा ग॒व्यन्न॒भि शूरो॒ न सत्वा॑
verses.transliteration: eṣá suvānáḥ pári sómaḥ pavítre  sárgo ná sr̥ṣṭó adadhāvad árvā  tigmé śíśāno mahiṣó ná śŕ̥ṅge  gā́ gavyánn abhí śū́ro ná sátvā

translation.text: This Soma, pressed into the cleansing filter, hath run as 'twere a host let loose, the Courser; Like a strong bull who whets his horns kpen-pointed, like a brave warrior in the fray for cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा य॑यौ पर॒माद॒न्तरद्रेः॒ कूचि॑त्स॒तीरू॒र्वे गा वि॑वेद दि॒वो न वि॒द्युत्स्त॒नय॑न्त्य॒भ्रैः सोम॑स्य ते पवत इन्द्र॒ धारा॑
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ yayau paramā́d antár ádreḥ  kū́cit satī́r ūrvé gā́ viveda  divó ná vidyút stanáyanty abhraíḥ  sómasya te pavata indra dhā́rā

translation.text: He issued forth from out the loftiest mountain, and found kine hidden somewhere in a stable. Soma's stream clears itself for thee, O Indra, like lightning thundering through the clouds of heaven,

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्म॑ रा॒शिं परि॑ यासि॒ गोना॒मिन्द्रे॑ण सोम स॒रथं॑ पुना॒नः पू॒र्वीरिषो॑ बृह॒तीर्जी॑रदानो॒ शिक्षा॑ शचीव॒स्तव॒ ता उ॑प॒ष्टुत्
verses.transliteration: utá sma rāśím pári yāsi gónām  índreṇa soma sarátham punānáḥ  pūrvī́r íṣo br̥hatī́r jīradāno  śíkṣā śacīvas táva tā́ upaṣṭút

translation.text: Cleansing thyselr, and borne along with Indra, Soma, thou goest round the herd of cattle. May thy praise help us, Mighty One, prompt Giver, to the full ample food which thou bestowest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं सोम॑ इन्द्र॒ तुभ्यं॑ सुन्वे॒ तुभ्यं॑ पवते॒ त्वम॑स्य पाहि त्वं ह॒ यं च॑कृ॒षे त्वं व॑वृ॒ष इन्दुं॒ मदा॑य॒ युज्या॑य॒ सोम॑म्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ sóma indra túbhyaṃ sunve-  túbhyam pavate tvám asya pāhi  tváṃ ha yáṃ cakr̥ṣé tváṃ vavr̥ṣé-  índum mádāya yújyāya sómam

translation.text: FOR thee this Soma is effused, O Indra: drink of this juice; for thee the stream is flowing- Soma, which thou thyself hast made and chosen, even Indu, for thy special drink to cheer thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स ईं॒ रथो॒ न भु॑रि॒षाळ॑योजि म॒हः पु॒रूणि॑ सा॒तये॒ वसू॑नि आदीं॒ विश्वा॑ नहु॒ष्या॑णि जा॒ता स्व॑र्षाता॒ वन॑ ऊ॒र्ध्वा न॑वन्त
verses.transliteration: sá īṃ rátho ná bhuriṣā́ḷ ayoji  maháḥ purū́ṇi sātáye vásūni  ā́d īṃ víśvā nahuṣyā̀ṇi jātā́  svàrṣātā vána ūrdhvā́ navanta

translation.text: Like a capacious car hath it been harnessed, the Mighty; to acquire abundant treasures. Then in the sacrifice they celebrated all triumphs won by Nahus in the battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒युर्न यो नि॒युत्वाँ॑ इ॒ष्टया॑मा॒ नास॑त्येव॒ हव॒ आ शम्भ॑विष्ठः वि॒श्ववा॑रो द्रविणो॒दा इ॑व॒ त्मन्पू॒षेव॑ धी॒जव॑नोऽसि सोम
verses.transliteration: vāyúr ná yó niyútvām̐ iṣṭáyāmā  nā́satyeva háva ā́ śámbhaviṣṭhaḥ  viśvávāro draviṇodā́ iva tmán  pūṣéva dhījávano 'si soma

translation.text: Like Vâyu with his team, moving at pleasure, most gracious when invoked like both Nâsatyas, Thou art thyself like the Wealth-Giver, Soma! who grants all boons, like song-inspiring Pûshan.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॒ न यो म॒हा कर्मा॑णि॒ चक्रि॑र्ह॒न्ता वृ॒त्राणा॑मसि सोम पू॒र्भित् पै॒द्वो न हि त्वमहि॑नाम्नां ह॒न्ता विश्व॑स्यासि सोम॒ दस्योः॑
verses.transliteration: índro ná yó mahā́ kármāṇi cákrir  hantā́ vr̥trā́ṇām asi soma pūrbhít  paidvó ná hí tvám áhināmnāṃ  hantā́ víśvasyāsi soma dásyoḥ

translation.text: Like Indra who hath done great deeds, thou, Soma, art slayer of the Vr̥itras, Fort-destroyer. Like Pedu's horse who killed the brood of serpents, thus thou, O Soma, slayest every Dasyu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्न यो वन॒ आ सृ॒ज्यमा॑नो॒ वृथा॒ पाजां॑सि कृणुते न॒दीषु॑ जनो॒ न युध्वा॑ मह॒त उ॑प॒ब्दिरिय॑र्ति॒ सोमः॒ पव॑मान ऊ॒र्मिम्
verses.transliteration: agnír ná yó vána ā́ sr̥jyámāno  vŕ̥thā pā́jāṃsi kr̥ṇute nadī́ṣu  jáno ná yúdhvā mahatá upabdír  íyarti sómaḥ pávamāna ūrmím

translation.text: Like Agni loosed amid the forest, fiercely he winneth splendour in the running waters. Like one who fights, the roaring of the mighty, thus Soma Pavamâna sends his current.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते सोमा॒ अति॒ वारा॒ण्यव्या॑ दि॒व्या न कोशा॑सो अ॒भ्रव॑र्षाः वृथा॑ समु॒द्रं सिन्ध॑वो॒ न नीचीः॑ सु॒तासो॑ अ॒भि क॒लशाँ॑ असृग्रन्
verses.transliteration: eté sómā áti vā́rāṇy ávyā  divyā́ ná kóśāso abhrávarṣāḥ  vŕ̥thā samudráṃ síndhavo ná nī́cīḥ  sutā́so abhí kaláśām̐ asr̥gran

translation.text: These Somas passing through the fleecy filter, like rain descending from the clouds of heaven, Have been effused and poured into the beakers, swiftly like rivers running lowly seaward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒ष्मी शर्धो॒ न मारु॑तं पव॒स्वान॑भिशस्ता दि॒व्या यथा॒ विट् आपो॒ न म॒क्षू सु॑म॒तिर्भ॑वा नः स॒हस्रा॑प्साः पृतना॒षाण्न य॒ज्ञः
verses.transliteration: śuṣmī́ śárdho ná mā́rutam pavasva-  -ánabhiśastā divyā́ yáthā víṭ  ā́po ná makṣū́ sumatír bhavā naḥ  sahásrāpsāḥ pr̥tanāṣā́ṇ ná yajñáḥ

translation.text: Flow onward like the potent band of Maruts, like that Celestial Host whom none revileth. Quickly be gracious unto us like waters, like sacrifice victorious, thousand-fashioned.

verses.sanskrit_deva: राज्ञो॒ नु ते॒ वरु॑णस्य व्र॒तानि॑ बृ॒हद्ग॑भी॒रं तव॑ सोम॒ धाम॑ शुचि॒ष्ट्वम॑सि प्रि॒यो न मि॒त्रो द॒क्षाय्यो॑ अर्य॒मेवा॑सि सोम
verses.transliteration: rā́jño nú te váruṇasya vratā́ni  br̥hád gabhīráṃ táva soma dhā́ma  śúciṣ ṭvám asi priyó ná mitró  dakṣā́yyo aryamévāsi soma

translation.text: Thine are King Varuṇa's eternal statutes, lofty and deep, O Soma, is thy glory. All-pure art thou like Mitra the beloved, adorable, like Aryaman, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रो स्य वह्निः॑ प॒थ्या॑भिरस्यान्दि॒वो न वृ॒ष्टिः पव॑मानो अक्षाः स॒हस्र॑धारो असद॒न्न्य१॒॑स्मे मा॒तुरु॒पस्थे॒ वन॒ आ च॒ सोमः॑
verses.transliteration: pró syá váhniḥ pathyā̀bhir asyān  divó ná vr̥ṣṭíḥ pávamāno akṣāḥ  sahásradhāro asadan ny àsmé  mātúr upásthe vána ā́ ca sómaḥ

translation.text: THIS Chariot-horse hath moved along the pathways, and Pavamâna flowed like rain from heaven. With us hath Soma with a thousand currents sunk in the wood, upon his Mother's bosom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: राजा॒ सिन्धू॑नामवसिष्ट॒ वास॑ ऋ॒तस्य॒ नाव॒मारु॑ह॒द्रजि॑ष्ठाम् अ॒प्सु द्र॒प्सो वा॑वृधे श्ये॒नजू॑तो दु॒ह ईं॑ पि॒ता दु॒ह ईं॑ पि॒तुर्जाम्
verses.transliteration: rā́jā síndhūnām avasiṣṭa vā́saḥ-  r̥tásya nā́vam ā́ruhad rájiṣṭhām  apsú drapsó vāvr̥dhe śyenájūto  duhá īm pitā́ duhá īm pitúr jā́m

translation.text: King, he hath clothed him in the robe of rivers, mounted the straightest-going ship of Order. Sped by the Hawk the drop hath waxed in waters: the father drains it, drains the Father's offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सिं॒हं न॑सन्त॒ मध्वो॑ अ॒यासं॒ हरि॑मरु॒षं दि॒वो अ॒स्य पति॑म् शूरो॑ यु॒त्सु प्र॑थ॒मः पृ॑च्छते॒ गा अस्य॒ चक्ष॑सा॒ परि॑ पात्यु॒क्षा
verses.transliteration: siṃháṃ nasanta mádhvo ayā́saṃ  hárim aruṣáṃ divó asyá pátim  śū́ro yutsú prathamáḥ pr̥chate gā́ḥ-  ásya cákṣasā pári pāty ukṣā́

translation.text: They come to him, red, tawny, Lord of Heaven, the watchful Guardian of the meath, the Lion. First, Hero in the fight, he seeks the cattle, and with his eye the Steer is our protector.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मधु॑पृष्ठं घो॒रम॒यास॒मश्वं॒ रथे॑ युञ्जन्त्युरुच॒क्र ऋ॒ष्वम् स्वसा॑र ईं जा॒मयो॑ मर्जयन्ति॒ सना॑भयो वा॒जिन॑मूर्जयन्ति
verses.transliteration: mádhupr̥ṣṭhaṃ ghorám ayā́sam áśvaṃ  ráthe yuñjanty urucakrá r̥ṣvám  svásāra īṃ jāmáyo marjayanti  sánābhayo vājínam ūrjayanti

translation.text: They harness to the broad-wheeled car the mighty Courser whose back bears meath, unwearied, awful. The twins, the sisters brighten him, and strengthen-these children of one damethe vigorous Racer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चत॑स्र ईं घृत॒दुहः॑ सचन्ते समा॒ने अ॒न्तर्ध॒रुणे॒ निष॑त्ताः ता ई॑मर्षन्ति॒ नम॑सा पुना॒नास्ता ईं॑ वि॒श्वतः॒ परि॑ षन्ति पू॒र्वीः
verses.transliteration: cátasra īṃ ghr̥tadúhaḥ sacante  samāné antár dharúṇe níṣattāḥ  tā́ īm arṣanti námasā punānā́s  tā́ īṃ viśvátaḥ pári ṣanti pūrvī́ḥ

translation.text: Four pouring out the holy oil attend him, sitting together in the same container. To him they flow, when purified, with homage, and still, from every side, are first about him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒ष्ट॒म्भो दि॒वो ध॒रुणः॑ पृथि॒व्या विश्वा॑ उ॒त क्षि॒तयो॒ हस्ते॑ अस्य अस॑त्त॒ उत्सो॑ गृण॒ते नि॒युत्वा॒न्मध्वो॑ अं॒शुः प॑वत इन्द्रि॒याय॑
verses.transliteration: viṣṭambhó divó dharúṇaḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  víśvā utá kṣitáyo háste asya  ásat ta útso gr̥ṇaté niyútvān  mádhvo aṃśúḥ pavata indriyā́ya

translation.text: He is the buttress of the heavens, supporter of earth, and in his hand are all the people. Be the team's Lord a well to thee the singer: cleansed is the sweet plant's stalk for deed of glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒न्वन्नवा॑तो अ॒भि दे॒ववी॑ति॒मिन्द्रा॑य सोम वृत्र॒हा प॑वस्व श॒ग्धि म॒हः पु॑रुश्च॒न्द्रस्य॑ रा॒यः सु॒वीर्य॑स्य॒ पत॑यः स्याम
verses.transliteration: vanvánn ávāto abhí devávītim  índrāya soma vr̥trahā́ pavasva  śagdhí maháḥ puruścandrásya rāyáḥ  suvī́ryasya pátayaḥ syāma

translation.text: Fighting, uninjured come where Gods are feasted; Soma, as Vitra-slayer flow for Indra. Vouchsafe us ample riches very splendid may we be masters of heroic vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र हि॑न्वा॒नो ज॑नि॒ता रोद॑स्यो॒ रथो॒ न वाजं॑ सनि॒ष्यन्न॑यासीत् इन्द्रं॒ गच्छ॒न्नायु॑धा सं॒शिशा॑नो॒ विश्वा॒ वसु॒ हस्त॑योरा॒दधा॑नः
verses.transliteration: prá hinvānó janitā́ ródasyoḥ-  rátho ná vā́jaṃ saniṣyánn ayāsīt  índraṃ gáchann ā́yudhā saṃśíśāno  víśvā vásu hástayor ādádhānaḥ

translation.text: URGED On, the Father of the Earth and Heaven hath gone forth like a car to gather booty, Going to Indra, sharpening his weapons, and in his hand containing every treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्रि॑पृ॒ष्ठं वृष॑णं वयो॒धामा॑ङ्गू॒षाणा॑मवावशन्त॒ वाणीः॑ वना॒ वसा॑नो॒ वरु॑णो॒ न सिन्धू॒न्वि र॑त्न॒धा द॑यते॒ वार्या॑णि
verses.transliteration: abhí tripr̥ṣṭháṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vayodhā́m  āṅgūṣā́ṇām avāvaśanta vā́ṇīḥ  vánā vásāno váruṇo ná síndhūn  ví ratnadhā́ dayate vā́ryāṇi

translation.text: To him the tones of sacred song have sounded, Steer of the triple height, the Life-bestower. Dwelling in wood as Varuṇa in rivers, lavishing treasure he distributes blessings

verses.sanskrit_deva: शूर॑ग्रामः॒ सर्व॑वीरः॒ सहा॑वा॒ञ्जेता॑ पवस्व॒ सनि॑ता॒ धना॑नि ति॒ग्मायु॑धः क्षि॒प्रध॑न्वा स॒मत्स्वषा॑ळ्हः सा॒ह्वान्पृत॑नासु॒ शत्रू॑न्
verses.transliteration: śū́ragrāmaḥ sárvavīraḥ sáhāvāñ  jétā pavasva sánitā dhánāni  tigmā́yudhaḥ kṣiprádhanvā samátsu-  áṣāḷhaḥ sāhvā́n pŕ̥tanāsu śátrūn

translation.text: Great Conqueror, warnor-girt, Lord of all heroes, flow on thy way as he who winneth riches; With sharpened. arms, with swift bow, never vanquished in battle, vanquishing in fight the foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रुग॑व्यूति॒रभ॑यानि कृ॒ण्वन्त्स॑मीची॒ने आ प॑वस्वा॒ पुरं॑धी अ॒पः सिषा॑सन्नु॒षसः॒ स्व१॒॑र्गाः सं चि॑क्रदो म॒हो अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ वाजा॑न्
verses.transliteration: urúgavyūtir ábhayāni kr̥ṇván  samīcīné ā́ pavasvā púraṃdhī  apáḥ síṣāsann uṣásaḥ svàr gā́ḥ  sáṃ cikrado mahó asmábhyaṃ vā́jān

translation.text: Giving security, Lord of wide dominion, send us both earth and heaven with all their fulness. Striving to win the Dawns, the light, the waters, and cattle, call to us abundant vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मत्सि॑ सोम॒ वरु॑णं॒ मत्सि॑ मि॒त्रं मत्सीन्द्र॑मिन्दो पवमान॒ विष्णु॑म् मत्सि॒ शर्धो॒ मारु॑तं॒ मत्सि॑ दे॒वान्मत्सि॑ म॒हामिन्द्र॑मिन्दो॒ मदा॑य
verses.transliteration: mátsi soma váruṇam mátsi mitrám  mátsī́ndram indo pavamāna víṣṇum  mátsi śárdho mā́rutam mátsi devā́n  mátsi mahā́m índram indo mádāya

translation.text: O Soma, gladden Varuṇa and Mitra; cheer, Indu Pavamâna! Indra, Vishṇu. Cheer thou the Gods, the Company of Maruts: Indu, cheer mighty Indra to rejoicing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा राजे॑व॒ क्रतु॑माँ॒ अमे॑न॒ विश्वा॒ घनि॑घ्नद्दुरि॒ता प॑वस्व इन्दो॑ सू॒क्ताय॒ वच॑से॒ वयो॑ धा यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: evā́ rā́jeva krátumām̐ ámena  víśvā ghánighnad duritā́ pavasva  índo sūktā́ya vácase váyo dhāḥ-  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Thus like a wise and potent King flow onward, destroying with thy vigour all misfortunes. For our well-spoken hymn give life, O Indu. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस॑र्जि॒ वक्वा॒ रथ्ये॒ यथा॒जौ धि॒या म॒नोता॑ प्रथ॒मो म॑नी॒षी दश॒ स्वसा॑रो॒ अधि॒ सानो॒ अव्येऽज॑न्ति॒ वह्निं॒ सद॑ना॒न्यच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: ásarji vákvā ráthye yáthājaú  dhiyā́ manótā prathamó manīṣī́  dáśa svásāro ádhi sā́no ávye-  -ájanti váhniṃ sádanāny ácha

translation.text: As for a chariot-race, the skilful Speaker, Chief, Sage, Inventor, hath, with song, been started. The sisters ten upon the fleecy summit drive on the Car-horse to the resting places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वी॒ती जन॑स्य दि॒व्यस्य॑ क॒व्यैरधि॑ सुवा॒नो न॑हु॒ष्ये॑भि॒रिन्दुः॑ प्र यो नृभि॑र॒मृतो॒ मर्त्ये॑भिर्मर्मृजा॒नोऽवि॑भि॒र्गोभि॑र॒द्भिः
verses.transliteration: vītī́ jánasya divyásya kavyaír  ádhi suvānó nahuṣyèbhir índuḥ  prá yó nŕ̥bhir amŕ̥to mártyebhir  marmr̥jānó 'vibhir góbhir adbhíḥ

translation.text: The drop of Soma, pressed by wise Nahushyas, becomes the banquet of the Heavenly People- Indu, by hands of mortal men made beauteous, immortal, with the sheep and cows and waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॒ वृष्णे॒ रोरु॑वदं॒शुर॑स्मै॒ पव॑मानो॒ रुश॑दीर्ते॒ पयो॒ गोः स॒हस्र॒मृक्वा॑ प॒थिभि॑र्वचो॒विद॑ध्व॒स्मभिः॒ सूरो॒ अण्वं॒ वि या॑ति
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā vŕ̥ṣṇe róruvad aṃśúr asmai  pávamāno rúśad īrte páyo góḥ  sahásram ŕ̥kvā pathíbhir vacovíd  adhvasmábhiḥ sū́ro áṇvaṃ ví yāti

translation.text: Steer roaring unto Steer, this Pavamâna, this juice runs to the white milk of the milch-cow. Through thousand fine hairs goes the tuneful Singer, like Sura by his fair and open pathways.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रु॒जा दृ॒ळ्हा चि॑द्र॒क्षसः॒ सदां॑सि पुना॒न इ॑न्द ऊर्णुहि॒ वि वाजा॑न् वृ॒श्चोपरि॑ष्टात्तुज॒ता व॒धेन॒ ये अन्ति॑ दू॒रादु॑पना॒यमे॑षाम्
verses.transliteration: rujā́ dr̥ḷhā́ cid rakṣásaḥ sádāṃsi  punāná inda ūrṇuhi ví vā́jān  vr̥ścópáriṣṭāt tujatā́ vadhéna  yé ánti dūrā́d upanāyám eṣām

translation.text: Break down the, strong seats even of the demons: cleansing thee, Indu, robd thyself in vigour. Rend with thy swift bolt, coming from above them, those who are near and those who yet are distant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स प्र॑त्न॒वन्नव्य॑से विश्ववार सू॒क्ताय॑ प॒थः कृ॑णुहि॒ प्राचः॑ ये दुः॒षहा॑सो व॒नुषा॑ बृ॒हन्त॒स्ताँस्ते॑ अश्याम पुरुकृत्पुरुक्षो
verses.transliteration: sá pratnaván návyase viśvavāra  sūktā́ya patháḥ kr̥ṇuhi prā́caḥ  yé duḥṣáhāso vanúṣā br̥hántas  tā́ṃs te aśyāma purukr̥t purukṣo

translation.text: Prepare the forward paths in ancient manner for the new bymn, thou Giver of all bounties. Those which are high and hard for foes to conquer may we gain from thee, Active! Food-bestower!

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा पु॑ना॒नो अ॒पः स्व१॒॑र्गा अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ तो॒का तन॑यानि॒ भूरि॑ शं नः॒ क्षेत्र॑मु॒रु ज्योतीं॑षि सोम॒ ज्योङ्नः॒ सूर्यं॑ दृ॒शये॑ रिरीहि
verses.transliteration: evā́ punānó apáḥ svàr gā́ḥ-  asmábhyaṃ tokā́ tánayāni bhū́ri  śáṃ naḥ kṣétram urú jyótīṃṣi soma  jyóṅ naḥ sū́ryaṃ dr̥śáye rirīhi

translation.text: So purifying thee vouchsafe us waters, heaven's light, and cows, offspring and many children. Give us health, ample land, and lights, O Soma, and grant us long to look upon the sunshine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ सुवा॒नो हरि॑रं॒शुः प॒वित्रे॒ रथो॒ न स॑र्जि स॒नये॑ हिया॒नः आप॒च्छ्लोक॑मिन्द्रि॒यं पू॒यमा॑नः॒ प्रति॑ दे॒वाँ अ॑जुषत॒ प्रयो॑भिः
verses.transliteration: pári suvānó hárir aṃśúḥ pavítre  rátho ná sarji sanáye hiyānáḥ  ā́pac chlókam indriyám pūyámānaḥ  práti devā́m̐ ajuṣata práyobhiḥ

translation.text: THE gold-hued juice, poured out upon the filter, is started like a car sent forth to conquer. He hath gained song and vigour while they cleansed him, and hath rejoiced the Gods with entertainments.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॑ नृ॒चक्षा॑ असरत्प॒वित्रे॒ नाम॒ दधा॑नः क॒विर॑स्य॒ योनौ॑ सीद॒न्होते॑व॒ सद॑ने च॒मूषूपे॑मग्म॒न्नृष॑यः स॒प्त विप्राः॑
verses.transliteration: áchā nr̥cákṣā asarat pavítre  nā́ma dádhānaḥ kavír asya yónau  sī́dan hóteva sádane camū́ṣu-  -úpem agmann ŕ̥ṣayaḥ saptá víprāḥ

translation.text: He who beholdeth man hath reached the filter: bearing his name, the Sage hath sought his dwelling. The R̥ishis came to him, seven holy singers, when in the bowls he settled as Invoker.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सु॑मे॒धा गा॑तु॒विद्वि॒श्वदे॑वः॒ सोमः॑ पुना॒नः सद॑ एति॒ नित्य॑म् भुव॒द्विश्वे॑षु॒ काव्ये॑षु॒ रन्तानु॒ जना॑न्यतते॒ पञ्च॒ धीरः॑
verses.transliteration: prá sumedhā́ gātuvíd viśvádevaḥ  sómaḥ punānáḥ sáda eti nítyam  bhúvad víśveṣu kā́vyeṣu rántā-  -ánu jánān yatate páñca dhī́raḥ

translation.text: Shared by all Gods, mobt wise, propitious, Soma goes, while they cleanse him, to his constant station. Let him rejoice in all his lofty wisdom to the Five Tribes the Sage attains with labour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॒ त्ये सो॑म पवमान नि॒ण्ये विश्वे॑ दे॒वास्त्रय॑ एकाद॒शासः॑ दश॑ स्व॒धाभि॒रधि॒ सानो॒ अव्ये॑ मृ॒जन्ति॑ त्वा न॒द्यः॑ स॒प्त य॒ह्वीः
verses.transliteration: táva tyé soma pavamāna niṇyé  víśve devā́s tráya ekādaśā́saḥ  dáśa svadhā́bhir ádhi sā́no ávye  mr̥jánti tvā nadyàḥ saptá yahvī́ḥ

translation.text: In thy mysterious place, O Pavamâna Soma, are all the Gods, the Thrice-Eleven. Ten on the fleecy height, themselves, self-prompted, and seven fresh rivers, brighten and adorn thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्नु स॒त्यं पव॑मानस्यास्तु॒ यत्र॒ विश्वे॑ का॒रवः॑ सं॒नस॑न्त ज्योति॒र्यदह्ने॒ अकृ॑णोदु लो॒कं प्राव॒न्मनुं॒ दस्य॑वे कर॒भीक॑म्
verses.transliteration: tán nú satyám pávamānasyāstu  yátra víśve kārávaḥ saṃnásanta  jyótir yád áhne ákr̥ṇod ulokám  prā́van mánuṃ dásyave kar abhī́kam

translation.text: Now let this be the truth of Pavamâna, there where all singers gather them together, That he hath given us room and made the daylight, hath holpen Manu and repelled the Dasyu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ सद्मे॑व पशु॒मान्ति॒ होता॒ राजा॒ न स॒त्यः समि॑तीरिया॒नः सोमः॑ पुना॒नः क॒लशाँ॑ अयासी॒त्सीद॑न्मृ॒गो न म॑हि॒षो वने॑षु
verses.transliteration: pári sádmeva paśumā́nti hótā  rā́jā ná satyáḥ sámitīr iyānáḥ  sómaḥ punānáḥ kaláśām̐ ayāsīt  sī́dan mr̥gó ná mahiṣó váneṣu

translation.text: As the priest seeks the station rich in cattle, like a true King who goes to great assemblies, Soma hath sought the beakers while they cleansed him, and like a wild bull, in the wood hath settled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒क॒मुक्षो॑ मर्जयन्त॒ स्वसा॑रो॒ दश॒ धीर॑स्य धी॒तयो॒ धनु॑त्रीः हरिः॒ पर्य॑द्रव॒ज्जाः सूर्य॑स्य॒ द्रोणं॑ ननक्षे॒ अत्यो॒ न वा॒जी
verses.transliteration: sākamúkṣo marjayanta svásāro  dáśa dhī́rasya dhītáyo dhánutrīḥ  háriḥ páry adravaj jā́ḥ sū́ryasya  dróṇaṃ nanakṣe átyo ná vājī́

translation.text: TEN sisters, pouring out the rain together, swift-moving thinkers of the sage, adorn him. Hither hath run the gold-hued Child of Sûrya and reached the vat like a fleet vigorous courser.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं मा॒तृभि॒र्न शिशु॑र्वावशा॒नो वृषा॑ दधन्वे पुरु॒वारो॑ अ॒द्भिः मर्यो॒ न योषा॑म॒भि नि॑ष्कृ॒तं यन्त्सं ग॑च्छते क॒लश॑ उ॒स्रिया॑भिः
verses.transliteration: sám mātŕ̥bhir ná śíśur vāvaśānó  vŕ̥ṣā dadhanve puruvā́ro adbhíḥ  máryo ná yóṣām abhí niṣkr̥táṃ yán  sáṃ gachate kaláśa usríyābhiḥ

translation.text: Even as a youngling crying to his mothers, the bounteous Steer hath flowed along to waters. As youth to damsel, so with milk he hastens on to the. chose meeting-place, the beaker.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त प्र पि॑प्य॒ ऊध॒रघ्न्या॑या॒ इन्दु॒र्धारा॑भिः सचते सुमे॒धाः मू॒र्धानं॒ गावः॒ पय॑सा च॒मूष्व॒भि श्री॑णन्ति॒ वसु॑भि॒र्न नि॒क्तैः
verses.transliteration: utá prá pipya ū́dhar ághnyāyāḥ-  índur dhā́rābhiḥ sacate sumedhā́ḥ  mūrdhā́naṃ gā́vaḥ páyasā camū́ṣu-  abhí śrīṇanti vásubhir ná niktaíḥ

translation.text: Yea, swollen is the udder of the milch-cow: thither in streams goes very sapient Indu. The kine make ready, as with new-washed treasures, the Head and Chief with milk within the vessels.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ दे॒वेभिः॑ पवमान र॒देन्दो॑ र॒यिम॒श्विनं॑ वावशा॒नः र॒थि॒रा॒यता॑मुश॒ती पुरं॑धिरस्म॒द्र्य१॒॑गा दा॒वने॒ वसू॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: sá no devébhiḥ pavamāna rada-  -índo rayím aśvínaṃ vāvaśānáḥ  rathirāyátām uśatī́ púraṃdhir  asmadryàg ā́ dāváne vásūnām

translation.text: With all the Gods, O Indu Pavamâna, while thou art roaring send us wealth in horses. Hither upon her car come willing Plenty, inclined to us, to give us of her treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू नो॑ र॒यिमुप॑ मास्व नृ॒वन्तं॑ पुना॒नो वा॒ताप्यं॑ वि॒श्वश्च॑न्द्रम् प्र व॑न्दि॒तुरि॑न्दो ता॒र्यायुः॑ प्रा॒तर्म॒क्षू धि॒याव॑सुर्जगम्यात्
verses.transliteration: nū́ no rayím úpa māsva nr̥vántam  punānó vātā́pyaṃ viśváścandram  prá vanditúr indo tāry ā́yuḥ  prātár makṣū́ dhiyā́vasur jagamyāt

translation.text: Now unto us mete riches, while they cleansethee, all-glorious, swelling wealth, with store of heroes. Long be his life who worships, thee, O Indu. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधि॒ यद॑स्मिन्वा॒जिनी॑व॒ शुभः॒ स्पर्ध॑न्ते॒ धियः॒ सूर्ये॒ न विशः॑ अ॒पो वृ॑णा॒नः प॑वते कवी॒यन्व्र॒जं न प॑शु॒वर्ध॑नाय॒ मन्म॑
verses.transliteration: ádhi yád asmin vājínīva śúbhaḥ-  spárdhante dhíyaḥ sū́rye ná víśaḥ  apó vr̥ṇānáḥ pavate kavīyán  vrajáṃ ná paśuvárdhanāya mánma

translation.text: WHEN beauties strive for him as for a charger, then strive the songs like soldiers for the sunlight. Acting the Sage, he flows enrobed in waters and song as 'twere a stall that kine may prosper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वि॒ता व्यू॒र्ण्वन्न॒मृत॑स्य॒ धाम॑ स्व॒र्विदे॒ भुव॑नानि प्रथन्त धियः॑ पिन्वा॒नाः स्वस॑रे॒ न गाव॑ ऋता॒यन्ती॑र॒भि वा॑वश्र॒ इन्दु॑म्
verses.transliteration: dvitā́ vyūrṇvánn amŕ̥tasya dhā́ma  svarvíde bhúvanāni prathanta  dhíyaḥ pinvānā́ḥ svásare ná gā́vaḥ-  r̥tāyántīr abhí vāvaśra índum

translation.text: The worlds expand to hirn who from aforetime found light to spread the law of life eternal. The swelling songs, like kine within the stable, in deep devotion call aloud on Indu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ यत्क॒विः काव्या॒ भर॑ते॒ शूरो॒ न रथो॒ भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑ दे॒वेषु॒ यशो॒ मर्ता॑य॒ भूष॒न्दक्षा॑य रा॒यः पु॑रु॒भूषु॒ नव्यः॑
verses.transliteration: pári yát kavíḥ kā́vyā bhárate  śū́ro ná rátho bhúvanāni víśvā  devéṣu yáśo mártāya bhū́ṣan  dákṣāya rāyáḥ purubhū́ṣu návyaḥ

translation.text: When the sage bears his holy wisdom round him, like a car visiting all worlds, the Hero, Becoming fame, mid Gods, unto the mortal, wealth to the skilled, worth praise mid the Ever-present,

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रि॒ये जा॒तः श्रि॒य आ निरि॑याय॒ श्रियं॒ वयो॑ जरि॒तृभ्यो॑ दधाति श्रियं॒ वसा॑ना अमृत॒त्वमा॑य॒न्भव॑न्ति स॒त्या स॑मि॒था मि॒तद्रौ॑
verses.transliteration: śriyé jātáḥ śriyá ā́ nír iyāya  śríyaṃ váyo jaritŕ̥bhyo dadhāti  śríyaṃ vásānā amr̥tatvám āyan  bhávanti satyā́ samithā́ mitádrau

translation.text: For glory born be hath come forth to glory: he giveth life and glory to the singers. They, clothed in glory, have become immortal. He, measured in his course, makes frays successful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इष॒मूर्ज॑म॒भ्य१॒॑र्षाश्वं॒ गामु॒रु ज्योतिः॑ कृणुहि॒ मत्सि॑ दे॒वान् विश्वा॑नि॒ हि सु॒षहा॒ तानि॒ तुभ्यं॒ पव॑मान॒ बाध॑से सोम॒ शत्रू॑न्
verses.transliteration: íṣam ū́rjam abhy àrṣā́śvaṃ gā́m  urú jyótiḥ kr̥ṇuhi mátsi devā́n  víśvāni hí suṣáhā tā́ni túbhyam  pávamāna bā́dhase soma śátrūn

translation.text: Stream to us food and vigour, kine and horses: give us broad lights and fill thGods with rapture. All ther are easy things for thee to master thou, Pavamâna Soma, quellest foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कनि॑क्रन्ति॒ हरि॒रा सृ॒ज्यमा॑नः॒ सीद॒न्वन॑स्य ज॒ठरे॑ पुना॒नः नृभि॑र्य॒तः कृ॑णुते नि॒र्णिजं॒ गा अतो॑ म॒तीर्ज॑नयत स्व॒धाभिः॑
verses.transliteration: kánikranti hárir ā́ sr̥jyámānaḥ  sī́dan vánasya jaṭháre punānáḥ  nŕ̥bhir yatáḥ kr̥ṇute nirṇíjaṃ gā́ḥ-  áto matī́r janayata svadhā́bhiḥ

translation.text: Loud neighs the Tawny Steed when started, settling deep in the wooden vessel while they cleanse him. Led by the men he takes the milk for raiment: then shall he, through his powers, engender praisesongs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हरिः॑ सृजा॒नः प॒थ्या॑मृ॒तस्येय॑र्ति॒ वाच॑मरि॒तेव॒ नाव॑म् दे॒वो दे॒वानां॒ गुह्या॑नि॒ नामा॒विष्कृ॑णोति ब॒र्हिषि॑ प्र॒वाचे॑
verses.transliteration: háriḥ sr̥jānáḥ pathyā̀m r̥tásya-  íyarti vā́cam aritéva nā́vam  devó devā́nāṃ gúhyāni nā́ma-  -āvíṣ kr̥ṇoti barhíṣi pravā́ce

translation.text: As one who rows drives on his boat, he, Gold-hued, sends forth his voice, loosed on the path of Order. As God, the secret names of Gods he utters, to be declared on sacred grass more widely.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पामि॒वेदू॒र्मय॒स्तर्तु॑राणाः॒ प्र म॑नी॒षा ई॑रते॒ सोम॒मच्छ॑ न॒म॒स्यन्ती॒रुप॑ च॒ यन्ति॒ सं चा च॑ विशन्त्युश॒तीरु॒शन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: apā́m ivéd ūrmáyas tárturāṇāḥ  prá manīṣā́ īrate sómam ácha  namasyántīr úpa ca yánti sáṃ ca-  -ā́ ca viśanty uśatī́r uśántam

translation.text: Hastening onward like the waves of waters, our holy hymns are pressing nigh to Soma. To him they come with lowly adoration, and, longing, enter him who longs to meet them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं म॑र्मृजा॒नं म॑हि॒षं न साना॑वं॒शुं दु॑हन्त्यु॒क्षणं॑ गिरि॒ष्ठाम् तं वा॑वशा॒नं म॒तयः॑ सचन्ते त्रि॒तो बि॑भर्ति॒ वरु॑णं समु॒द्रे
verses.transliteration: tám marmr̥jānám mahiṣáṃ ná sā́nāv  aṃśúṃ duhanty ukṣáṇaṃ giriṣṭhā́m  táṃ vāvaśānám matáyaḥ sacante  tritó bibharti váruṇaṃ samudré

translation.text: They drain the stalk, the Steer who dwells on mountains, even as a Bull who decks him on the upland. Hymns follow and attend him as he bellows: Trita bears Varuṇa aloft in ocean.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इष्य॒न्वाच॑मुपव॒क्तेव॒ होतुः॑ पुना॒न इ॑न्दो॒ वि ष्या॑ मनी॒षाम् इन्द्र॑श्च॒ यत्क्षय॑थः॒ सौभ॑गाय सु॒वीर्य॑स्य॒ पत॑यः स्याम
verses.transliteration: íṣyan vā́cam upavaktéva hótuḥ  punāná indo ví ṣyā manīṣā́m  índraś ca yát kṣáyathaḥ saúbhagāya  suvī́ryasya pátayaḥ syāma

translation.text: Sending thy voice out as Director, loosen the Invoker's thought, O Indu, as they cleanse thee. While thou and Indra rule for our advantage, may we be masters of heroic vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र से॑ना॒नीः शूरो॒ अग्रे॒ रथा॑नां ग॒व्यन्ने॑ति॒ हर्ष॑ते अस्य॒ सेना॑ भ॒द्रान्कृ॒ण्वन्नि॑न्द्रह॒वान्त्सखि॑भ्य॒ आ सोमो॒ वस्त्रा॑ रभ॒सानि॑ दत्ते
verses.transliteration: prá senānī́ḥ śū́ro ágre ráthānāṃ  gavyánn eti hárṣate asya sénā  bhadrā́n kr̥ṇvánn indrahavā́n sákhibhyaḥ-  ā́ sómo vástrā rabhasā́ni datte

translation.text: IN forefront of the cars forth goes the Hero, the Leader, winning spoil: his host rejoices. Soma endues his robes of lasting colours, and blesses, for his friends, their calls on Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॑स्य॒ हरिं॒ हर॑यो मृजन्त्यश्वह॒यैरनि॑शितं॒ नमो॑भिः आ ति॑ष्ठति॒ रथ॒मिन्द्र॑स्य॒ सखा॑ वि॒द्वाँ ए॑ना सुम॒तिं या॒त्यच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: sám asya háriṃ hárayo mr̥janti-  aśvahayaír ániśitaṃ námobhiḥ  ā́ tiṣṭhati rátham índrasya sákhā  vidvā́m̐ enā sumatíṃ yāty ácha

translation.text: Men decked with gold adorn his golden tendril, incessantly with steed-impelling homage. The Friend of Indra mounts his car well-knowing, he comes thereon to meet the prayer we offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ देव दे॒वता॑ते पवस्व म॒हे सो॑म॒ प्सर॑स इन्द्र॒पानः॑ कृ॒ण्वन्न॒पो व॒र्षय॒न्द्यामु॒तेमामु॒रोरा नो॑ वरिवस्या पुना॒नः
verses.transliteration: sá no deva devátāte pavasva  mahé soma psárasa indrapā́naḥ  kr̥ṇvánn apó varṣáyan dyā́m utémā́m  urór ā́ no varivasyā punānáḥ

translation.text: O God, for service of the Gods flow onward, for food sublime, as Indra's drink, O Soma. Making the floods, bedewing earth and heaven, come from the vast, comfort us while we cleanse thee

verses.sanskrit_deva: अजी॑त॒येऽह॑तये पवस्व स्व॒स्तये॑ स॒र्वता॑तये बृह॒ते तदु॑शन्ति॒ विश्व॑ इ॒मे सखा॑य॒स्तद॒हं व॑श्मि पवमान सोम
verses.transliteration: ájītayé 'hataye pavasva  svastáye sarvátātaye br̥haté  tád uśanti víśva imé sákhāyas  tád aháṃ vaśmi pavamāna soma

translation.text: Flow for prosperity and constant Vigour, flow on for happiness and high perfection. This is the wish of these friends assembled: this is my wish, O Soma Pavamâna.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमः॑ पवते जनि॒ता म॑ती॒नां ज॑नि॒ता दि॒वो ज॑नि॒ता पृ॑थि॒व्याः ज॒नि॒ताग्नेर्ज॑नि॒ता सूर्य॑स्य जनि॒तेन्द्र॑स्य जनि॒तोत विष्णोः॑
verses.transliteration: sómaḥ pavate janitā́ matīnā́ṃ  janitā́ divó janitā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  janitā́gnér janitā́ sū́ryasya  janiténdrasya janitótá víṣṇoḥ

translation.text: Father of holy hymns, Soma flows onward the Father of the earth, Father of heaven: Father of Agni, Sûrya's generator, the Father who begat Indra and Vishṇu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्र॒ह्मा दे॒वानां॑ पद॒वीः क॑वी॒नामृषि॒र्विप्रा॑णां महि॒षो मृ॒गाणा॑म् श्ये॒नो गृध्रा॑णां॒ स्वधि॑ति॒र्वना॑नां॒ सोमः॑ प॒वित्र॒मत्ये॑ति॒ रेभ॑न्
verses.transliteration: brahmā́ devā́nām padavī́ḥ kavīnā́m  ŕ̥ṣir víprāṇām mahiṣó mr̥gā́ṇām  śyenó gŕ̥dhrāṇāṃ svádhitir vánānāṃ  sómaḥ pavítram áty eti rébhan

translation.text: Brahman of Gods, the Leader of the poets, R̥ishi of sages, Bull of savage creatures, Falcon amid the vultures, Axe of forests, over the cleansing sieve goes Soma singing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रावी॑विपद्वा॒च ऊ॒र्मिं न सिन्धु॒र्गिरः॒ सोमः॒ पव॑मानो मनी॒षाः अ॒न्तः पश्य॑न्वृ॒जने॒माव॑रा॒ण्या ति॑ष्ठति वृष॒भो गोषु॑ जा॒नन्
verses.transliteration: prā́vīvipad vācá ūrmíṃ ná síndhur  gíraḥ sómaḥ pávamāno manīṣā́ḥ  antáḥ páśyan vr̥jánemā́varāṇi-  ā́ tiṣṭhati vr̥ṣabhó góṣu jānán

translation.text: He, Soma Pavamâna, like a river, hath stirred the wave of voice, our songs and praises. Beholding these inferior powers in cattle, he rests among them as a Steer well-knowing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स म॑त्स॒रः पृ॒त्सु व॒न्वन्नवा॑तः स॒हस्र॑रेता अ॒भि वाज॑मर्ष इन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ पव॑मानो मनी॒ष्यं१॒॑शोरू॒र्मिमी॑रय॒ गा इ॑ष॒ण्यन्
verses.transliteration: sá matsaráḥ pr̥tsú vanvánn ávātaḥ  sahásraretā abhí vā́jam arṣa  índrāyendo pávamāno manīṣī́-  -aṃśór ūrmím īraya gā́ iṣaṇyán

translation.text: As Gladdener, Warrior never harmed in battle, with thousand genial streams, pour strength and vigour. As thoughtful Pavamâna, urge O Indu, speeding the kine, the plant's wave on to Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ प्रि॒यः क॒लशे॑ दे॒ववा॑त॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमो॒ रण्यो॒ मदा॑य स॒हस्र॑धारः श॒तवा॑ज॒ इन्दु॑र्वा॒जी न सप्तिः॒ सम॑ना जिगाति
verses.transliteration: pári priyáḥ kaláśe devávātaḥ-  índrāya sómo ráṇyo mádāya  sahásradhāraḥ śatávāja índur  vājī́ ná sáptiḥ sámanā jigāti

translation.text: Dear, grateful to the Gods, on to the beaker moves Soma, sweet to Indra, to delight him. With hundred powers, with thousand currents, Indu, like a strong car-horse, goes to the assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स पू॒र्व्यो व॑सु॒विज्जाय॑मानो मृजा॒नो अ॒प्सु दु॑दुहा॒नो अद्रौ॑ अ॒भि॒श॒स्ति॒पा भुव॑नस्य॒ राजा॑ वि॒दद्गा॒तुं ब्रह्म॑णे पू॒यमा॑नः
verses.transliteration: sá pūrvyó vasuvíj jā́yamāno  mr̥jānó apsú duduhānó ádrau  abhiśastipā́ bhúvanasya rā́jā  vidád gātúm bráhmaṇe pūyámānaḥ

translation.text: Born in old time as finder-out of treasures, drained with the stone, decking himself in waters, Warding off curses, King of all existence, he shall find way for prayer the while they cleanse him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वया॒ हि नः॑ पि॒तरः॑ सोम॒ पूर्वे॒ कर्मा॑णि च॒क्रुः प॑वमान॒ धीराः॑ व॒न्वन्नवा॑तः परि॒धीँरपो॑र्णु वी॒रेभि॒रश्वै॑र्म॒घवा॑ भवा नः
verses.transliteration: tváyā hí naḥ pitáraḥ soma pū́rve  kármāṇi cakrúḥ pavamāna dhī́rāḥ  vanvánn ávātaḥ paridhī́m̐r áporṇu  vīrébhir áśvair maghávā bhavā naḥ

translation.text: For our sage fathers, Soma Pavamâna, of old performed, by thee, their sacred duties. Fighting unvanquished, open the enclosures: enrich us with large gifts of steeds and heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथाप॑वथा॒ मन॑वे वयो॒धा अ॑मित्र॒हा व॑रिवो॒विद्ध॒विष्मा॑न् ए॒वा प॑वस्व॒ द्रवि॑णं॒ दधा॑न॒ इन्द्रे॒ सं ति॑ष्ठ ज॒नयायु॑धानि
verses.transliteration: yáthā́pavathā mánave vayodhā́ḥ-  amitrahā́ varivovíd dhavíṣmān  evā́ pavasva dráviṇaṃ dádhānaḥ-  índre sáṃ tiṣṭha janáyā́yudhāni

translation.text: As thou didst flow for Manu Life-bestowing, Foe-queller, Comforter, rich in oblations, Even thus flow onward now conferring riches: combine with Indra, and bring forth thy weapons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व सोम॒ मधु॑माँ ऋ॒तावा॒पो वसा॑नो॒ अधि॒ सानो॒ अव्ये॑ अव॒ द्रोणा॑नि घृ॒तवा॑न्ति सीद म॒दिन्त॑मो मत्स॒र इ॑न्द्र॒पानः॑
verses.transliteration: pávasva soma mádhumām̐ r̥tā́vā-  -apó vásāno ádhi sā́no ávye  áva dróṇāni ghr̥távānti sīda  madíntamo matsará indrapā́naḥ

translation.text: Flow onward, Soma, rich in sweets and holy,. enrobed in waters on the fleecy summit. Settle in vessels that are full of fatness, as cheering and most gladdening drink for Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒ष्टिं दि॒वः श॒तधा॑रः पवस्व सहस्र॒सा वा॑ज॒युर्दे॒ववी॑तौ सं सिन्धु॑भिः क॒लशे॑ वावशा॒नः समु॒स्रिया॑भिः प्रति॒रन्न॒ आयुः॑
verses.transliteration: vr̥ṣṭíṃ diváḥ śatádhāraḥ pavasva  sahasrasā́ vājayúr devávītau  sáṃ síndhubhiḥ kaláśe vāvaśānáḥ  sám usríyābhiḥ pratirán na ā́yuḥ

translation.text: Pour, hundred-streamed, winner of thousands, mighty at the Gods' banquet, Pour the rain of heaven, While thou with rivers roarest in the beaker, and blent with milk prolongest our existence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्य सोमो॑ म॒तिभिः॑ पुना॒नोऽत्यो॒ न वा॒जी तर॒तीदरा॑तीः पयो॒ न दु॒ग्धमदि॑तेरिषि॒रमु॒र्वि॑व गा॒तुः सु॒यमो॒ न वोळ्हा॑
verses.transliteration: eṣá syá sómo matíbhiḥ punānó  -átyo ná vājī́ táratī́d árātīḥ  páyo ná dugdhám áditer iṣirám  urv ìva gātúḥ suyámo ná vóḷhā

translation.text: Purified with our holy hymns, this Soma o'ertakes malignities like some strong charger, Like fresh milk poured by Aditi, like passage in ample room, or like a docile car-horse.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वा॒यु॒धः सो॒तृभिः॑ पू॒यमा॑नो॒ऽभ्य॑र्ष॒ गुह्यं॒ चारु॒ नाम॑ अ॒भि वाजं॒ सप्ति॑रिव श्रव॒स्याभि वा॒युम॒भि गा दे॑व सोम
verses.transliteration: svāyudháḥ sotŕ̥bhiḥ pūyámāno  -abhy àrṣa gúhyaṃ cā́ru nā́ma  abhí vā́jaṃ sáptir iva śravasyā́-  -abhí vāyúm abhí gā́ deva soma

translation.text: Cleansed by the pressers, armed with noble weapons, stream to us the fair secret name thou bearest. Pour booty, like a horse, for love of glory God, Soma, send us kine, and send us Vâyu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शिशुं॑ जज्ञा॒नं ह॑र्य॒तं मृ॑जन्ति शु॒म्भन्ति॒ वह्निं॑ म॒रुतो॑ ग॒णेन॑ क॒विर्गी॒र्भिः काव्ये॑ना क॒विः सन्त्सोमः॑ प॒वित्र॒मत्ये॑ति॒ रेभ॑न्
verses.transliteration: śíśuṃ jajñānáṃ haryatám mr̥janti  śumbhánti váhnim marúto gaṇéna  kavír gīrbhíḥ kā́vyenā kavíḥ sán  sómaḥ pavítram áty eti rébhan

translation.text: They deck him at his birth, the lovely Infant, the Maruts with their troop adorn the Car-horse. By songs a Poet and a Sage by wisdom, Soma joes singing through the cleansing filter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋषि॑मना॒ य ऋ॑षि॒कृत्स्व॒र्षाः स॒हस्र॑णीथः पद॒वीः क॑वी॒नाम् तृ॒तीयं॒ धाम॑ महि॒षः सिषा॑स॒न्त्सोमो॑ वि॒राज॒मनु॑ राजति॒ ष्टुप्
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥ṣimanā yá r̥ṣikŕ̥t svarṣā́ḥ  sahásraṇīthaḥ padavī́ḥ kavīnā́m  tr̥tī́yaṃ dhā́ma mahiṣáḥ síṣāsan  sómo virā́jam ánu rājati ṣṭúp

translation.text: Light-winner, R̥ishi-mindcd, R̥ishi-maker, hymned in a thousand hymns, Leader of sages, A Steer who strives to gain his third form, Soma is, like Virâj, resplendent as a Singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒मू॒षच्छ्ये॒नः श॑कु॒नो वि॒भृत्वा॑ गोवि॒न्दुर्द्र॒प्स आयु॑धानि॒ बिभ्र॑त् अ॒पामू॒र्मिं सच॑मानः समु॒द्रं तु॒रीयं॒ धाम॑ महि॒षो वि॑वक्ति
verses.transliteration: camūṣác chyenáḥ śakunó vibhŕ̥tvā  govindúr drapsá ā́yudhāni bíbhrat  apā́m ūrmíṃ sácamānaḥ samudráṃ  turī́yaṃ dhā́ma mahiṣó vivakti

translation.text: Hawk seated in the bowls, Bird wide-extended, the Banner seeking kine and wielding weapons, Following close the sea, the wave of waters, the great Bull tells his fourth form and declares it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मर्यो॒ न शु॒भ्रस्त॒न्वं॑ मृजा॒नोऽत्यो॒ न सृत्वा॑ स॒नये॒ धना॑नाम् वृषे॑व यू॒था परि॒ कोश॒मर्ष॒न्कनि॑क्रदच्च॒म्वो॒३॒॑रा वि॑वेश
verses.transliteration: máryo ná śubhrás tanvàm mr̥jānó  -átyo ná sŕ̥tvā sanáye dhánānām  vŕ̥ṣeva yūthā́ pári kóśam árṣan  kánikradac camvòr ā́ viveśa

translation.text: Like a fair youth who decorates his body, a courser rushing to the gain of riches, A steer to herds, so, flowing to the pitcher, he with a roar hath passed into the beakers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्वेन्दो॒ पव॑मानो॒ महो॑भिः॒ कनि॑क्रद॒त्परि॒ वारा॑ण्यर्ष क्रीळ॑ञ्च॒म्वो॒३॒॑रा वि॑श पू॒यमा॑न॒ इन्द्रं॑ ते॒ रसो॑ मदि॒रो म॑मत्तु
