verses.transliteration: pávasvendo pávamāno máhobhiḥ  kánikradat pári vā́rāṇy arṣa  krī́ḷañ camvòr ā́ viśa pūyámānaḥ-  índraṃ te ráso madiró mamattu

translation.text: Flow on with might as Pavamâna, Indu flow loudly roaring through the fleecy filter. Enter the beakers sporting, as they cleanse thee, and let thy gladdening juice make Indra joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रास्य॒ धारा॑ बृह॒तीर॑सृग्रन्न॒क्तो गोभिः॑ क॒लशाँ॒ आ वि॑वेश साम॑ कृ॒ण्वन्त्सा॑म॒न्यो॑ विप॒श्चित्क्रन्द॑न्नेत्य॒भि सख्यु॒र्न जा॒मिम्
verses.transliteration: prā́sya dhā́rā br̥hatī́r asr̥grann  aktó góbhiḥ kaláśām̐ ā́ viveśa  sā́ma kr̥ṇván sāmanyò vipaścít  krándann ety abhí sákhyur ná jāmím

translation.text: His streams have been effused in all their fulness, and he hath entered, balmed with milk, the goblets. Singing his psalm, well-skilled in song, a Chanter, be comes as 'twere to his friend's sister roaring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒प॒घ्नन्ने॑षि पवमान॒ शत्रू॑न्प्रि॒यां न जा॒रो अ॒भिगी॑त॒ इन्दुः॑ सीद॒न्वने॑षु शकु॒नो न पत्वा॒ सोमः॑ पुना॒नः क॒लशे॑षु॒ सत्ता॑
verses.transliteration: apaghnánn eṣi pavamāna śátrūn  priyā́ṃ ná jāró abhígīta índuḥ  sī́dan váneṣu śakunó ná pátvā  sómaḥ punānáḥ kaláśeṣu sáttā

translation.text: Chasing our foes thou comest, Pavamâna Indu, besting, as lover to his darling. As a bird flies and settles in the forest, thus Soma settles, purified, in goblets.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ते॒ रुचः॒ पव॑मानस्य सोम॒ योषे॑व यन्ति सु॒दुघाः॑ सुधा॒राः हरि॒रानी॑तः पुरु॒वारो॑ अ॒प्स्वचि॑क्रदत्क॒लशे॑ देवयू॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ te rúcaḥ pávamānasya soma  yóṣeva yanti sudúghāḥ sudhārā́ḥ  hárir ā́nītaḥ puruvā́ro apsú-  ácikradat kaláśe devayūnā́m

translation.text: With full stream and abundant milk, O Soma, thy beams come, like a woman, as they cleanse thee. He, gold-hued, rich in boons, brought to the waters, hath roared within the goblet of the pious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य प्रे॒षा हे॒मना॑ पू॒यमा॑नो दे॒वो दे॒वेभिः॒ सम॑पृक्त॒ रस॑म् सु॒तः प॒वित्रं॒ पर्ये॑ति॒ रेभ॑न्मि॒तेव॒ सद्म॑ पशु॒मान्ति॒ होता॑
verses.transliteration: asyá preṣā́ hemánā pūyámāno  devó devébhiḥ sám apr̥kta rásam  sutáḥ pavítram páry eti rébhan  mitéva sádma paśumā́nti hótā

translation.text: MADE pure by this man's urgent zeal and impulse the God hath to the Gods his juice imparted. He goes, effused and singing, to the filter, like priest to measured seats supplied with cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रा वस्त्रा॑ सम॒न्या॒३॒॑ वसा॑नो म॒हान्क॒विर्नि॒वच॑नानि॒ शंस॑न् आ व॑च्यस्व च॒म्वोः॑ पू॒यमा॑नो विचक्ष॒णो जागृ॑विर्दे॒ववी॑तौ
verses.transliteration: bhadrā́ vástrā samanyā̀ vásāno  mahā́n kavír nivácanāni śáṃsan  ā́ vacyasva camvòḥ pūyámāno  vicakṣaṇó jā́gr̥vir devávītau

translation.text: Robed in fair raiment meet to wear in battle, a mighty Sage pronouncing invocations. Roll onward to the beakers as they cleanse thee, far-seeing at the feast of Gods, and watchful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समु॑ प्रि॒यो मृ॑ज्यते॒ सानो॒ अव्ये॑ य॒शस्त॑रो य॒शसां॒ क्षैतो॑ अ॒स्मे अ॒भि स्व॑र॒ धन्वा॑ पू॒यमा॑नो यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: sám u priyó mr̥jyate sā́no ávye  yaśástaro yaśásāṃ kṣaíto asmé  abhí svara dhánvā pūyámāno  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Dear, he is brightened on the fleecy summit, a Prince among us, nobler than the noble. Roar out as thou art purified, run forward. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र गा॑यता॒भ्य॑र्चाम दे॒वान्त्सोमं॑ हिनोत मह॒ते धना॑य स्वा॒दुः प॑वाते॒ अति॒ वार॒मव्य॒मा सी॑दाति क॒लशं॑ देव॒युर्नः॑
verses.transliteration: prá gāyatābhy àrcāma devā́n  sómaṃ hinota mahaté dhánāya  svādúḥ pavāte áti vā́ram ávyam  ā́ sīdāti kaláśaṃ devayúr naḥ

translation.text: Let us sing praises to the Gods: sing loudly, send ye the Soma forth for mighty riches. Let him flow, sweetly-flavoured, through the filter, and let our pious one rest in the pitcher.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्दु॑र्दे॒वाना॒मुप॑ स॒ख्यमा॒यन्त्स॒हस्र॑धारः पवते॒ मदा॑य नृभिः॒ स्तवा॑नो॒ अनु॒ धाम॒ पूर्व॒मग॒न्निन्द्रं॑ मह॒ते सौभ॑गाय
verses.transliteration: índur devā́nām úpa sakhyám āyán  sahásradhāraḥ pavate mádāya  nŕ̥bhi stávāno ánu dhā́ma pū́rvam  ágann índram mahaté saúbhagāya

translation.text: Winning the friendship of the Deities, Indu flows in a thousand streams to make them joyful. Praised by the men after the ancient statute, he hath come nigh, for our great bliss, to Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तो॒त्रे रा॒ये हरि॑रर्षा पुना॒न इन्द्रं॒ मदो॑ गच्छतु ते॒ भरा॑य दे॒वैर्या॑हि स॒रथं॒ राधो॒ अच्छा॑ यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: stotré rāyé hárir arṣā punānáḥ-  índram mádo gachatu te bhárāya  devaír yāhi saráthaṃ rā́dho áchā  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Flow, Gold-hued, cleansing thee, to enrich the singer: let thy juice go to Indra to support him. Come nigh, together with the Gods, for bounty. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र काव्य॑मु॒शने॑व ब्रुवा॒णो दे॒वो दे॒वानां॒ जनि॑मा विवक्ति महि॑व्रतः॒ शुचि॑बन्धुः पाव॒कः प॒दा व॑रा॒हो अ॒भ्ये॑ति॒ रेभ॑न्
verses.transliteration: prá kā́vyam uśáneva bruvāṇó  devó devā́nāṃ jánimā vivakti  máhivrataḥ śúcibandhuḥ pāvakáḥ  padā́ varāhó abhy èti rébhan

translation.text: The God declares the Deities' generations, like Uṣanâ, proclaiming lofty wisdom. With brilliant kin, far-ruling, sanctifying, the Boar advances, singing, to the places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र हं॒सास॑स्तृ॒पलं॑ म॒न्युमच्छा॒मादस्तं॒ वृष॑गणा अयासुः आ॒ङ्गू॒ष्यं१॒॑ पव॑मानं॒ सखा॑यो दु॒र्मर्षं॑ सा॒कं प्र व॑दन्ति वा॒णम्
verses.transliteration: prá haṃsā́sas tr̥pálam manyúm ácha-  -amā́d ástaṃ vŕ̥ṣagaṇā ayāsuḥ  āṅgūṣyàm pávamānaṃ sákhāyo  durmárṣaṃ sākám prá vadanti vāṇám

translation.text: The Swans, the Vr̥ishagaṇas from anear us have brought their restless spirit to our dwelling. Friends come to Pavamâna meet for praises, and sound in concert their resistless music.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स रं॑हत उरुगा॒यस्य॑ जू॒तिं वृथा॒ क्रीळ॑न्तं मिमते॒ न गावः॑ प॒री॒ण॒सं कृ॑णुते ति॒ग्मशृ॑ङ्गो॒ दिवा॒ हरि॒र्ददृ॑शे॒ नक्त॑मृ॒ज्रः
verses.transliteration: sá raṃhata urugāyásya jūtíṃ  vŕ̥thā krī́ḷantam mimate ná gā́vaḥ  parīṇasáṃ kr̥ṇute tigmáśr̥ṅgo  dívā hárir dádr̥śe náktam r̥jráḥ

translation.text: He follows the Wide-strider's rapid movement: cows low, as 'twere, to him who sports at pleasure. He with the sharpened horns brings forth abundance: the Silvery shines by night, by day the Golden.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्दु॑र्वा॒जी प॑वते॒ गोन्यो॑घा॒ इन्द्रे॒ सोमः॒ सह॒ इन्व॒न्मदा॑य हन्ति॒ रक्षो॒ बाध॑ते॒ पर्यरा॑ती॒र्वरि॑वः कृ॒ण्वन्वृ॒जन॑स्य॒ राजा॑
verses.transliteration: índur vājī́ pavate gónyoghāḥ-  índre sómaḥ sáha ínvan mádāya  hánti rákṣo bā́dhate páry árātīr  várivaḥ kr̥ṇván vr̥jánasya rā́jā

translation.text: Strong Indu, bathed in milk, flows on for Indra, Soma exciting strength, to make him joyful. He quells malignities and slays the demons, the King of mighty power who brings us comfort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ धार॑या॒ मध्वा॑ पृचा॒नस्ति॒रो रोम॑ पवते॒ अद्रि॑दुग्धः इन्दु॒रिन्द्र॑स्य स॒ख्यं जु॑षा॒णो दे॒वो दे॒वस्य॑ मत्स॒रो मदा॑य
verses.transliteration: ádha dhā́rayā mádhvā pr̥cānás  tiró róma pavate ádridugdhaḥ  índur índrasya sakhyáṃ juṣāṇó  devó devásya matsaró mádāya

translation.text: Then in a stream he flows, milked out with press-stones, mingled with sweetness, through the fleecy filter- Indu rejoicing in the love of Indra, the God who gladdens, for the God's enjoyment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि प्रि॒याणि॑ पवते पुना॒नो दे॒वो दे॒वान्त्स्वेन॒ रसे॑न पृ॒ञ्चन् इन्दु॒र्धर्मा॑ण्यृतु॒था वसा॑नो॒ दश॒ क्षिपो॑ अव्यत॒ सानो॒ अव्ये॑
verses.transliteration: abhí priyā́ṇi pavate punānó  devó devā́n svéna rásena pr̥ñcán  índur dhármāṇy r̥tuthā́ vásāno  dáśa kṣípo avyata sā́no ávye

translation.text: As he is purified he pours out treasures, a God bedewing Gods with his own juices. Indu hath, wearing qualities by seasons, on the raised fleece engaged, the ten swift fingers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॒ शोणो॑ अभि॒कनि॑क्रद॒द्गा न॒दय॑न्नेति पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्याम् इन्द्र॑स्येव व॒ग्नुरा शृ॑ण्व आ॒जौ प्र॑चे॒तय॑न्नर्षति॒ वाच॒मेमाम्
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā śóṇo abhikánikradad gā́ḥ-  nadáyann eti pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m  índrasyeva vagnúr ā́ śr̥ṇva ājaú  pracetáyann arṣati vā́cam émā́m

translation.text: The Red Bull bellowing to the kine advances, causing the heavens and earth to roar and thunder. Well is he beard like Indra's shout in battle: letting this voice be known he hastens hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒साय्यः॒ पय॑सा॒ पिन्व॑मान ई॒रय॑न्नेषि॒ मधु॑मन्तमं॒शुम् पव॑मानः संत॒निमे॑षि कृ॒ण्वन्निन्द्रा॑य सोम परिषि॒च्यमा॑नः
verses.transliteration: rasā́yyaḥ páyasā pínvamānaḥ-  īráyann eṣi mádhumantam aṃśúm  pávamānaḥ saṃtaním eṣi kr̥ṇvánn  índrāya soma pariṣicyámānaḥ

translation.text: Swelling with milk, abounding in sweet flavours, urging the meath-rich plant thou goest onward. Raising a shout thou flowest as they cleanse thee, when thou, O Soma, art effused for Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा प॑वस्व मदि॒रो मदा॑योदग्रा॒भस्य॑ न॒मय॑न्वध॒स्नैः परि॒ वर्णं॒ भर॑माणो॒ रुश॑न्तं ग॒व्युर्नो॑ अर्ष॒ परि॑ सोम सि॒क्तः
verses.transliteration: evā́ pavasva madiró mádāya-  -udagrābhásya namáyan vadhasnaíḥ  pári várṇam bháramāṇo rúśantaṃ  gavyúr no arṣa pári soma siktáḥ

translation.text: So flow thou on inspiriting, for rapture, aiming death-shafts at him who stays the waters, Flow to us wearing thy resplendent colour, effused and eager for the kine, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जु॒ष्ट्वी न॑ इन्दो सु॒पथा॑ सु॒गान्यु॒रौ प॑वस्व॒ वरि॑वांसि कृ॒ण्वन् घ॒नेव॒ विष्व॑ग्दुरि॒तानि॑ वि॒घ्नन्नधि॒ ष्णुना॑ धन्व॒ सानो॒ अव्ये॑
verses.transliteration: juṣṭvī́ na indo supáthā sugā́ni-  uraú pavasva várivāṃsi kr̥ṇván  ghanéva víṣvag duritā́ni vighnánn  ádhi ṣṇúnā dhanva sā́no ávye

translation.text: Pleased with us, Indu, send us as thou flowest good easy paths in ample space and comforts. Dispelling, as 'twere with a club, misfortunes, run o'er the height, run o'er the fleecy summit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒ष्टिं नो॑ अर्ष दि॒व्यां जि॑ग॒त्नुमिळा॑वतीं शं॒गयीं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम् स्तुके॑व वी॒ता ध॑न्वा विचि॒न्वन्बन्धूँ॑रि॒माँ अव॑राँ इन्दो वा॒यून्
verses.transliteration: vr̥ṣṭíṃ no arṣa divyā́ṃ jigatnúm  íḷāvatīṃ śaṃgáyīṃ jīrádānum  stúkeva vītā́ dhanvā vicinván  bándhūm̐r imā́m̐ ávarām̐ indo vāyū́n

translation.text: Pour on us rain celestial, quickly streaming, refreshing, fraught with health and ready bounty. Flow, Indu, send these Winds thy lower kinsmen, setting them free like locks of hair unbraided.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग्र॒न्थिं न वि ष्य॑ ग्रथि॒तं पु॑ना॒न ऋ॒जुं च॑ गा॒तुं वृ॑जि॒नं च॑ सोम अत्यो॒ न क्र॑दो॒ हरि॒रा सृ॑जा॒नो मर्यो॑ देव धन्व प॒स्त्या॑वान्
verses.transliteration: granthíṃ ná ví ṣya grathitám punānáḥ-  r̥júṃ ca gātúṃ vr̥jináṃ ca soma  átyo ná krado hárir ā́ sr̥jānó  máryo deva dhanva pastyā̀vān

translation.text: Part, like a knotted tangle, while they cleanse thee, O Soma, righteous and unrighteous conduct. Neigh like a tawny courser who is loosened, come like a youth, O God, a house-possessor.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जुष्टो॒ मदा॑य दे॒वता॑त इन्दो॒ परि॒ ष्णुना॑ धन्व॒ सानो॒ अव्ये॑ स॒हस्र॑धारः सुर॒भिरद॑ब्धः॒ परि॑ स्रव॒ वाज॑सातौ नृ॒षह्ये॑
verses.transliteration: júṣṭo mádāya devátāta indo  pári ṣṇúnā dhanva sā́no ávye  sahásradhāraḥ surabhír ádabdhaḥ  pári srava vā́jasātau nr̥ṣáhye

translation.text: For the God's service, for delight, O Indu, run o'er the height, run o'ver the fleecy summit. With thousand streams, inviolate, sweet-scented, flow on for gain of strength that conquers heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र॒श्मानो॒ ये॑ऽर॒था अयु॑क्ता॒ अत्या॑सो॒ न स॑सृजा॒नास॑ आ॒जौ ए॒ते शु॒क्रासो॑ धन्वन्ति॒ सोमा॒ देवा॑स॒स्ताँ उप॑ याता॒ पिब॑ध्यै
verses.transliteration: araśmā́no yè 'rathā́ áyuktāḥ-  átyāso ná sasr̥jānā́sa ājaú  eté śukrā́so dhanvanti sómāḥ-  dévāsas tā́m̐ úpa yātā píbadhyai

translation.text: Without a car, without a rein to guide them, unyoked, like coursers started in the contest, These brilliant drops of Soma juice run forward. Do ye, O Deities, come nigh to drink them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा न॑ इन्दो अ॒भि दे॒ववी॑तिं॒ परि॑ स्रव॒ नभो॒ अर्ण॑श्च॒मूषु॑ सोमो॑ अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ काम्यं॑ बृ॒हन्तं॑ र॒यिं द॑दातु वी॒रव॑न्तमु॒ग्रम्
verses.transliteration: evā́ na indo abhí devávītim  pári srava nábho árṇaś camū́ṣu  sómo asmábhyaṃ kā́myam br̥hántaṃ  rayíṃ dadātu vīrávantam ugrám

translation.text: So for our banquet of the Gods, O Indu, pour down the rain of heaven into the vessels. May Soma grant us riches sought with longing, mighty, exceeding strong, with store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तक्ष॒द्यदी॒ मन॑सो॒ वेन॑तो॒ वाग्ज्येष्ठ॑स्य वा॒ धर्म॑णि॒ क्षोरनी॑के आदी॑माय॒न्वर॒मा वा॑वशा॒ना जुष्टं॒ पतिं॑ क॒लशे॒ गाव॒ इन्दु॑म्
verses.transliteration: tákṣad yádī mánaso vénato vā́g  jyéṣṭhasya vā dhármaṇi kṣór ánīke  ā́d īm āyan váram ā́ vāvaśānā́ḥ-  júṣṭam pátiṃ kaláśe gā́va índum

translation.text: What time the loving spirit's word had formed him Chief of all food, by statute of the Highest, Then loudly lowing came the cows to Indu, the chosen, well-loved Master in the beaker.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र दा॑नु॒दो दि॒व्यो दा॑नुपि॒न्व ऋ॒तमृ॒ताय॑ पवते सुमे॒धाः ध॒र्मा भु॑वद्वृज॒न्य॑स्य॒ राजा॒ प्र र॒श्मिभि॑र्द॒शभि॑र्भारि॒ भूम॑
verses.transliteration: prá dānudó divyó dānupinváḥ-  r̥tám r̥tā́ya pavate sumedhā́ḥ  dharmā́ bhuvad vr̥janyàsya rā́jā  prá raśmíbhir daśábhir bhāri bhū́ma

translation.text: The Sage, Celestial, liberal, raining bounties, pours as he flows the Genuine for the Truthful. The King shall be effectual strength's upholder: he by the ten bright reins is mostly guided.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒वित्रे॑भिः॒ पव॑मानो नृ॒चक्षा॒ राजा॑ दे॒वाना॑मु॒त मर्त्या॑नाम् द्वि॒ता भु॑वद्रयि॒पती॑ रयी॒णामृ॒तं भ॑र॒त्सुभृ॑तं॒ चार्विन्दुः॑
verses.transliteration: pavítrebhiḥ pávamāno nr̥cákṣāḥ-  rā́jā devā́nām utá mártyānām  dvitā́ bhuvad rayipátī rayīṇā́m  r̥tám bharat súbhr̥taṃ cā́rv índuḥ

translation.text: He who beholds mankind, made pure with filters, the King supreme of Deities and mortals, From days of old is Treasure-Lord of riches: he, Indu, cherishes fair well-kept Order.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्वाँ॑ इव॒ श्रव॑से सा॒तिमच्छेन्द्र॑स्य वा॒योर॒भि वी॒तिम॑र्ष स नः॑ स॒हस्रा॑ बृह॒तीरिषो॑ दा॒ भवा॑ सोम द्रविणो॒वित्पु॑ना॒नः
verses.transliteration: árvām̐ iva śrávase sātím áchā-  -índrasya vāyór abhí vītím arṣa  sá naḥ sahásrā br̥hatī́r íṣo dāḥ-  bhávā soma draviṇovít punānáḥ

translation.text: Haste, like a steed, to vittory for glory, to Indra's and to Vâyu's entertainment. Give us food ample, thousandfold: be, Soma, the finder-out of riches when they cleanse thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वा॒व्यो॑ नः परिषि॒च्यमा॑नाः॒ क्षयं॑ सु॒वीरं॑ धन्वन्तु॒ सोमाः॑ आ॒य॒ज्यवः॑ सुम॒तिं वि॒श्ववा॑रा॒ होता॑रो॒ न दि॑वि॒यजो॑ म॒न्द्रत॑माः
verses.transliteration: devāvyò naḥ pariṣicyámānāḥ  kṣáyaṃ suvī́raṃ dhanvantu sómāḥ  āyajyávaḥ sumatíṃ viśvávārāḥ-  hótāro ná diviyájo mandrátamāḥ

translation.text: Effused by us let God-delighting Somas bring as they flow a home with noble heroes. Rich in all boons like priests acquiring favour, the worshippers of heaven, the best of Cheerers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा दे॑व दे॒वता॑ते पवस्व म॒हे सो॑म॒ प्सर॑से देव॒पानः॑ म॒हश्चि॒द्धि ष्मसि॑ हि॒ताः स॑म॒र्ये कृ॒धि सु॑ष्ठा॒ने रोद॑सी पुना॒नः
verses.transliteration: evā́ deva devátāte pavasva  mahé soma psárase devapā́naḥ  maháś cid dhí ṣmási hitā́ḥ samaryé  kr̥dhí suṣṭhāné ródasī punānáḥ

translation.text: So, God, for service of the Gods flow onward, flow, drink of Gods, for ample food, O Soma. For we go forth to war against the mighty make heaven and earth well stablished by thy cleansing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वो॒ न क्र॑दो॒ वृष॑भिर्युजा॒नः सिं॒हो न भी॒मो मन॑सो॒ जवी॑यान् अ॒र्वा॒चीनैः॑ प॒थिभि॒र्ये रजि॑ष्ठा॒ आ प॑वस्व सौमन॒सं न॑ इन्दो
verses.transliteration: áśvo ná krado vŕ̥ṣabhir yujānáḥ  siṃhó ná bhīmó mánaso jávīyān  arvācī́naiḥ pathíbhir yé rájiṣṭhāḥ-  ā́ pavasva saumanasáṃ na indo

translation.text: Thou, yoked by strong men, neighest like a courser, swifter than thought is, like an awful lion. By paths directed hitherward, the straightest, send thou us happiness, Indu, while they cleanse thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं धारा॑ दे॒वजा॑ता असृग्रन्त्स॒हस्र॑मेनाः क॒वयो॑ मृजन्ति इन्दो॑ स॒नित्रं॑ दि॒व आ प॑वस्व पुरए॒तासि॑ मह॒तो धन॑स्य
verses.transliteration: śatáṃ dhā́rā devájātā asr̥gran  sahásram enāḥ kaváyo mr̥janti  índo sanítraṃ divá ā́ pavasva  puraetā́si maható dhánasya

translation.text: Sprung from the Gods, a hundred streams, a thousand, have been effused: sages prepare and purge them. Bring us from heaven the means of winnning, Indu; thou art-forerunnner of abundant riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो न सर्गा॑ अससृग्र॒मह्नां॒ राजा॒ न मि॒त्रं प्र मि॑नाति॒ धीरः॑ पि॒तुर्न पु॒त्रः क्रतु॑भिर्यता॒न आ प॑वस्व वि॒शे अ॒स्या अजी॑तिम्
verses.transliteration: divó ná sárgā asasr̥gram áhnāṃ  rā́jā ná mitrám prá mināti dhī́raḥ  pitúr ná putráḥ krátubhir yatānáḥ-  ā́ pavasva viśé asyā́ ájītim

translation.text: The streams of days, were poured as 'twere from heaven: the wise King doth not treat his friend unkindly. Like a son following his father's wishes, grant to this family success and safety.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॒ धारा॒ मधु॑मतीरसृग्र॒न्वारा॒न्यत्पू॒तो अ॒त्येष्यव्या॑न् पव॑मान॒ पव॑से॒ धाम॒ गोनां॑ जज्ञा॒नः सूर्य॑मपिन्वो अ॒र्कैः
verses.transliteration: prá te dhā́rā mádhumatīr asr̥gran  vā́rān yát pūtó atyéṣy ávyān  pávamāna pávase dhā́ma gónāṃ  jajñānáḥ sū́ryam apinvo arkaíḥ

translation.text: Now are thy streams poured forth with all their sweetness, when, purified. thou goest through the filter. The race of kine is thy gift, Pavarridna: when born thou madest Sûrya rich with brightness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कनि॑क्रद॒दनु॒ पन्था॑मृ॒तस्य॑ शु॒क्रो वि भा॑स्य॒मृत॑स्य॒ धाम॑ स इन्द्रा॑य पवसे मत्स॒रवा॑न्हिन्वा॒नो वाचं॑ म॒तिभिः॑ कवी॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: kánikradad ánu pánthām r̥tásya  śukró ví bhāsy amŕ̥tasya dhā́ma  sá índrāya pavase matsarávān  hinvānó vā́cam matíbhiḥ kavīnā́m

translation.text: Bright, bellowing aiong the path of Order, thou shinest as the form of life eternal. Thou flowest on as gladdening drink for Indra, sending thy voice out with the hymns of sages.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒व्यः सु॑प॒र्णोऽव॑ चक्षि सोम॒ पिन्व॒न्धाराः॒ कर्म॑णा दे॒ववी॑तौ एन्दो॑ विश क॒लशं॑ सोम॒धानं॒ क्रन्द॑न्निहि॒ सूर्य॒स्योप॑ र॒श्मिम्
verses.transliteration: divyáḥ suparṇó 'va cakṣi soma  pínvan dhā́rāḥ kármaṇā devávītau  éndo viśa kaláśaṃ somadhā́naṃ  krándann ihi sū́ryasyópa raśmím

translation.text: Pouring out streams at the Gods' feast with service, thou, Soma, lookest down, a heavenly Eagle. Enter the Soma-holding beaker, Indu, and with a roar approach the ray of Sarya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒स्रो वाच॑ ईरयति॒ प्र वह्नि॑र्ऋ॒तस्य॑ धी॒तिं ब्रह्म॑णो मनी॒षाम् गावो॑ यन्ति॒ गोप॑तिं पृ॒च्छमा॑नाः॒ सोमं॑ यन्ति म॒तयो॑ वावशा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: tisró vā́ca īrayati prá váhnir  r̥tásya dhītím bráhmaṇo manīṣā́m  gā́vo yanti gópatim pr̥chámānāḥ  sómaṃ yanti matáyo vāvaśānā́ḥ

translation.text: Three are the voices that the Courser utters: he speaks the thought of prayer, the law of Order. To the Cow's Master come the Cows inquiring: the hymns with eager longing come to Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमं॒ गावो॑ धे॒नवो॑ वावशा॒नाः सोमं॒ विप्रा॑ म॒तिभिः॑ पृ॒च्छमा॑नाः सोमः॑ सु॒तः पू॑यते अ॒ज्यमा॑नः॒ सोमे॑ अ॒र्कास्त्रि॒ष्टुभः॒ सं न॑वन्ते
verses.transliteration: sómaṃ gā́vo dhenávo vāvaśānā́ḥ  sómaṃ víprā matíbhiḥ pr̥chámānāḥ  sómaḥ sutáḥ pūyate ajyámānaḥ  sóme arkā́s triṣṭúbhaḥ sáṃ navante

translation.text: To Soma come the Cows, the Milch-kine longing, to Soma sages with their hvmns inquiring. Soma, effused, is purified and blended our hymns and Trishṭup songs unite in Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा नः॑ सोम परिषि॒च्यमा॑न॒ आ प॑वस्व पू॒यमा॑नः स्व॒स्ति इन्द्र॒मा वि॑श बृह॒ता रवे॑ण व॒र्धया॒ वाचं॑ ज॒नया॒ पुरं॑धिम्
verses.transliteration: evā́ naḥ soma pariṣicyámāno  ā́ pavasva pūyámānaḥ svastí  índram ā́ viśa br̥hatā́ ráveṇa  vardháyā vā́caṃ janáyā púraṃdhim

translation.text: Thus, Soma, as we pour thee into vessels, while thou art purified flow for our welfare. Pass into Indra with a mighty roaring make the voice swell, and generate abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ जागृ॑वि॒र्विप्र॑ ऋ॒ता म॑ती॒नां सोमः॑ पुना॒नो अ॑सदच्च॒मूषु॑ सप॑न्ति॒ यं मि॑थु॒नासो॒ निका॑मा अध्व॒र्यवो॑ रथि॒रासः॑ सु॒हस्ताः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ jā́gr̥vir vípra r̥tā́ matīnā́ṃ  sómaḥ punānó asadac camū́ṣu  sápanti yám mithunā́so níkāmāḥ-  adhvaryávo rathirā́saḥ suhástāḥ

translation.text: Singer of true songs, ever-watchful, Soma hath settled in the ladles when they cleanse him. Him the Adhvaryus, paired and eager, follow, leaders of sacrifice and skilful-handed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स पु॑ना॒न उप॒ सूरे॒ न धातोभे अ॑प्रा॒ रोद॑सी॒ वि ष आ॑वः प्रि॒या चि॒द्यस्य॑ प्रिय॒सास॑ ऊ॒ती स तू धनं॑ का॒रिणे॒ न प्र यं॑सत्
verses.transliteration: sá punāná úpa sū́re ná dhā́tā-  -óbhé aprā ródasī ví ṣá āvaḥ  priyā́ cid yásya priyasā́sa ūtī́  sá tū́ dhánaṃ kāríṇe ná prá yaṃsat

translation.text: Cleansed near the Sun as 'twere he as Creator hath filled full heaven and earth, and hath disclosed them. He by whose dear help men gain all their wishes shall yield the precious meed as to a victor.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स व॑र्धि॒ता वर्ध॑नः पू॒यमा॑नः॒ सोमो॑ मी॒ढ्वाँ अ॒भि नो॒ ज्योति॑षावीत् येना॑ नः॒ पूर्वे॑ पि॒तरः॑ पद॒ज्ञाः स्व॒र्विदो॑ अ॒भि गा अद्रि॑मु॒ष्णन्
verses.transliteration: sá vardhitā́ várdhanaḥ pūyámānaḥ  sómo mīḍhvā́m̐ abhí no jyótiṣāvīt  yénā naḥ pū́rve pitáraḥ padajñā́ḥ-  svarvído abhí gā́ ádrim uṣṇán

translation.text: He, being cleansed, the Strengthener and Increaser, Soma the Bounteous, helped us with his lustre, Wherewith our sires of old who knew the footsteps found light and stole the cattle from the mountain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अक्रा॑न्त्समु॒द्रः प्र॑थ॒मे विध॑र्मञ्ज॒नय॑न्प्र॒जा भुव॑नस्य॒ राजा॑ वृषा॑ प॒वित्रे॒ अधि॒ सानो॒ अव्ये॑ बृ॒हत्सोमो॑ वावृधे सुवा॒न इन्दुः॑
verses.transliteration: ákrān samudráḥ prathamé vídharmañ  janáyan prajā́ bhúvanasya rā́jā  vŕ̥ṣā pavítre ádhi sā́no ávye  br̥hát sómo vāvr̥dhe suvāná índuḥ

translation.text: In the first vault of heaven loud roared the Ocean, King of all being, generating creatures. Steer, in the filter, on the fleecy summit, Soma, the Drop effused, hath waxen mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हत्तत्सोमो॑ महि॒षश्च॑कारा॒पां यद्गर्भोऽवृ॑णीत दे॒वान् अद॑धा॒दिन्द्रे॒ पव॑मान॒ ओजोऽज॑नय॒त्सूर्ये॒ ज्योति॒रिन्दुः॑
verses.transliteration: mahát tát sómo mahiṣáś cakāra-  -apā́ṃ yád gárbhó 'vr̥ṇīta devā́n  ádadhād índre pávamāna ójaḥ-  -ájanayat sū́rye jyótir índuḥ

translation.text: Soma the Steer, in that as Child of Waters he chose the Gods, performed that great achievement. He, Pavamâna, granted strength to Indra; he, Indu, generated light in Sûrya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मत्सि॑ वा॒युमि॒ष्टये॒ राध॑से च॒ मत्सि॑ मि॒त्रावरु॑णा पू॒यमा॑नः मत्सि॒ शर्धो॒ मारु॑तं॒ मत्सि॑ दे॒वान्मत्सि॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी दे॑व सोम
verses.transliteration: mátsi vāyúm iṣṭáye rā́dhase ca  mátsi mitrā́váruṇā pūyámānaḥ  mátsi śárdho mā́rutam mátsi devā́n  mátsi dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ deva soma

translation.text: Make Vâyu glad,, for furtherance and bounty: cheer Varuṇa and Mitra, as they cleanse thee. Gladden the Gods, gladden the host of Maruts: make Heaven and Earth rejoice, O God, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒जुः प॑वस्व वृजि॒नस्य॑ ह॒न्तापामी॑वां॒ बाध॑मानो॒ मृध॑श्च अ॒भि॒श्री॒णन्पयः॒ पय॑सा॒भि गोना॒मिन्द्र॑स्य॒ त्वं तव॑ व॒यं सखा॑यः
verses.transliteration: r̥júḥ pavasva vr̥jinásya hantā́-  -ápā́mīvām bā́dhamāno mŕ̥dhaś ca  abhiśrīṇán páyaḥ páyasābhí gónām  índrasya tváṃ táva vayáṃ sákhāyaḥ

translation.text: Flow onward righteous slayer of the wicked, driving away our enemies and sickness, Blending thy milk with milk which cows afford us. We are thy friends, thou art the Friend of Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मध्वः॒ सूदं॑ पवस्व॒ वस्व॒ उत्सं॑ वी॒रं च॑ न॒ आ प॑वस्वा॒ भगं॑ च स्वद॒स्वेन्द्रा॑य॒ पव॑मान इन्दो र॒यिं च॑ न॒ आ प॑वस्वा समु॒द्रात्
verses.transliteration: mádhvaḥ sū́dam pavasva vásva útsaṃ  vīráṃ ca na ā́ pavasvā bhágaṃ ca  svádasvéndrāya pávamāna indo  rayíṃ ca na ā́ pavasvā samudrā́t

translation.text: Pour us a fount of meath, a spring of treasure; send us a hero son and happy fortune. Be sweet to India when they cleanse thee, Indu, and pour down riches on us from the ocean.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमः॑ सु॒तो धार॒यात्यो॒ न हित्वा॒ सिन्धु॒र्न नि॒म्नम॒भि वा॒ज्य॑क्षाः आ योनिं॒ वन्य॑मसदत्पुना॒नः समिन्दु॒र्गोभि॑रसर॒त्सम॒द्भिः
verses.transliteration: sómaḥ sutó dhā́rayā́tyo ná hítvā  síndhur ná nimnám abhí vājy àkṣāḥ  ā́ yóniṃ ványam asadat punānáḥ  sám índur góbhir asarat sám adbhíḥ

translation.text: Strong Soma, pressed, like an impetuous courser, hath flowed in stream as a flood speeding downward. Cleansed, he hath settled in his wooden dwelling: Indu hath flowed with milk and with the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्य ते॑ पवत इन्द्र॒ सोम॑श्च॒मूषु॒ धीर॑ उश॒ते तव॑स्वान् स्व॑र्चक्षा रथि॒रः स॒त्यशु॑ष्मः॒ कामो॒ न यो दे॑वय॒तामस॑र्जि
verses.transliteration: eṣá syá te pavata indra sómaś  camū́ṣu dhī́ra uśaté távasvān  svàrcakṣā rathiráḥ satyáśuṣmaḥ  kā́mo ná yó devayatā́m ásarji

translation.text: Strong, wise, for thee who longest for his coming this Soma here flows to the bowls, O Indra. He, chariot-borne, sun-bright, and truly potent, was poured forth like the longing of the pious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष प्र॒त्नेन॒ वय॑सा पुना॒नस्ति॒रो वर्पां॑सि दुहि॒तुर्दधा॑नः वसा॑नः॒ शर्म॑ त्रि॒वरू॑थम॒प्सु होते॑व याति॒ सम॑नेषु॒ रेभ॑न्
verses.transliteration: eṣá pratnéna váyasā punānás  tiró várpāṃsi duhitúr dádhānaḥ  vásānaḥ śárma trivárūtham apsú  hóteva yāti sámaneṣu rébhan

translation.text: He, purified with ancient vital vigour, pervading all his Daughter's forms and figures, Finding his threefold refuge in the waters, goes singing, as a priest, to the assemblies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू न॒स्त्वं र॑थि॒रो दे॑व सोम॒ परि॑ स्रव च॒म्वोः॑ पू॒यमा॑नः अ॒प्सु स्वादि॑ष्ठो॒ मधु॑माँ ऋ॒तावा॑ दे॒वो न यः स॑वि॒ता स॒त्यम॑न्मा
verses.transliteration: nū́ nas tváṃ rathiró deva soma  pári srava camvòḥ pūyámānaḥ  apsú svā́diṣṭho mádhumām̐ r̥tā́vā  devó ná yáḥ savitā́ satyámanmā

translation.text: Now, chariot-borne, flow unto us, God Soma, as thou art purified flow to the saucers, Sweetest in waters, rich in meath, and holy, as Savitar the God is, truthfulminded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि वा॒युं वी॒त्य॑र्षा गृणा॒नो॒३॒॑ऽभि मि॒त्रावरु॑णा पू॒यमा॑नः अ॒भी नरं॑ धी॒जव॑नं रथे॒ष्ठाम॒भीन्द्रं॒ वृष॑णं॒ वज्र॑बाहुम्
verses.transliteration: abhí vāyúṃ vīty àrṣā gr̥ṇānáḥ-  -abhí mitrā́váruṇā pūyámānaḥ  abhī́ náraṃ dhījávanaṃ ratheṣṭhā́m  abhī́ndraṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vájrabāhum

translation.text: To feast him, flow mid song and hymn, to Vâyu, flow purified to Varuṇa and Mitra. Flow to the song-inspiring car-borne Hero, to mighty Indra, him who wields the thunder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि वस्त्रा॑ सुवस॒नान्य॑र्षा॒भि धे॒नूः सु॒दुघाः॑ पू॒यमा॑नः अ॒भि च॒न्द्रा भर्त॑वे नो॒ हिर॑ण्या॒भ्यश्वा॑न्र॒थिनो॑ देव सोम
verses.transliteration: abhí vástrā suvasanā́ny arṣa-  -abhí dhenū́ḥ sudúghāḥ pūyámānaḥ  abhí candrā́ bhártave no híraṇyā-  -abhy áśvān rathíno deva soma

translation.text: Pour on us garments that shall clothe us meetly, send, purified, miIch-kine, abundant yielders. God Soma, send us chariot-drawing horses that they may bring us treasures bright and golden.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भी नो॑ अर्ष दि॒व्या वसू॑न्य॒भि विश्वा॒ पार्थि॑वा पू॒यमा॑नः अ॒भि येन॒ द्रवि॑णम॒श्नवा॑मा॒भ्या॑र्षे॒यं ज॑मदग्नि॒वन्नः॑
verses.transliteration: abhī́ no arṣa divyā́ vásūni-  abhí víśvā pā́rthivā pūyámānaḥ  abhí yéna dráviṇam aśnávāma-  -abhy ā̀rṣeyáṃ jamadagniván naḥ

translation.text: Send to us in a stream celestial riches, send us, when thou art cleansed, what earth containeth, So that thereby we may acquire possessions and R̥ishihood in Jamadagni's manner.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒या प॒वा प॑वस्वै॒ना वसू॑नि माँश्च॒त्व इ॑न्दो॒ सर॑सि॒ प्र ध॑न्व ब्र॒ध्नश्चि॒दत्र॒ वातो॒ न जू॒तः पु॑रु॒मेध॑श्चि॒त्तक॑वे॒ नरं॑ दात्
verses.transliteration: ayā́ pavā́ pavasvainā́ vásūni  mām̐ścatvá indo sárasi prá dhanva  bradhnáś cid átra vā́to ná jūtáḥ  purumédhaś cit tákave náraṃ dāt

translation.text: Pour forth this wealth with this purification: flow onward to the yellow lake, O Indu. Here, too, the Ruddy, wind-swift, full of wisdom, Shall give a son to him who cometh quickly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त न॑ ए॒ना प॑व॒या प॑व॒स्वाधि॑ श्रु॒ते श्र॒वाय्य॑स्य ती॒र्थे ष॒ष्टिं स॒हस्रा॑ नैगु॒तो वसू॑नि वृ॒क्षं न प॒क्वं धू॑नव॒द्रणा॑य
verses.transliteration: utá na enā́ pavayā́ pavasva-  -ádhi śruté śravā́yyasya tīrthé  ṣaṣṭíṃ sahásrā naigutó vásūni  vr̥kṣáṃ ná pakváṃ dhūnavad ráṇāya

translation.text: Flow on for us with this purification to the famed ford of thee whose due is glory. May the Foe-queller shake us down, for triumph, like a tree's ripe fruit, sixty thousand treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मही॒मे अ॑स्य॒ वृष॒नाम॑ शू॒षे माँश्च॑त्वे वा॒ पृश॑ने वा॒ वध॑त्रे अस्वा॑पयन्नि॒गुतः॑ स्ने॒हय॒च्चापा॒मित्राँ॒ अपा॒चितो॑ अचे॒तः
verses.transliteration: máhīmé asya vŕ̥ṣanā́ma śūṣé  mā́m̐ścatve vā pŕ̥śane vā vádhatre  ásvāpayan nigútaḥ sneháyac ca-  -ápāmítrām̐ ápācíto acetáḥ

translation.text: Eagerly do we pray for those two exploits, at the blue lake and Pr̥iṣana, wrought in battle. He sent our enemies to sleep and slew them, and turned away the foolish and unfriendly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं त्री प॒वित्रा॒ वित॑तान्ये॒ष्यन्वेकं॑ धावसि पू॒यमा॑नः असि॒ भगो॒ असि॑ दा॒त्रस्य॑ दा॒तासि॑ म॒घवा॑ म॒घव॑द्भ्य इन्दो
verses.transliteration: sáṃ trī́ pavítrā vítatāny eṣi-  ánv ékaṃ dhāvasi pūyámānaḥ  ási bhágo ási dātrásya dātā-  -ási maghávā maghávadbhya indo

translation.text: Thou comest unto three extended filters, and hasteriest through each one as they cleanse thee. Thou art the giver of the gift, a Bhaga, a Maghavan for liberal lords, O Indu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष वि॑श्व॒वित्प॑वते मनी॒षी सोमो॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ राजा॑ द्र॒प्साँ ई॒रय॑न्वि॒दथे॒ष्विन्दु॒र्वि वार॒मव्यं॑ स॒मयाति॑ याति
verses.transliteration: eṣá viśvavít pavate manīṣī́  sómo víśvasya bhúvanasya rā́jā  drapsā́m̐ īráyan vidátheṣv índur  ví vā́ram ávyaṃ samáyā́ti yāti

translation.text: This Soma here, the Wise, the All-obtainer, flows on his way as King of all existence. Driving the drops at our assemblies, Indu completely traverses the fleecy filter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्दुं॑ रिहन्ति महि॒षा अद॑ब्धाः प॒दे रे॑भन्ति क॒वयो॒ न गृध्राः॑ हि॒न्वन्ति॒ धीरा॑ द॒शभिः॒ क्षिपा॑भिः॒ सम॑ञ्जते रू॒पम॒पां रसे॑न
verses.transliteration: índuṃ rihanti mahiṣā́ ádabdhāḥ  padé rebhanti kaváyo ná gŕ̥dhrāḥ  hinvánti dhī́rā daśábhiḥ kṣípābhiḥ  sám añjate rūpám apā́ṃ rásena

translation.text: The Great Inviolate are kissing Indu, and singing in his place like eager sages. The wise men send him forth with ten swift fingers, and balm his form with essence of the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वया॑ व॒यं पव॑मानेन सोम॒ भरे॑ कृ॒तं वि चि॑नुयाम॒ शश्व॑त् तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: tváyā vayám pávamānena soma  bháre kr̥táṃ ví cinuyāma śáśvat  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Soma, may we, with thee as Pavamâna, pile up together all our spoil in battle. This boon vouchsafe us Varuṇa and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि नो॑ वाज॒सात॑मं र॒यिम॑र्ष पुरु॒स्पृह॑म् इन्दो॑ स॒हस्र॑भर्णसं तुविद्यु॒म्नं वि॑भ्वा॒सह॑म्
verses.transliteration: abhí no vājasā́tamaṃ  rayím arṣa puruspŕ̥ham  índo sahásrabharṇasam  tuvidyumnáṃ vibhvāsáham

translation.text: STREAM on us riches that are sought by many, best at winning strength Riches, O Indu, thousandfold, glorious, conquering the great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ ष्य सु॑वा॒नो अ॒व्ययं॒ रथे॒ न वर्मा॑व्यत इन्दु॑र॒भि द्रुणा॑ हि॒तो हि॑या॒नो धारा॑भिरक्षाः
verses.transliteration: pári ṣyá suvānó avyáyaṃ  ráthe ná vármāvyata  índur abhí drúṇā hitó  hiyānó dhā́rābhir akṣāḥ

translation.text: Effused, he hath, as on a car, invested him in fleecy mail: Onward hath Indu flowed in streams, impelled, surrounded by the wood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ ष्य सु॑वा॒नो अ॑क्षा॒ इन्दु॒रव्ये॒ मद॑च्युतः धारा॒ य ऊ॒र्ध्वो अ॑ध्व॒रे भ्रा॒जा नैति॑ गव्य॒युः
verses.transliteration: pári ṣyá suvānó akṣāḥ-  índur ávye mádacyutaḥ  dhā́rā yá ūrdhvó adhvaré  bhrājā́ naíti gavyayúḥ

translation.text: Effused, this Indu hath flowed on, distilling rapture, to the fleece: He goes erect, as seeking kine in stream, with light, to sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि त्वं दे॑व॒ शश्व॑ते॒ वसु॒ मर्ता॑य दा॒शुषे॑ इन्दो॑ सह॒स्रिणं॑ र॒यिं श॒तात्मा॑नं विवाससि
verses.transliteration: sá hí tváṃ deva śáśvate  vásu mártāya dāśúṣe  índo sahasríṇaṃ rayíṃ  śatā́tmānaṃ vivāsasi

translation.text: For thou thyself, O Indu, God, to every mortal worshipper Attractest riches thousandfold, made manifest in hundred forms.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं ते॑ अ॒स्य वृ॑त्रह॒न्वसो॒ वस्वः॑ पुरु॒स्पृहः॑ नि नेदि॑ष्ठतमा इ॒षः स्याम॑ सु॒म्नस्या॑ध्रिगो
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ te asyá vr̥trahan  váso vásvaḥ puruspŕ̥haḥ  ní nédiṣṭhatamā iṣáḥ  syā́ma sumnásyādhrigo

translation.text: Good Vr̥itra-slayer, may we be still nearest to this wealth of thine Which many crave, nearest to food and happiness, Resistless One!

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्विर्यं पञ्च॒ स्वय॑शसं॒ स्वसा॑रो॒ अद्रि॑संहतम् प्रि॒यमिन्द्र॑स्य॒ काम्यं॑ प्रस्ना॒पय॑न्त्यू॒र्मिण॑म्
verses.transliteration: dvír yám páñca sváyaśasaṃ  svásāro ádrisaṃhatam  priyám índrasya kā́myam  prasnāpáyanty ūrmíṇam

translation.text: Whom, bright with native splendour, crushed between the pair of pressingstones- The wavy Friend whom Indra loves-the twice-five sisters dip and bathe,

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ त्यं ह॑र्य॒तं हरिं॑ ब॒भ्रुं पु॑नन्ति॒ वारे॑ण यो दे॒वान्विश्वाँ॒ इत्परि॒ मदे॑न स॒ह गच्छ॑ति
verses.transliteration: pári tyáṃ haryatáṃ hárim  babhrúm punanti vā́reṇa  yó devā́n víśvām̐ ít pári  mádena sahá gáchati

translation.text: Him with the fleece they purify, brown, golden-hued, beloved of all, Who with exhilarating juice goes forth to all the Deities.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य वो॒ ह्यव॑सा॒ पान्तो॑ दक्ष॒साध॑नम् यः सू॒रिषु॒ श्रवो॑ बृ॒हद्द॒धे स्व१॒॑र्ण ह॑र्य॒तः
verses.transliteration: asyá vo hy ávasā  pā́nto dakṣasā́dhanam  yáḥ sūríṣu śrávo br̥hád  dadhé svàr ṇá haryatáḥ

translation.text: Through longing for this sap of yours ye drink what brings ability, Even him who, dear as heaven's own light, gives to our princes high renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वां॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॑ मानवी॒ इन्दु॑र्जनिष्ट रोदसी दे॒वो दे॑वी गिरि॒ष्ठा अस्रे॑ध॒न्तं तु॑वि॒ष्वणि॑
verses.transliteration: sá vāṃ yajñéṣu mānavī  índur janiṣṭa rodasī  devó devī giriṣṭhā́ḥ-  ásredhan táṃ tuviṣváṇi

translation.text: Indu at holy rites produced you, Heaven and Earth, the Friends of men, Hill-haunting God the Goddesses. They bruised him where the roar was loud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य सोम॒ पात॑वे वृत्र॒घ्ने परि॑ षिच्यसे नरे॑ च॒ दक्षि॑णावते दे॒वाय॑ सदना॒सदे॑
verses.transliteration: índrāya soma pā́tave  vr̥traghné pári ṣicyase  náre ca dákṣiṇāvate  devā́ya sadanāsáde

translation.text: For Vr̥itra-slaying Indra, thou, Soma, art poured that he may drink, Poured for the guerdon-giving man, poured for the God who sitteth there.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते प्र॒त्नासो॒ व्यु॑ष्टिषु॒ सोमाः॑ प॒वित्रे॑ अक्षरन् अ॒प॒प्रोथ॑न्तः सनु॒तर्हु॑र॒श्चितः॑ प्रा॒तस्ताँ अप्र॑चेतसः
verses.transliteration: té pratnā́so vyùṣṭiṣu  sómāḥ pavítre akṣaran  apapróthantaḥ sanutár huraścítaḥ  prātás tā́m̐ ápracetasaḥ

translation.text: These ancient Somas, at the break of day, have flowed into the sieve, Snorting away at early morn these foolish evil-hearted ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं स॑खायः पुरो॒रुचं॑ यू॒यं व॒यं च॑ सू॒रयः॑ अ॒श्याम॒ वाज॑गन्ध्यं स॒नेम॒ वाज॑पस्त्यम्
verses.transliteration: táṃ sakhāyaḥ purorúcaṃ  yūyáṃ vayáṃ ca sūráyaḥ  aśyā́ma vā́jagandhyaṃ  sanéma vā́japastyam

translation.text: Friends, may the princes, ye and we, obtain this Most Resplendent One. Gain him who hath the smell of strength, win him whose home is very strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ह॑र्य॒ताय॑ धृ॒ष्णवे॒ धनु॑स्तन्वन्ति॒ पौंस्य॑म् शु॒क्रां व॑य॒न्त्यसु॑राय नि॒र्णिजं॑ वि॒पामग्रे॑ मही॒युवः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ haryatā́ya dhr̥ṣṇáve  dhánus tanvanti paúṃsyam  śukrā́ṃ vayanty ásurāya nirṇíjaṃ  vipā́m ágre mahīyúvaḥ

translation.text: THEY for the Bold and Lovely One ply manly vigour like a bow: joyous, in front of songs they weave bright raiment for the Lord Divine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॑ क्ष॒पा परि॑ष्कृतो॒ वाजाँ॑ अ॒भि प्र गा॑हते यदी॑ वि॒वस्व॑तो॒ धियो॒ हरिं॑ हि॒न्वन्ति॒ यात॑वे
verses.transliteration: ádha kṣapā́ páriṣkr̥to  vā́jām̐ abhí prá gāhate  yádī vivásvato dhíyo  háriṃ hinvánti yā́tave

translation.text: And he, made beautiful by night, dips forward into strengthening food', What time the sacrificer's thoughts speed on his way the Golden-hued.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तम॑स्य मर्जयामसि॒ मदो॒ य इ॑न्द्र॒पात॑मः यं गाव॑ आ॒सभि॑र्द॒धुः पु॒रा नू॒नं च॑ सू॒रयः॑
verses.transliteration: tám asya marjayāmasi  mádo yá indrapā́tamaḥ  yáṃ gā́va āsábhir dadhúḥ  purā́ nūnáṃ ca sūráyaḥ

translation.text: We cleanse this gladdening drink of his the juice which Indra chiefly drinks--- That which kine took into their mouths, of old, and princes take it now.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं गाथ॑या पुरा॒ण्या पु॑ना॒नम॒भ्य॑नूषत उ॒तो कृ॑पन्त धी॒तयो॑ दे॒वानां॒ नाम॒ बिभ्र॑तीः
verses.transliteration: táṃ gā́thayā purāṇyā́  punānám abhy ànūṣata  utó kr̥panta dhītáyo  devā́nāṃ nā́ma bíbhratīḥ

translation.text: To him, while purifying, they have raised the ancient psalm of praise: And sacred songs which bear the names of Gods have supplicated him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॒क्षमा॑णम॒व्यये॒ वारे॑ पुनन्ति धर्ण॒सिम् दू॒तं न पू॒र्वचि॑त्तय॒ आ शा॑सते मनी॒षिणः॑
verses.transliteration: tám ukṣámāṇam avyáye  vā́re punanti dharṇasím  dūtáṃ ná pūrvácittaye-  ā́ śāsate manīṣíṇaḥ

translation.text: They purify him as he drops, courageous, in the fleecy sieve. Him they instruct as messenger to bear the sage's morning prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स पु॑ना॒नो म॒दिन्त॑मः॒ सोम॑श्च॒मूषु॑ सीदति प॒शौ न रेत॑ आ॒दध॒त्पति॑र्वचस्यते धि॒यः
verses.transliteration: sá punānó madíntamaḥ  sómaś camū́ṣu sīdati  paśaú ná réta ādádhat  pátir vacasyate dhiyáḥ

translation.text: Soma, best Cheerer, takes his seat, the while they cleanse him in the bowls. He as it were impregns the cow, and babbles on, the Lord of Song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स मृ॑ज्यते सु॒कर्म॑भिर्दे॒वो दे॒वेभ्यः॑ सु॒तः वि॒दे यदा॑सु संद॒दिर्म॒हीर॒पो वि गा॑हते
verses.transliteration: sá mr̥jyate sukármabhir  devó devébhyaḥ sutáḥ  vidé yád āsu saṃdadír  mahī́r apó ví gāhate

translation.text: He is effused and beautified, a God for Gods, by skilful men. He penetrates the mighty floods collecting all he knows therein.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒त इ॑न्दो प॒वित्र॒ आ नृभि॑र्य॒तो वि नी॑यसे इन्द्रा॑य मत्स॒रिन्त॑मश्च॒मूष्वा नि षी॑दसि
verses.transliteration: sutá indo pavítra~ā́  nŕ̥bhir yató ví nīyase  índrāya matsaríntamaḥ  camū́ṣv ā́ ní ṣīdasi

translation.text: Pressed, Indu, guided by the men, thou art led to the cleaning sieve. Thou, yielding Indra highest joy, takest thy seat within the bowls.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भी न॑वन्ते अ॒द्रुहः॑ प्रि॒यमिन्द्र॑स्य॒ काम्य॑म् व॒त्सं न पूर्व॒ आयु॑नि जा॒तं रि॑हन्ति मा॒तरः॑
verses.transliteration: abhī́ navante adrúhaḥ  priyám índrasya kā́myam  vatsáṃ ná pū́rva ā́yuni  jātáṃ rihanti mātáraḥ

translation.text: THE Guileless Ones are singing praise to Indra's well beloved Friend, As, in the morning of its life, the mothers lick the new-born calf.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒ना॒न इ॑न्द॒वा भ॑र॒ सोम॑ द्वि॒बर्ह॑सं र॒यिम् त्वं वसू॑नि पुष्यसि॒ विश्वा॑नि दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हे
verses.transliteration: punāná indav ā́ bhara  sóma dvibárhasaṃ rayím  tváṃ vásūni puṣyasi  víśvāni dāśúṣo gr̥hé

translation.text: O Indu, while they cleanse thee bring, O Soma, doubly-waxing wealth Thou in the worshipper's abode causest all treasures to increase.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं धियं॑ मनो॒युजं॑ सृ॒जा वृ॒ष्टिं न त॑न्य॒तुः त्वं वसू॑नि॒ पार्थि॑वा दि॒व्या च॑ सोम पुष्यसि
verses.transliteration: tváṃ dhíyam manoyújaṃ  sr̥jā́ vr̥ṣṭíṃ ná tanyatúḥ  tváṃ vásūni pā́rthivā  divyā́ ca soma puṣyasi

translation.text: Set free the. song which mind hath yoked, even as thunder frees the rain: All treasures of the earth and heaven, O Soma, thou dost multiply.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ ते जि॒ग्युषो॑ यथा॒ धारा॑ सु॒तस्य॑ धावति रंह॑माणा॒ व्य१॒॑व्ययं॒ वारं॑ वा॒जीव॑ सान॒सिः
verses.transliteration: pári te jigyúṣo yathā  dhā́rā sutásya dhāvati  ráṃhamāṇā vy àvyáyaṃ  vā́raṃ vājī́va sānasíḥ

translation.text: Thy stream when thou art pressed runs on like some victorious warrior's steed Hastening onward through the fleece like a fierce horse who wins the prize.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्रत्वे॒ दक्षा॑य नः कवे॒ पव॑स्व सोम॒ धार॑या इन्द्रा॑य॒ पात॑वे सु॒तो मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णाय च
verses.transliteration: krátve dákṣāya naḥ kave  pávasva soma dhā́rayā  índrāya pā́tave sutáḥ  mitrā́ya váruṇāya ca

translation.text: Flow on, Sage Soma, with thy stream to give us mental power and strength, Effused for Indra, for his drink, for Mitra and for Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व वाज॒सात॑मः प॒वित्रे॒ धार॑या सु॒तः इन्द्रा॑य सोम॒ विष्ण॑वे दे॒वेभ्यो॒ मधु॑मत्तमः
verses.transliteration: pávasva vājasā́tamaḥ  pavítre dhā́rayā sutáḥ  índrāya soma víṣṇave  devébhyo mádhumattamaḥ

translation.text: Flow to the filter with thy stream, effused, best winner, thou, of spoil, O Soma, as most rich in sweets for Indra, Vishṇu, and the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां रि॑हन्ति मा॒तरो॒ हरिं॑ प॒वित्रे॑ अ॒द्रुहः॑ व॒त्सं जा॒तं न धे॒नवः॒ पव॑मान॒ विध॑र्मणि
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ rihanti mātáro  hárim pavítre adrúhaḥ  vatsáṃ jātáṃ ná dhenávaḥ  pávamāna vídharmaṇi

translation.text: The mothers, void of guiles, caress thee Golden-coloured, in the sieve, As cows, O Pavamâna, lick the new-born calf, as Law commands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑मान॒ महि॒ श्रव॑श्चि॒त्रेभि॑र्यासि र॒श्मिभिः॑ शर्ध॒न्तमां॑सि जिघ्नसे॒ विश्वा॑नि दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हे
verses.transliteration: pávamāna máhi śrávaḥ  citrébhir yāsi raśmíbhiḥ  śárdhan támāṃsi jighnase  víśvāni dāśúṣo gr̥hé

translation.text: Thou, Pavamâna, movest on with wondrous rays to great renown. Striving within the votary's house thou drivest all the glooms away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं द्यां च॑ महिव्रत पृथि॒वीं चाति॑ जभ्रिषे प्रति॑ द्रा॒पिम॑मुञ्चथाः॒ पव॑मान महित्व॒ना
verses.transliteration: tváṃ dyā́ṃ ca mahivrata  pr̥thivī́ṃ cā́ti jabhriṣe  práti drāpím amuñcathāḥ  pávamāna mahitvanā́

translation.text: Lord of great sway, thou liftest thee above the heavens, above the earth. Thou, Pavamâna hast assumed thy coat of mail in majesty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रोजि॑ती वो॒ अन्ध॑सः सु॒ताय॑ मादयि॒त्नवे॑ अप॒ श्वानं॑ श्नथिष्टन॒ सखा॑यो दीर्घजि॒ह्व्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: purójitī vo ándhasaḥ  sutā́ya mādayitnáve  ápa śvā́naṃ śnathiṣṭana  sákhāyo dīrghajihvyàm

translation.text: FOR first possession of your juice, for the exhilarating drink, Drive ye away the dog, my friends, drive ye the long-tongued dog away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो धार॑या पाव॒कया॑ परिप्र॒स्यन्द॑ते सु॒तः इन्दु॒रश्वो॒ न कृत्व्यः॑
verses.transliteration: yó dhā́rayā pāvakáyā  pariprasyándate sutáḥ  índur áśvo ná kŕ̥tvyaḥ

translation.text: He who with purifying stream, effused, comes flowing hitherward, Indu, is like an able steed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं दु॒रोष॑म॒भी नरः॒ सोमं॑ वि॒श्वाच्या॑ धि॒या य॒ज्ञं हि॑न्व॒न्त्यद्रि॑भिः
verses.transliteration: táṃ duróṣam abhī́ náraḥ  sómaṃ viśvā́cyā dhiyā́  yajñáṃ hinvanty ádribhiḥ

translation.text: The men with all-pervading song send unassailable Soma forth, By pressing-stones, to sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒तासो॒ मधु॑मत्तमाः॒ सोमा॒ इन्द्रा॑य म॒न्दिनः॑ प॒वित्र॑वन्तो अक्षरन्दे॒वान्ग॑च्छन्तु वो॒ मदाः॑
verses.transliteration: sutā́so mádhumattamāḥ  sómā índrāya mandínaḥ  pavítravanto akṣaran  devā́n gachantu vo mádāḥ

translation.text: The Somas, very rich in sweets, for which the sieve is destined, flow, Effused, the source of Indra's joy: may your strong juices reach the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्दु॒रिन्द्रा॑य पवत॒ इति॑ दे॒वासो॑ अब्रुवन् वा॒चस्पति॑र्मखस्यते॒ विश्व॒स्येशा॑न॒ ओज॑सा
verses.transliteration: índur índrāya pavate-  íti devā́so abruvan  vācás pátir makhasyate  víśvasyéśāna ójasā

translation.text: Indu flows on for Indra's sake: thus have the Deities declared. The Lord of Speech exerts himself, Ruler of all, because of might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्र॑धारः पवते समु॒द्रो वा॑चमीङ्ख॒यः सोमः॒ पती॑ रयी॒णां सखेन्द्र॑स्य दि॒वेदि॑वे
verses.transliteration: sahásradhāraḥ pavate  samudró vācamīṅkhayáḥ  sómaḥ pátī rayīṇā́ṃ  sákhéndrasya divé-dive

translation.text: Inciter of the voice of song, with thousand streams the ocean flows, Even Soma, Lord of opulence, the Friend of Indra, day by day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं पू॒षा र॒यिर्भगः॒ सोमः॑ पुना॒नो अ॑र्षति पति॒र्विश्व॑स्य॒ भूम॑नो॒ व्य॑ख्य॒द्रोद॑सी उ॒भे
verses.transliteration: ayám pūṣā́ rayír bhágaḥ  sómaḥ punānó arṣati  pátir víśvasya bhū́mano  vy àkhyad ródasī ubhé

translation.text: As Pûshan, Fortune, Bhaga, comes this Soma while they make him pure. He, Lord of the multitude, hath looked upon the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समु॑ प्रि॒या अ॑नूषत॒ गावो॒ मदा॑य॒ घृष्व॑यः सोमा॑सः कृण्वते प॒थः पव॑मानास॒ इन्द॑वः
verses.transliteration: sám u priyā́ anūṣata  gā́vo mádāya ghŕ̥ṣvayaḥ  sómāsaḥ kr̥ṇvate patháḥ  pávamānāsa índavaḥ

translation.text: The dear cows lowed in joyful mood together to the gladdening drink. The drops as they were purified, the Soma juices, made then paths.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ओजि॑ष्ठ॒स्तमा भ॑र॒ पव॑मान श्र॒वाय्य॑म् यः पञ्च॑ चर्ष॒णीर॒भि र॒यिं येन॒ वना॑महै
verses.transliteration: yá ójiṣṭhas tám ā́ bhara  pávamāna śravā́yyam  yáḥ páñca carṣaṇī́r abhí  rayíṃ yéna vánāmahai

translation.text: O Pavamâna, bring the juice, the mightiest, worthy to be famed, Which the Five Tribes have over them, whereby we may win opulence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमाः॑ पवन्त॒ इन्द॑वो॒ऽस्मभ्यं॑ गातु॒वित्त॑माः मि॒त्राः सु॑वा॒ना अ॑रे॒पसः॑ स्वा॒ध्यः॑ स्व॒र्विदः॑
verses.transliteration: sómāḥ pavanta índavo  -asmábhyaṃ gātuvíttamāḥ  mitrā́ḥ suvānā́ arepásaḥ  svādhyàḥ svarvídaḥ

translation.text: For us the Soma juices flow, the drops best furtherers of our weal, Effused as friends without a spot, benevolent, finders of the light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒ष्वा॒णासो॒ व्यद्रि॑भि॒श्चिता॑ना॒ गोरधि॑ त्व॒चि इष॑म॒स्मभ्य॑म॒भितः॒ सम॑स्वरन्वसु॒विदः॑
verses.transliteration: suṣvāṇā́so vy ádribhiś  cítānā gór ádhi tvací  íṣam asmábhyam abhítaḥ  sám asvaran vasuvídaḥ

translation.text: Effused by means of pressing-stones, upon the ox-hide visible, They, treasure-finders, have announced food unto us from every side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते पू॒ता वि॑प॒श्चितः॒ सोमा॑सो॒ दध्या॑शिरः सूर्या॑सो॒ न द॑र्श॒तासो॑ जिग॒त्नवो॑ ध्रु॒वा घृ॒ते
verses.transliteration: eté pūtā́ vipaścítaḥ  sómāso dádhyāśiraḥ  sū́ryāso ná darśatā́so  jigatnávo dhruvā́ ghr̥té

translation.text: Tlese Soma juices, skilled in song, purified, blent with milk and curd, When moving and when firmly laid in oil, resemble lovely Suns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सु॑न्वा॒नस्यान्ध॑सो॒ मर्तो॒ न वृ॑त॒ तद्वचः॑ अप॒ श्वान॑मरा॒धसं॑ ह॒ता म॒खं न भृग॑वः
verses.transliteration: prá sunvānásyā́ndhaso  márto ná vr̥ta tád vácaḥ  ápa śvā́nam arādhásaṃ  hatā́ makháṃ ná bhŕ̥gavaḥ

translation.text: Let not the power of men restrain the voice of the outpouring juice: As Bhr̥igu's sons chased Makha, so drive ye the greedy hound away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ जा॒मिरत्के॑ अव्यत भु॒जे न पु॒त्र ओ॒ण्योः॑ सर॑ज्जा॒रो न योष॑णां व॒रो न योनि॑मा॒सद॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ jāmír átke avyata  bhujé ná putrá oṇyòḥ  sáraj jāró ná yóṣaṇāṃ  varó ná yónim āsádam

translation.text: The Friend hath wrapped him in his robe, as in his parents arms, a son. He went, as lover to a dame, to take his station suitor-like.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वी॒रो द॑क्ष॒साध॑नो॒ वि यस्त॒स्तम्भ॒ रोद॑सी हरिः॑ प॒वित्रे॑ अव्यत वे॒धा न योनि॑मा॒सद॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá vīró dakṣasā́dhano  ví yás tastámbha ródasī  háriḥ pavítre avyata  vedhā́ ná yónim āsádam

translation.text: That Hero who produces strength, he who hath propped both worlds apart, Gold-hued, hath wrapped him in the sieve, to settle, priest-like, in his place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव्यो॒ वारे॑भिः पवते॒ सोमो॒ गव्ये॒ अधि॑ त्व॒चि कनि॑क्रद॒द्वृषा॒ हरि॒रिन्द्र॑स्या॒भ्ये॑ति निष्कृ॒तम्
verses.transliteration: ávyo vā́rebhiḥ pavate  sómo gávye ádhi tvací  kánikradad vŕ̥ṣā hárir  índrasyābhy èti niṣkr̥tám

translation.text: Soma upon the ox's skin through the sheep's wool flows purified. Bellowing out, the Tawny Steer goes on to Indra's special place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्रा॒णा शिशु॑र्म॒हीनां॑ हि॒न्वन्नृ॒तस्य॒ दीधि॑तिम् विश्वा॒ परि॑ प्रि॒या भु॑व॒दध॑ द्वि॒ता
verses.transliteration: krāṇā́ śíśur mahī́nāṃ  hinvánn r̥tásya dī́dhitim  víśvā pári priyā́ bhuvad  ádha dvitā́

translation.text: THE Child, when blended with the streams, speeding the plan of sacrifice, Surpasses all things that are dear, yea, from of old.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ त्रि॒तस्य॑ पा॒ष्यो॒३॒॑रभ॑क्त॒ यद्गुहा॑ प॒दम् य॒ज्ञस्य॑ स॒प्त धाम॑भि॒रध॑ प्रि॒यम्
verses.transliteration: úpa tritásya pāṣyòr  ábhakta yád gúhā padám  yajñásya saptá dhā́mabhir  ádha priyám

translation.text: The place, near the two pressing-stones of Trita, hath he occupied, Secret and dear through seven lights of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रीणि॑ त्रि॒तस्य॒ धार॑या पृ॒ष्ठेष्वेर॑या र॒यिम् मिमी॑ते अस्य॒ योज॑ना॒ वि सु॒क्रतुः॑
verses.transliteration: trī́ṇi tritásya dhā́rayā  pr̥ṣṭhéṣv érayā rayím  mímīte asya yójanā  ví sukrátuḥ

translation.text: Urge to three courses, on the heights of Trita, riches in a stream. He who is passing wise measures his courses out.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒ज्ञा॒नं स॒प्त मा॒तरो॑ वे॒धाम॑शासत श्रि॒ये अ॒यं ध्रु॒वो र॑यी॒णां चिके॑त॒ यत्
verses.transliteration: jajñānáṃ saptá mātáro  vedhā́m aśāsata śriyé  ayáṃ dhruvó rayīṇā́ṃ  cíketa yát

translation.text: Even at his birth the Mothers Seven taught him, for glory, like a sage, So that he, firm and sure, hath set his mind on wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य व्र॒ते स॒जोष॑सो॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वासो॑ अ॒द्रुहः॑ स्पा॒र्हा भ॑वन्ति॒ रन्त॑यो जु॒षन्त॒ यत्
verses.transliteration: asyá vraté sajóṣaso  víśve devā́so adrúhaḥ  spārhā́ bhavanti rántayo  juṣánta yát

translation.text: Under his sway, of one accord, are all the guileless Deities: Warriors to be envied, they, when they are pleased.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यमी॒ गर्भ॑मृता॒वृधो॑ दृ॒शे चारु॒मजी॑जनन् क॒विं मंहि॑ष्ठमध्व॒रे पु॑रु॒स्पृह॑म्
verses.transliteration: yám ī gárbham r̥tāvŕ̥dho  dr̥śé cā́rum ájījanan  kavím máṃhiṣṭham adhvaré  puruspŕ̥ham

translation.text: The Babe whom they who strengthen Law have generated fair to see, Much longed for at the sacrifice, most liberal Sage,–

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मी॒ची॒ने अ॒भि त्मना॑ य॒ह्वी ऋ॒तस्य॑ मा॒तरा॑ त॒न्वा॒ना य॒ज्ञमा॑नु॒षग्यद॑ञ्ज॒ते
verses.transliteration: samīcīné abhí tmánā  yahvī́ r̥tásya mātárā  tanvānā́ yajñám ānuṣág  yád añjaté

translation.text: To him, united, of themselves, come the young Parents of the rite, When they adorn him, duly weaving sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्रत्वा॑ शु॒क्रेभि॑र॒क्षभि॑र्ऋ॒णोरप॑ व्र॒जं दि॒वः हि॒न्वन्नृ॒तस्य॒ दीधि॑तिं॒ प्राध्व॒रे
verses.transliteration: krátvā śukrébhir akṣábhir  r̥ṇór ápa vrajáṃ diváḥ  hinvánn r̥tásya dī́dhitim  prā́dhvaré

translation.text: With wisdom and with radiant eyes unbar to us the stall of heaven, Speeding at solemn rite the plan of Holy Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र पु॑ना॒नाय॑ वे॒धसे॒ सोमा॑य॒ वच॒ उद्य॑तम् भृ॒तिं न भ॑रा म॒तिभि॒र्जुजो॑षते
verses.transliteration: prá punānā́ya vedháse  sómāya váca údyatam  bhr̥tíṃ ná bharā matíbhir jújoṣate

translation.text: To Soma who is purified as ordering Priest the song is raised: Bring meed, as 'twere, to one who makes thee glad with hymns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ वारा॑ण्य॒व्यया॒ गोभि॑रञ्जा॒नो अ॑र्षति त्री ष॒धस्था॑ पुना॒नः कृ॑णुते॒ हरिः॑
verses.transliteration: pári vā́rāṇy avyáyā  góbhir añjānó arṣati  trī́ ṣadhásthā punānáḥ kr̥ṇute háriḥ

translation.text: Blended with milk and curds he flows on through the long wool of the sheep. The Gold-hued, purified, makes him three seats for rest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ कोशं॑ मधु॒श्चुत॑म॒व्यये॒ वारे॑ अर्षति अ॒भि वाणी॒र्ऋषी॑णां स॒प्त नू॑षत
verses.transliteration: pári kóśam madhuścútam  avyáye vā́re arṣati  abhí vā́ṇīr ŕ̥ṣīṇāṃ saptá nūṣata

translation.text: On through the long wool of the sheep to the meath-dropping vat he flows: The R̥ishis' sevenfold quire hath sung aloud to him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ णे॒ता म॑ती॒नां वि॒श्वदे॑वो॒ अदा॑भ्यः सोमः॑ पुना॒नश्च॒म्वो॑र्विश॒द्धरिः॑
verses.transliteration: pári ṇetā́ matīnā́ṃ  viśvádevo ádābhyaḥ  sómaḥ punānáś camvòr viśad dháriḥ

translation.text: Shared by all Gods, Infallible, the Leader of our holy hymns, Golden-hued Soma, being cleansed, hath reached the bowls.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ दैवी॒रनु॑ स्व॒धा इन्द्रे॑ण याहि स॒रथ॑म् पु॒ना॒नो वा॒घद्वा॒घद्भि॒रम॑र्त्यः
verses.transliteration: pári daívīr ánu svadhā́ḥ-  índreṇa yāhi sarátham  punānó vāghád vāghádbhir ámartyaḥ

translation.text: After thy Godlike qualities, associate with Indra, go, As a Priest purified by priests, Immortal One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ सप्ति॒र्न वा॑ज॒युर्दे॒वो दे॒वेभ्यः॑ सु॒तः व्या॒न॒शिः पव॑मानो॒ वि धा॑वति
verses.transliteration: pári sáptir ná vājayúr  devó devébhyaḥ sutáḥ  vyānaśíḥ pávamāno ví dhāvati

translation.text: Like a car-horse who shows his strength, a God effused for Deities. The penetrating Pavamâna flows along.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सखा॑य॒ आ नि षी॑दत पुना॒नाय॒ प्र गा॑यत शिशुं॒ न य॒ज्ञैः परि॑ भूषत श्रि॒ये
verses.transliteration: sákhāya ā́ ní ṣīdata  punānā́ya prá gāyata  śíśuṃ ná yajñaíḥ pári bhūṣata śriyé

translation.text: SIT down, O friends, and sing aloud to him who purifies himself: Deck him for glory, like a child, with holy rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समी॑ व॒त्सं न मा॒तृभिः॑ सृ॒जता॑ गय॒साध॑नम् दे॒वा॒व्यं१॒॑ मद॑म॒भि द्विश॑वसम्
verses.transliteration: sám ī vatsáṃ ná mātŕ̥bhiḥ  sr̥játā gayasā́dhanam  devāvyàm mádam abhí dvíśavasam

translation.text: Unite him bringing household wealth, even as a calf, with mother kine, Him who hath double strength, the God, delighting juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒नाता॑ दक्ष॒साध॑नं॒ यथा॒ शर्धा॑य वी॒तये॑ यथा॑ मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णाय॒ शंत॑मः
verses.transliteration: punā́tā dakṣasā́dhanaṃ  yáthā śárdhāya vītáye  yáthā mitrā́ya váruṇāya śáṃtamaḥ

translation.text: Purify him who gives us power, that he, most Blessed One, may be A banquet for the Troop, Mitra, and Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ त्वा वसु॒विद॑म॒भि वाणी॑रनूषत गोभि॑ष्टे॒ वर्ण॑म॒भि वा॑सयामसि
verses.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ tvā vasuvídam  abhí vā́ṇīr anūṣata  góbhiṣ ṭe várṇam abhí vāsayāmasi

translation.text: Voices have sung aloud to thee as finderout of wealth for us: We clothe the hue thou wearest with a robe of milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ मदानां पत॒ इन्दो॑ दे॒वप्स॑रा असि सखे॑व॒ सख्ये॑ गातु॒वित्त॑मो भव
verses.transliteration: sá no madānām pate-  índo devápsarā asi  sákheva sákhye gātuvíttamo bhava

translation.text: Thou, Indu, art the food of Gods, O Sovran of all gladdening drinks: As Friend for friend, be thou best finder of success.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सने॑मि कृ॒ध्य१॒॑स्मदा र॒क्षसं॒ कं चि॑द॒त्रिण॑म् अपादे॑वं द्व॒युमंहो॑ युयोधि नः
verses.transliteration: sánemi kr̥dhy àsmád~ā́  rakṣásaṃ káṃ cid atríṇam  ápā́devaṃ dvayúm áṃho yuyodhi naḥ

translation.text: Drive utterly away from us each demon, each voracious fiend, The godless and the false: keep sorrow far away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वः॑ सखायो॒ मदा॑य पुना॒नम॒भि गा॑यत शिशुं॒ न य॒ज्ञैः स्व॑दयन्त गू॒र्तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ vaḥ sakhāyo mádāya  punānám abhí gāyata  śíśuṃ ná yajñaíḥ svadayanta gūrtíbhiḥ

translation.text: SING; ye aloud, O friends, to him who makes him pure for gladdening drink: They shall make sweet the Child with sacrifice and laud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं व॒त्स इ॑व मा॒तृभि॒रिन्दु॑र्हिन्वा॒नो अ॑ज्यते दे॒वा॒वीर्मदो॑ म॒तिभिः॒ परि॑ष्कृतः
verses.transliteration: sáṃ vatsá iva mātŕ̥bhir  índur hinvānó ajyate  devāvī́r mádo matíbhiḥ páriṣkr̥taḥ

translation.text: Like as a calf with mother cows, so Indu is urged forth and sent, Glorified by our hymns, the God-delighting juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं दक्षा॑य॒ साध॑नो॒ऽयं शर्धा॑य वी॒तये॑ अ॒यं दे॒वेभ्यो॒ मधु॑मत्तमः सु॒तः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ dákṣāya sā́dhano  -ayáṃ śárdhāya vītáye  ayáṃ devébhyo mádhumattamaḥ sutáḥ

translation.text: Effectual means of power is he, he is a banquet for the Troop, He who hath been effused, most rich in meath, for Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोम॑न्न इन्दो॒ अश्व॑वत्सु॒तः सु॑दक्ष धन्व शुचिं॑ ते॒ वर्ण॒मधि॒ गोषु॑ दीधरम्
verses.transliteration: góman na indo áśvavat  sutáḥ sudakṣa dhanva  śúciṃ te várṇam ádhi góṣu dīdharam

translation.text: Flow to us, Indu, passing, strong, effused, with wealth of kine and steeds: I will spread forth above the milk thy radiant hue.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ हरीणां पत॒ इन्दो॑ दे॒वप्स॑रस्तमः सखे॑व॒ सख्ये॒ नर्यो॑ रु॒चे भ॑व
verses.transliteration: sá no harīṇām pate-  índo devápsarastamaḥ  sákheva sákhye náryo rucé bhava

translation.text: Lord of the tawny, Indu thou who art the God's most special food, As Friend to friend, for splendour be thou good to men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सने॑मि॒ त्वम॒स्मदाँ अदे॑वं॒ कं चि॑द॒त्रिण॑म् सा॒ह्वाँ इ॑न्दो॒ परि॒ बाधो॒ अप॑ द्व॒युम्
verses.transliteration: sánemi tvám asmád ā́m̐  ádevaṃ káṃ cid atríṇam  sāhvā́m̐ indo pári bā́dho ápa dvayúm

translation.text: Drive utterly, far away from us each godless, each voracious foe. O Indu, overcome and drive the false afar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒मच्छ॑ सु॒ता इ॒मे वृष॑णं यन्तु॒ हर॑यः श्रु॒ष्टी जा॒तास॒ इन्द॑वः स्व॒र्विदः॑
verses.transliteration: índram ácha sutā́ imé  vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ yantu hárayaḥ  śruṣṭī́ jātā́sa índavaḥ  svarvídaḥ

translation.text: To Indra, to the Mighty Steer, may these gold-coloured juices go, Drops rapidly produced, that find the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं भरा॑य सान॒सिरिन्द्रा॑य पवते सु॒तः सोमो॒ जैत्र॑स्य चेतति॒ यथा॑ वि॒दे
verses.transliteration: ayám bhárāya sānasír  -índrāya pavate sutáḥ  sómo jaítrasya cetati  yáthā vidé

translation.text: Effused, this juice victorious flows for Indra, for his maintenance. Soma bethinks him of the Conqueror, as he knows.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्येदिन्द्रो॒ मदे॒ष्वा ग्रा॒भं गृ॑भ्णीत सान॒सिम् वज्रं॑ च॒ वृष॑णं भर॒त्सम॑प्सु॒जित्
verses.transliteration: asyéd índro mádeṣv ā́  grābháṃ gr̥bhṇīta sānasím  vájraṃ ca vŕ̥ṣaṇam bharat  sám apsujít

translation.text: May Indra in his raptures gain from him the grasp that gathers spoil, And, winning waters, wield the steerstrong thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ध॑न्वा सोम॒ जागृ॑वि॒रिन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव द्यु॒मन्तं॒ शुष्म॒मा भ॑रा स्व॒र्विद॑म्
verses.transliteration: prá dhanvā soma jā́gr̥vir  -índrāyendo pári srava  dyumántaṃ śúṣmam ā́ bharā  svarvídam

translation.text: Flow vigilant for Indra, thou Soma, yea, Indu, run thou on: Bring hither splendid strength that finds the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य॒ वृष॑णं॒ मदं॒ पव॑स्व वि॒श्वद॑र्शतः स॒हस्र॑यामा पथि॒कृद्वि॑चक्ष॒णः
verses.transliteration: índrāya vŕ̥ṣaṇam mádam  pávasva viśvádarśataḥ  sahásrayāmā pathikŕ̥d  vicakṣaṇáḥ

translation.text: Do thou, all-beautiful, purify for Indra's sake the mighty juice, Path-maker thou, far seeing, with a thousand ways.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ गातु॒वित्त॑मो दे॒वेभ्यो॒ मधु॑मत्तमः स॒हस्रं॑ याहि प॒थिभिः॒ कनि॑क्रदत्
verses.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ gātuvíttamo  devébhyo mádhumattamaḥ  sahásraṃ yāhi pathíbhiḥ  kánikradat

translation.text: Best finder of prosperity for us, most rich in sweets for Gods, Proceed thou loudly roaring on a thousand paths.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व दे॒ववी॑तय॒ इन्दो॒ धारा॑भि॒रोज॑सा आ क॒लशं॒ मधु॑मान्त्सोम नः सदः
verses.transliteration: pávasva devávītaye-  -índo dhā́rābhir ójasā  ā́ kaláśam mádhumān soma naḥ sadaḥ

translation.text: O Indu, with thy streams, in might, flow for the banquet of the Gods: Rich in meath, Soma, in our beaker take thy place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॑ द्र॒प्सा उ॑द॒प्रुत॒ इन्द्रं॒ मदा॑य वावृधुः त्वां दे॒वासो॑ अ॒मृता॑य॒ कं प॑पुः
verses.transliteration: táva drapsā́ udaprútaḥ-  índram mádāya vāvr̥dhuḥ  tvā́ṃ devā́so amŕ̥tāya kám papuḥ

translation.text: Thy drops that swim in water have exalted Indra to delight: The Gods have drunk thee up for immortality.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नः॑ सुतास इन्दवः पुना॒ना धा॑वता र॒यिम् वृ॒ष्टिद्या॑वो रीत्यापः स्व॒र्विदः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ naḥ sutāsa indavaḥ  punānā́ dhāvatā rayím  vr̥ṣṭídyāvo rītyāpaḥ svarvídaḥ

translation.text: Stream opulence to us, ye drops of Soma, pressed and purified, Pouring down rain from heaven in hoods, and finding light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमः॑ पुना॒न ऊ॒र्मिणाव्यो॒ वारं॒ वि धा॑वति अग्रे॑ वा॒चः पव॑मानः॒ कनि॑क्रदत्
verses.transliteration: sómaḥ punāná ūrmíṇā-  ávyo vā́raṃ ví dhāvati  ágre vācáḥ pávamānaḥ kánikradat

translation.text: Soma, while filtered, with his wave flows through the long wool of the sheep, Shouting while purified before the voice of song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धी॒भिर्हि॑न्वन्ति वा॒जिनं॒ वने॒ क्रीळ॑न्त॒मत्य॑विम् अ॒भि त्रि॑पृ॒ष्ठं म॒तयः॒ सम॑स्वरन्
verses.transliteration: dhībhír hinvanti vājínaṃ  váne krī́ḷantam átyavim  abhí tripr̥ṣṭhám matáyaḥ sám asvaran

translation.text: With songs they send the Mighty forth, sporting in wood, above the fleece: Our psalms have glorified him of the triple height.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस॑र्जि क॒लशाँ॑ अ॒भि मी॒ळ्हे सप्ति॒र्न वा॑ज॒युः पु॒ना॒नो वाचं॑ ज॒नय॑न्नसिष्यदत्
verses.transliteration: ásarji kaláśām̐ abhí  mīḷhé sáptir ná vājayúḥ  punānó vā́caṃ janáyann asiṣyadat

translation.text: Into the jars hath he been loosed, like an impetuous steed for war, And lifting up his voice, while filtered, glided on.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑ते हर्य॒तो हरि॒रति॒ ह्वरां॑सि॒ रंह्या॑ अ॒भ्यर्ष॑न्त्स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ वी॒रव॒द्यशः॑
verses.transliteration: pávate haryató hárir  áti hvárāṃsi ráṃhyā  abhyárṣan stotŕ̥bhyo vīrávad yáśaḥ

translation.text: Gold-hued and lovely in his course, througb tangles of the wool he flows, And pours heroic fame upon the worshippers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒या प॑वस्व देव॒युर्मधो॒र्धारा॑ असृक्षत रेभ॑न्प॒वित्रं॒ पर्ये॑षि वि॒श्वतः॑
verses.transliteration: ayā́ pavasva devayúr  mádhor dhā́rā asr̥kṣata  rébhan pavítram páry eṣi viśvátaḥ

translation.text: Flow thus, a faithful votary: the streams of meath have been effused. Thou comest to the filter, singing, from each side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परी॒तो षि॑ञ्चता सु॒तं सोमो॒ य उ॑त्त॒मं ह॒विः द॒ध॒न्वाँ यो नर्यो॑ अ॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तरा सु॒षाव॒ सोम॒मद्रि॑भिः
verses.transliteration: párītó ṣiñcatā sutáṃ  sómo yá uttamáṃ havíḥ  dadhanvā́m̐ yó náryo apsv àntár~ā́  suṣā́va sómam ádribhiḥ

translation.text: HENCE sprinkle forth the juice effused,. Soma, the best of sacred gifts, Who, friend of man, hath run amid the water-streams. He hath pressed Soma out with stones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू॒नं पु॑ना॒नोऽवि॑भिः॒ परि॑ स्र॒वाद॑ब्धः सुर॒भिंत॑रः सु॒ते चि॑त्त्वा॒प्सु म॑दामो॒ अन्ध॑सा श्री॒णन्तो॒ गोभि॒रुत्त॑रम्
verses.transliteration: nūnám punānó 'vibhiḥ pári srava-  -ádabdhaḥ surabhíntaraḥ  suté cit tvāpsú madāmo ándhasā  śrīṇánto góbhir úttaram

translation.text: Now, being purified, flow hither through the fleece inviolate and most odorous. We ladden thee in waters when thou art effused, blending thee still with juice and milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ सुवा॒नश्चक्ष॑से देव॒माद॑नः॒ क्रतु॒रिन्दु॑र्विचक्ष॒णः
verses.transliteration: pári suvānáś cákṣase devamā́danaḥ  krátur índur vicakṣaṇáḥ

translation.text: Pressed out for all to see, delighting Gods, Indu, Far-sighted One, is mental power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒ना॒नः सो॑म॒ धार॑या॒पो वसा॑नो अर्षसि आ र॑त्न॒धा योनि॑मृ॒तस्य॑ सीद॒स्युत्सो॑ देव हिर॒ण्ययः॑
verses.transliteration: punānáḥ soma dhā́rayā-  -apó vásāno arṣasi  ā́ ratnadhā́ yónim r̥tásya sīdasi-  útso deva hiraṇyáyaḥ

translation.text: Cleansing thee, Soma, in thy stream, thou flowest in a watery robe: Giver of wealth, thou sittest in the place of Law, O God, a fountain made of gold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दु॒हा॒न ऊध॑र्दि॒व्यं मधु॑ प्रि॒यं प्र॒त्नं स॒धस्थ॒मास॑दत् आ॒पृच्छ्यं॑ ध॒रुणं॑ वा॒ज्य॑र्षति॒ नृभि॑र्धू॒तो वि॑चक्ष॒णः
verses.transliteration: duhāná ū́dhar divyám mádhu priyám  pratnáṃ sadhástham ā́sadat  āpŕ̥chyaṃ dharúṇaṃ vājy àrṣati  nŕ̥bhir dhūtó vicakṣaṇáḥ

translation.text: Milking the heavenly udder for dear meath, he hath sat in the ancient gatheringplace. Washed by the men, the Strong Farseeing One streams forth nutriti us food that all desire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒ना॒नः सो॑म॒ जागृ॑वि॒रव्यो॒ वारे॒ परि॑ प्रि॒यः त्वं विप्रो॑ अभ॒वोऽङ्गि॑रस्तमो॒ मध्वा॑ य॒ज्ञं मि॑मिक्ष नः
verses.transliteration: punānáḥ soma jā́gr̥vir  ávyo vā́re pári priyó  tváṃ vípro abhavó 'ṅgirastamo  mádhvā yajñám mimikṣa naḥ

translation.text: O Soma, while they cleanse thee, dear and watchful in the sheep's long wool, Thou hast become a Singer most like Angiras: thou madest Sûrya mount to heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमो॑ मी॒ढ्वान्प॑वते गातु॒वित्त॑म॒ ऋषि॒र्विप्रो॑ विचक्ष॒णः त्वं क॒विर॑भवो देव॒वीत॑म॒ आ सूर्यं॑ रोहयो दि॒वि
verses.transliteration: sómo mīḍhvā́n pavate gātuvíttamaḥ-  ŕ̥ṣir vípro vicakṣaṇáḥ  tváṃ kavír abhavo devavī́tamaḥ-  ā́ sū́ryaṃ rohayo diví

translation.text: Bountiful, best of furtherers, Soma floweth on, R̥ishi and Singer, keen of sight. Thou hast become a Sage most welcome to the Gods: thou madest Sûrya mount to heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोम॑ उ षुवा॒णः सो॒तृभि॒रधि॒ ष्णुभि॒रवी॑नाम् अश्व॑येव ह॒रिता॑ याति॒ धार॑या म॒न्द्रया॑ याति॒ धार॑या
verses.transliteration: sóma u ṣuvāṇáḥ sotŕ̥bhir  ádhi ṣṇúbhir ávīnām  áśvayeva harítā yāti dhā́rayā  mandráyā yāti dhā́rayā

translation.text: Pressed out by pressers, Soma goes over the fleecy backs of sheep, Goes, even as with a mare, in tawnycoloured stream, goes in exhilarating stream.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒नू॒पे गोमा॒न्गोभि॑रक्षाः॒ सोमो॑ दु॒ग्धाभि॑रक्षाः स॒मु॒द्रं न सं॒वर॑णान्यग्मन्म॒न्दी मदा॑य तोशते
verses.transliteration: anūpé gómān góbhir akṣāḥ  sómo dugdhā́bhir akṣāḥ  samudráṃ ná saṃváraṇāny agman  mandī́ mádāya tośate

translation.text: Down to the water-Soma, rich in kine hath flowed with cows, with cows that have been milked. They have approached the mixing-vessel as a sea: the cheerer streams for the carouse.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ सो॑म सुवा॒नो अद्रि॑भिस्ति॒रो वारा॑ण्य॒व्यया॑ जनो॒ न पु॒रि च॒म्वो॑र्विश॒द्धरिः॒ सदो॒ वने॑षु दधिषे
verses.transliteration: ā́ soma suvānó ádribhis  tiró vā́rāṇy avyáyā  jáno ná purí camvòr viśad dháriḥ  sádo váneṣu dadhiṣe

translation.text: Effused by stones, O Soma, and urged through the long wool of the sheep, Thou, entering the saucers as a man the fort, gold-hued hast settled in the wood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स मा॑मृजे ति॒रो अण्वा॑नि मे॒ष्यो॑ मी॒ळ्हे सप्ति॒र्न वा॑ज॒युः अ॒नु॒माद्यः॒ पव॑मानो मनी॒षिभिः॒ सोमो॒ विप्रे॑भि॒र्ऋक्व॑भिः
verses.transliteration: sá māmr̥je tiró áṇvāni meṣyò  mīḷhé sáptir ná vājayúḥ  anumā́dyaḥ pávamāno manīṣíbhiḥ  sómo víprebhir ŕ̥kvabhiḥ

translation.text: He beautifies himself through the sheep's long fine wool, like an impetuous steed in war, Even Soma Pavamâna who shall be the joy of sages and of holy bards.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सो॑म दे॒ववी॑तये॒ सिन्धु॒र्न पि॑प्ये॒ अर्ण॑सा अं॒शोः पय॑सा मदि॒रो न जागृ॑वि॒रच्छा॒ कोशं॑ मधु॒श्चुत॑म्
verses.transliteration: prá soma devávītaye  síndhur ná pipye árṇasā  aṃśóḥ páyasā madiró ná jā́gr̥vir  áchā kóśam madhuścútam

translation.text: O Soma,– for the feast of Gods, river-like he hath swelled with surge, With the stalk's juice, exhilarating, resting not, into the vat that drops with meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ह॑र्य॒तो अर्जु॑ने॒ अत्के॑ अव्यत प्रि॒यः सू॒नुर्न मर्ज्यः॑ तमीं॑ हिन्वन्त्य॒पसो॒ यथा॒ रथं॑ न॒दीष्वा गभ॑स्त्योः
verses.transliteration: ā́ haryató árjune átke avyata  priyáḥ sūnúr ná márjyaḥ  tám īṃ hinvanty apáso yáthā ráthaṃ  nadī́ṣv ā́ gábhastyoḥ

translation.text: Like a dear son who must be decked, the Lovely One hath clad him in a shining robe. Men skilful at their work drive him forth, like a car, into the rivers from their bands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि सोमा॑स आ॒यवः॒ पव॑न्ते॒ मद्यं॒ मद॑म् स॒मु॒द्रस्याधि॑ वि॒ष्टपि॑ मनी॒षिणो॑ मत्स॒रासः॑ स्व॒र्विदः॑
verses.transliteration: abhí sómāsa āyávaḥ  pávante mádyam mádam  samudrásyā́dhi viṣṭápi manīṣíṇo  matsarā́saḥ svarvídaḥ

translation.text: The living drops of Soma juice pour, as they flow, the gladdening drink, Intelligent drops above the basin of the sea, exhilarating, finding light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तर॑त्समु॒द्रं पव॑मान ऊ॒र्मिणा॒ राजा॑ दे॒व ऋ॒तं बृ॒हत् अर्ष॑न्मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ धर्म॑णा॒ प्र हि॑न्वा॒न ऋ॒तं बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: tárat samudrám pávamāna ūrmíṇā  rā́jā devá r̥tám br̥hát  árṣan mitrásya váruṇasya dhármaṇā  prá hinvāná r̥tám br̥hát

translation.text: May Pavamâna, King and God, speed with his wave over the sea the lofty rite: May he by Mitra's and by Varuṇa's decree flow furthering the lofty rite.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नृभि॑र्येमा॒नो ह॑र्य॒तो वि॑चक्ष॒णो राजा॑ दे॒वः स॑मु॒द्रियः॑
verses.transliteration: nŕ̥bhir yemānó haryató vicakṣaṇó  rā́jā deváḥ samudríyaḥ

translation.text: Far-seeing, lovely, guided by the men, the God whose home is in the sea-

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य पवते॒ मदः॒ सोमो॑ म॒रुत्व॑ते सु॒तः स॒हस्र॑धारो॒ अत्यव्य॑मर्षति॒ तमी॑ मृजन्त्या॒यवः॑
verses.transliteration: índrāya pavate mádaḥ  sómo marútvate sutáḥ  sahásradhāro áty ávyam arṣati  tám ī mr̥janty āyávo

translation.text: Soma, the gladdening juice, flows pressed for Indra with his Marut host: He hastens o'er the fleece with all his thousand streams: men make him bright and beautiful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒ना॒नश्च॒मू ज॒नय॑न्म॒तिं क॒विः सोमो॑ दे॒वेषु॑ रण्यति अ॒पो वसा॑नः॒ परि॒ गोभि॒रुत्त॑रः॒ सीद॒न्वने॑ष्वव्यत
verses.transliteration: punānáś camū́ janáyan matíṃ kavíḥ  sómo devéṣu raṇyati  apó vásānaḥ pári góbhir úttaraḥ  sī́dan váneṣv avyata

translation.text: Purified in the bowl and gendering the hymn, wise Soma joys among the Gods. Robed in the flood, the Mighty One hath clad himself with milk and settled in the vats.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तवा॒हं सो॑म रारण स॒ख्य इ॑न्दो दि॒वेदि॑वे पु॒रूणि॑ बभ्रो॒ नि च॑रन्ति॒ मामव॑ परि॒धीँरति॒ ताँ इ॑हि
verses.transliteration: távāháṃ soma rāraṇa  sakhyá indo divé-dive  purū́ṇi babhro ní caranti mā́m áva  paridhī́m̐r áti tā́m̐ ihi

translation.text: O Soma, Indu, every day thy friendship hath been my delight. Many fiends follow me; help me, thou Tawny-hued; pass on beyond these barriers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ताहं नक्त॑मु॒त सो॑म ते॒ दिवा॑ स॒ख्याय॑ बभ्र॒ ऊध॑नि घृ॒णा तप॑न्त॒मति॒ सूर्यं॑ प॒रः श॑कु॒ना इ॑व पप्तिम
verses.transliteration: utā́háṃ náktam utá soma te dívā  sakhyā́ya babhra ū́dhani  ghr̥ṇā́ tápantam áti sū́ryam paráḥ  śakunā́ iva paptima

translation.text: Close to thy bosom am I, Soma, day and night. O Tawny-hued, for friendship sake. Sûrya himself refulgent with his glow have we o'ertaken in his course like birds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मृ॒ज्यमा॑नः सुहस्त्य समु॒द्रे वाच॑मिन्वसि र॒यिं पि॒शङ्गं॑ बहु॒लं पु॑रु॒स्पृहं॒ पव॑माना॒भ्य॑र्षसि
verses.transliteration: mr̥jyámānaḥ suhastya  samudré vā́cam invasi  rayím piśáṅgam bahulám puruspŕ̥ham  pávamānābhy àrṣasi

translation.text: Deft-handcd! thou when purified liftest thy voice amid the sea. Thou, Pavamâna, makest riches flow to us, yellow, abundant, much-desifed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मृ॒जा॒नो वारे॒ पव॑मानो अ॒व्यये॒ वृषाव॑ चक्रदो॒ वने॑ दे॒वानां॑ सोम पवमान निष्कृ॒तं गोभि॑रञ्जा॒नो अ॑र्षसि
verses.transliteration: mr̥jānó vā́re pávamāno avyáye  vŕ̥ṣā́va cakrado váne  devā́nāṃ soma pavamāna niṣkr̥táṃ  góbhir añjānó arṣasi

translation.text: Making thee pure and bright in the sheep's long wool, thou hast bellowed, steerlike, in the wood. Thou flowest, Soma Pavamâna, balmed with milk unto the special place of Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व॒ वाज॑सातये॒ऽभि विश्वा॑नि॒ काव्या॑ त्वं स॑मु॒द्रं प्र॑थ॒मो वि धा॑रयो दे॒वेभ्यः॑ सोम मत्स॒रः
verses.transliteration: pávasva vā́jasātaye  abhí víśvāni kā́vyā  tváṃ samudrám prathamó ví dhārayo  devébhyaḥ soma matsaráḥ

translation.text: Flow on to win us strength, flow on to lofty lore of every kind. Thou, Soma, as Exhilarator wast the first to spread the sea abroad for Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स तू प॑वस्व॒ परि॒ पार्थि॑वं॒ रजो॑ दि॒व्या च॑ सोम॒ धर्म॑भिः त्वां विप्रा॑सो म॒तिभि॑र्विचक्षण शु॒भ्रं हि॑न्वन्ति धी॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: sá tū́ pavasva pári pā́rthivaṃ rájaḥ-  divyā́ ca soma dhármabhiḥ  tvā́ṃ víprāso matíbhir vicakṣaṇa  śubhráṃ hinvanti dhītíbhiḥ

translation.text: Flow to the realm of earth, flow to the realm of heaven, O Soma, in thy righteous ways. Fair art thou whom the sages, O Far-seeing One, urge onward with their songs and hymns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑माना असृक्षत प॒वित्र॒मति॒ धार॑या म॒रुत्व॑न्तो मत्स॒रा इ॑न्द्रि॒या हया॑ मे॒धाम॒भि प्रयां॑सि च
verses.transliteration: pávamānā asr̥kṣata  pavítram áti dhā́rayā  marútvanto matsarā́ indriyā́ háyāḥ-  medhā́m abhí práyāṃsi ca

translation.text: Over the cleansing sieve have flowed the Pavamânas in a stream, Girt by the Maruts, gladdening, Steeds with Indra's stiength, for wisdom and for dainty food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पो वसा॑नः॒ परि॒ कोश॑मर्ष॒तीन्दु॑र्हिया॒नः सो॒तृभिः॑ ज॒नय॒ञ्ज्योति॑र्म॒न्दना॑ अवीवश॒द्गाः कृ॑ण्वा॒नो न नि॒र्णिज॑म्
verses.transliteration: apó vásānaḥ pári kóśam arṣati-  índur hiyānáḥ sotŕ̥bhir  janáyañ jyótir mandánā avīvaśad  gā́ḥ kr̥ṇvānó ná nirṇíjam

translation.text: Urged onward by the pressers, clad in watery robes, Indu is speeding to the vat. He gendering light, hath made the glad Cows low, while he takes them as his garb of state.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व॒ मधु॑मत्तम॒ इन्द्रा॑य सोम क्रतु॒वित्त॑मो॒ मदः॑ महि॑ द्यु॒क्षत॑मो॒ मदः॑
verses.transliteration: pávasva mádhumattamaḥ  índrāya soma kratuvíttamo mádaḥ  máhi dyukṣátamo mádaḥ

translation.text: FOR Indra, flow thou Soma on, as gladdening juice most sweet, intelligent, Great, cheering, dwelling most in heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ ते पी॒त्वा वृ॑ष॒भो वृ॑षा॒यते॒ऽस्य पी॒ता स्व॒र्विदः॑ स सु॒प्रके॑तो अ॒भ्य॑क्रमी॒दिषोऽच्छा॒ वाजं॒ नैत॑शः
verses.transliteration: yásya te pītvā́ vr̥ṣabhó vr̥ṣāyáte  -asyá pītā́ svarvídaḥ  sá supráketo abhy àkramīd íṣaḥ-  -achā vā́jaṃ naítaśaḥ

translation.text: Thou, of whom having drunk the Steer acts like a steer. drinking of this that finds the light, He, Excellently Wise, is come to strengthening food, to spoil and wealth like Etaṣa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ह्य१॒॑ङ्ग दैव्या॒ पव॑मान॒ जनि॑मानि द्यु॒मत्त॑मः अ॒मृ॒त॒त्वाय॑ घो॒षयः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ hy àṅgá daívyā  pávamāna jánimāni dyumáttamaḥ  amr̥tatvā́ya ghoṣáyaḥ

translation.text: For, verily, Pavamâna, thou bast, splendidest, called all the generations of The Gods to immortality.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येना॒ नव॑ग्वो द॒ध्यङ्ङ॑पोर्णु॒ते येन॒ विप्रा॑स आपि॒रे दे॒वानां॑ सु॒म्ने अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ चारु॑णो॒ येन॒ श्रवां॑स्यान॒शुः
verses.transliteration: yénā návagvo dadhyáṅṅ aporṇuté  yéna víprāsa āpiré  devā́nāṃ sumné amŕ̥tasya cā́ruṇo  yéna śrávāṃsy ānaśúḥ

translation.text: By whom Dadhyac Navagva opens fastened doors, by whom the sages gained their wish, By whom they won the fame of lovely Amrit in the felicity of Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्य धार॑या सु॒तोऽव्यो॒ वारे॑भिः पवते म॒दिन्त॑मः क्रीळ॑न्नू॒र्मिर॒पामि॑व
verses.transliteration: eṣá syá dhā́rayā sutó  -ávyo vā́rebhiḥ pavate madíntamaḥ  krī́ḷann ūrmír apā́m iva

translation.text: Effused, he floweth in a stream, best rapture-giver, in the long wool of the sheep, Sporting, as 'twere the waters' wave.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य उ॒स्रिया॒ अप्या॑ अ॒न्तरश्म॑नो॒ निर्गा अकृ॑न्त॒दोज॑सा अ॒भि व्र॒जं त॑त्निषे॒ गव्य॒मश्व्यं॑ व॒र्मीव॑ धृष्ण॒वा रु॑ज
verses.transliteration: yá usríyā ápyā antár áśmano  nír gā́ ákr̥ntad ójasā  abhí vrajáṃ tatniṣe gávyam áśvyaṃ  varmī́va dhr̥ṣṇav ā́ ruja

translation.text: He who from out the rocky cavern took with might the red refulgent watery Cows, Thou masterest the stable full of kine and steeds: burst it, brave Lord, like one in mail.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ सो॑ता॒ परि॑ षिञ्च॒ताश्वं॒ न स्तोम॑म॒प्तुरं॑ रज॒स्तुर॑म् व॒न॒क्र॒क्षमु॑द॒प्रुत॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ sotā pári ṣiñcata-  -áśvaṃ ná stómam aptúraṃ rajastúram  vanakrakṣám udaprútam

translation.text: Press ye and pour him, like a steed, laudworthy, speeding through the region and the flood, Who swims in water, roan in wood;

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्र॑धारं वृष॒भं प॑यो॒वृधं॑ प्रि॒यं दे॒वाय॒ जन्म॑ने ऋ॒तेन॒ य ऋ॒तजा॑तो विवावृ॒धे राजा॑ दे॒व ऋ॒तं बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: sahásradhāraṃ vr̥ṣabhám payovŕ̥dham  priyáṃ devā́ya jánmane  r̥téna yá r̥tájāto vivāvr̥dhé  rā́jā devá r̥tám br̥hát

translation.text: Increaser of the water, Steer with thousand streams, dear to the race of Deities; Who born in Law hath waxen mighty by the Law, King, God, and lofty Ordinance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि द्यु॒म्नं बृ॒हद्यश॒ इष॑स्पते दिदी॒हि दे॑व देव॒युः वि कोशं॑ मध्य॒मं यु॑व
verses.transliteration: abhí dyumnám br̥hád yáśaḥ-  íṣas pate didīhí deva devayúḥ  ví kóśam madhyamáṃ yuva

translation.text: Make splendid glory shine on us, thou Lord of strengthening food, God, as the Friend of Gods: Unclose the fount of middle air.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ व॑च्यस्व सुदक्ष च॒म्वोः॑ सु॒तो वि॒शां वह्नि॒र्न वि॒श्पतिः॑ वृ॒ष्टिं दि॒वः प॑वस्व री॒तिम॒पां जिन्वा॒ गवि॑ष्टये॒ धियः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ vacyasva sudakṣa camvòḥ sutó  viśā́ṃ váhnir ná viśpátiḥ  vr̥ṣṭíṃ diváḥ pavasva rītím apā́ṃ  jínvā gáviṣṭaye dhíyaḥ

translation.text: Roll onward to the bowls, O Mighty One, effused, as Prince supporter of the tribes. Pour on us rain from heaven, send us the waters' flow: incite our thoughts to win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तमु॒ त्यं म॑द॒च्युतं॑ स॒हस्र॑धारं वृष॒भं दिवो॑ दुहुः विश्वा॒ वसू॑नि॒ बिभ्र॑तम्
verses.transliteration: etám u tyám madacyútaṃ  sahásradhāraṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ dívo duhuḥ  víśvā vásūni bíbhratam

translation.text: They have drained him the Steer of heaven, him with a thousand streams, distilling rapturous joy, Him who brings all things excellent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॒ वि ज॑ज्ञे ज॒नय॒न्नम॑र्त्यः प्र॒तप॒ञ्ज्योति॑षा॒ तमः॑ स सुष्टु॑तः क॒विभि॑र्नि॒र्णिजं॑ दधे त्रि॒धात्व॑स्य॒ दंस॑सा
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā ví jajñe janáyann ámartyaḥ  pratápañ jyótiṣā támaḥ  sá súṣṭutaḥ kavíbhir nirṇíjaṃ dadhe  tridhā́tv asya dáṃsasā

translation.text: The Mighty One was born Immortal, giving life, lightening darkness with his shine. Wcll-praised by. sages he hath. by his wondrous power assumed the Threefold as his robe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सु॑न्वे॒ यो वसू॑नां॒ यो रा॒यामा॑ने॒ता य इळा॑नाम् सोमो॒ यः सु॑क्षिती॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: sá sunve yó vásūnāṃ  yó rāyā́m ānetā́ yá íḷānām  sómo yáḥ sukṣitīnā́m

translation.text: Effused is he who brings good things, who brings us bounteous gifts and sweet refreshing food, Soma who brings us quiet homes:

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ न॒ इन्द्रः॒ पिबा॒द्यस्य॑ म॒रुतो॒ यस्य॑ वार्य॒मणा॒ भगः॑ आ येन॑ मि॒त्रावरु॑णा॒ करा॑मह॒ एन्द्र॒मव॑से म॒हे
verses.transliteration: yásya na índraḥ píbād yásya marúto  yásya vāryamáṇā bhágaḥ  ā́ yéna mitrā́váruṇā kárāmahe-  éndram ávase mahé

translation.text: He whom our Indra and the Marut host shall drink, Bhaga shall drink with Aryaman, By whom we bring to us Mitra and Varuṇa and Indra for our great defence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य सोम॒ पात॑वे॒ नृभि॑र्य॒तः स्वा॑यु॒धो म॒दिन्त॑मः पव॑स्व॒ मधु॑मत्तमः
verses.transliteration: índrāya soma pā́tave  nŕ̥bhir yatáḥ svāyudhó madíntamaḥ  pávasva mádhumattamaḥ

translation.text: Soma, for Indra's drink do thou, led by the men, well-wcaponcd and most gladdening, Flow on with greatest store of sweets.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑स्य॒ हार्दि॑ सोम॒धान॒मा वि॑श समु॒द्रमि॑व॒ सिन्ध॑वः जुष्टो॑ मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णाय वा॒यवे॑ दि॒वो वि॑ष्ट॒म्भ उ॑त्त॒मः
verses.transliteration: -índrasya hā́rdi somadhā́nam ā́ viśa  samudrám iva síndhavaḥ  júṣṭo mitrā́ya váruṇāya vāyáve  divó viṣṭambhá uttamáḥ

translation.text: Enter the Soma-holder, even Indra's heart, as rivers pass into the sea, Acceptable to Mitra, Vâyu, Varuṇa, the noblest Pillar of the heavens.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ प्र ध॒न्वेन्द्रा॑य सोम स्वा॒दुर्मि॒त्राय॑ पू॒ष्णे भगा॑य
verses.transliteration: pári prá dhanvéndrāya soma  svādúr mitrā́ya pūṣṇé bhágāya

translation.text: PLEASANT to Indra's Mitra's, Pûshan's Bhaga's taste, sped onward, Soma, with thy flowing stream.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑स्ते सोम सु॒तस्य॑ पेयाः॒ क्रत्वे॒ दक्षा॑य॒ विश्वे॑ च दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: índras te soma sutásya peyāḥ  krátve dákṣāya víśve ca devā́ḥ
