translation.text: Let Indra drink, O Soma, of thy juice for wisdom, and all Deities for strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वामृता॑य म॒हे क्षया॑य॒ स शु॒क्रो अ॑र्ष दि॒व्यः पी॒यूषः॑
verses.transliteration: evā́mŕ̥tāya mahé kṣáyāya  sá śukró arṣa divyáḥ pīyū́ṣaḥ

translation.text: So flow thou on as bright celestial juice, flow to the vast, immortal dwelling-place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व सोम म॒हान्त्स॑मु॒द्रः पि॒ता दे॒वानां॒ विश्वा॒भि धाम॑
verses.transliteration: pávasva soma mahā́n samudráḥ  pitā́ devā́nāṃ víśvābhí dhā́ma

translation.text: Flow onward, Soma, as a mighty sea, as Father of the Gods to every form.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒क्रः प॑वस्व दे॒वेभ्यः॑ सोम दि॒वे पृ॑थि॒व्यै शं च॑ प्र॒जायै॑
verses.transliteration: śukráḥ pavasva devébhyaḥ soma  divé pr̥thivyaí śáṃ ca prajā́yai

translation.text: Flow on, O Soma, radiant for the Gods and Heaven and Earth and bless our progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो ध॒र्तासि॑ शु॒क्रः पी॒यूषः॑ स॒त्ये विध॑र्मन्वा॒जी प॑वस्व
verses.transliteration: divó dhartā́si śukráḥ pīyū́ṣaḥ  satyé vídharman vājī́ pavasva

translation.text: Thou, bright Juice, art Sustainer of the sky: flow, mighty, in accordance with true Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व सोम द्यु॒म्नी सु॑धा॒रो म॒हामवी॑ना॒मनु॑ पू॒र्व्यः
verses.transliteration: pávasva soma dyumnī́ sudhāró  mahā́m ávīnām ánu pūrvyáḥ

translation.text: Soma, flow splendid with thy copious stream through the great fleece as in the olden time.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नृभि॑र्येमा॒नो ज॑ज्ञा॒नः पू॒तः क्षर॒द्विश्वा॑नि म॒न्द्रः स्व॒र्वित्
verses.transliteration: nŕ̥bhir yemānó jajñānáḥ pūtáḥ  kṣárad víśvāni mandráḥ svarvít

translation.text: Bom, led by men, joyous, and purified, let the Light-finder make all blessings flow:

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्दुः॑ पुना॒नः प्र॒जामु॑रा॒णः कर॒द्विश्वा॑नि॒ द्रवि॑णानि नः
verses.transliteration: índuḥ punānáḥ prajā́m urāṇáḥ  kárad víśvāni dráviṇāni naḥ

translation.text: Indu, while cleansed, keeping the people safe, shall give us all possessions for our own.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पव॑स्व सोम॒ क्रत्वे॒ दक्षा॒याश्वो॒ न नि॒क्तो वा॒जी धना॑य
verses.transliteration: pávasva soma krátve dákṣāya-  -áśvo ná niktó vājī́ dhánāya

translation.text: Flow on for wisdom, Soma, and for power, as a strong courser bathed, to win the prize.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं ते॑ सो॒तारो॒ रसं॒ मदा॑य पु॒नन्ति॒ सोमं॑ म॒हे द्यु॒म्नाय॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ te sotā́ro rásam mádāya  punánti sómam mahé dyumnā́ya

translation.text: The pressers purify this juice of thine, the Soma, for delight, and lofty fame

verses.sanskrit_deva: शिशुं॑ जज्ञा॒नं हरिं॑ मृजन्ति प॒वित्रे॒ सोमं॑ दे॒वेभ्य॒ इन्दु॑म्
verses.transliteration: śíśuṃ jajñānáṃ hárim mr̥janti  pavítre sómaṃ devébhya índum

translation.text: They deck the Gold-hued Infant, newlyborn, even Soma, Indu, in the sieve for Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्दुः॑ पविष्ट॒ चारु॒र्मदा॑या॒पामु॒पस्थे॑ क॒विर्भगा॑य
verses.transliteration: índuḥ paviṣṭa cā́rur mádāya-  -apā́m upásthe kavír bhágāya

translation.text: Fair Indu hath flowed on for rapturous joy, Sage for good fortune in the waters' lap.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बिभ॑र्ति॒ चार्विन्द्र॑स्य॒ नाम॒ येन॒ विश्वा॑नि वृ॒त्रा ज॒घान॑
verses.transliteration: bíbharti cā́rv índrasya nā́ma  yéna víśvāni vr̥trā́ jaghā́na

translation.text: He bears the beauteous name of Indra, that wherewith he overcame all demon foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पिब॑न्त्यस्य॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वासो॒ गोभिः॑ श्री॒तस्य॒ नृभिः॑ सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: píbanty asya víśve devā́so  góbhiḥ śrītásya nŕ̥bhiḥ sutásya

translation.text: All Deities are wont to drink of him, pressed by the men and blent with milk and curds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सु॑वा॒नो अ॑क्षाः स॒हस्र॑धारस्ति॒रः प॒वित्रं॒ वि वार॒मव्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: prá suvānó akṣāḥ sahásradhāras  tiráḥ pavítraṃ ví vā́ram ávyam

translation.text: He hath flowed forth with thousand streams effused, flowed ihsough the filter and the sheep's long wool.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वा॒ज्य॑क्षाः स॒हस्र॑रेता अ॒द्भिर्मृ॑जा॒नो गोभिः॑ श्रीणा॒नः
verses.transliteration: sá vājy àkṣāḥ sahásraretāḥ-  adbhír mr̥jānó góbhiḥ śrīṇānáḥ

translation.text: With endless genial flow the Strong hath run, purified by the waters, blent with milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सो॑म या॒हीन्द्र॑स्य कु॒क्षा नृभि॑र्येमा॒नो अद्रि॑भिः सु॒तः
verses.transliteration: prá soma yāhī́ndrasya kukṣā́  nŕ̥bhir yemānó ádribhiḥ sutáḥ

translation.text: Pressed out with stones, directed by the men, go fortli, O Soma, into Indra's throat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस॑र्जि वा॒जी ति॒रः प॒वित्र॒मिन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमः॑ स॒हस्र॑धारः
verses.transliteration: ásarji vājī́ tiráḥ pavítram  índrāya sómaḥ sahásradhāraḥ

translation.text: The mighty Soma with a thousand streams is poured to Indra through the cleansing sieve.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ञ्जन्त्ये॑नं॒ मध्वो॒ रसे॒नेन्द्रा॑य॒ वृष्ण॒ इन्दुं॒ मदा॑य
verses.transliteration: añjánty enam mádhvo rásena-  -índrāya vŕ̥ṣṇa índum mádāya

translation.text: Indu they balm with pleasant milky juice for Indra, for the Steer, for his delight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वेभ्य॑स्त्वा॒ वृथा॒ पाज॑से॒ऽपो वसा॑नं॒ हरिं॑ मृजन्ति
verses.transliteration: devébhyas tvā vŕ̥thā pā́jase  -apó vásānaṃ hárim mr̥janti

translation.text: Lightly, for sheen, they cleanse thee for the Gods, gold-coloured, wearing water as thy robe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्दु॒रिन्द्रा॑य तोशते॒ नि तो॑शते श्री॒णन्नु॒ग्रो रि॒णन्न॒पः
verses.transliteration: índur índrāya tośate  ní tośate  śrīṇánn ugró riṇánn apáḥ

translation.text: Indu to Indra streams, yea, downward streams, Strong, flowing to the floods, and mingling -there.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पर्यू॒ षु प्र ध॑न्व॒ वाज॑सातये॒ परि॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ स॒क्षणिः॑ द्वि॒षस्त॒रध्या॑ ऋण॒या न॑ ईयसे
verses.transliteration: páry ū ṣú prá dhanva vā́jasātaye  pári vr̥trā́ṇi sakṣáṇiḥ  dviṣás tarádhyā r̥ṇayā́ na īyase

translation.text: O'ERPOWERING Vr̥itras, forward run to win great strength: Thou speedest to subdue like one exacting debts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॒ हि त्वा॑ सु॒तं सो॑म॒ मदा॑मसि म॒हे स॑मर्य॒राज्ये॑ वाजाँ॑ अ॒भि प॑वमान॒ प्र गा॑हसे
verses.transliteration: ánu hí tvā sutáṃ soma mádāmasi  mahé samaryarā́jye  vā́jām̐ abhí pavamāna prá gāhase

translation.text: In thee, effused, O Soma, we rejoice ourselves for great supremacy in fight. Thou, Pavamâna, enterest into mighty deeds,

verses.sanskrit_deva: अजी॑जनो॒ हि प॑वमान॒ सूर्यं॑ वि॒धारे॒ शक्म॑ना॒ पयः॑ गोजी॑रया॒ रंह॑माणः॒ पुरं॑ध्या
verses.transliteration: ájījano hí pavamāna sū́ryaṃ  vidhā́re śákmanā páyaḥ  gójīrayā ráṃhamāṇaḥ púraṃdhyā

translation.text: O Pavamâna, thou didst generate the Sun, and spread the moisture out with power, Hasting to us with plenty vivified with milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अजी॑जनो अमृत॒ मर्त्ये॒ष्वाँ ऋ॒तस्य॒ धर्म॑न्न॒मृत॑स्य॒ चारु॑णः सदा॑सरो॒ वाज॒मच्छा॒ सनि॑ष्यदत्
verses.transliteration: ájījano amr̥ta mártyeṣv ā́m̐  r̥tásya dhármann amŕ̥tasya cā́ruṇaḥ  sádāsaro vā́jam áchā sániṣyadat

translation.text: Thou didst produce him, Deathless God mid mortal men for maintenance of Law and lovely Amrit: Thou evermore hast moved making strength flow to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भ्य॑भि॒ हि श्रव॑सा त॒तर्दि॒थोत्सं॒ न कं चि॑ज्जन॒पान॒मक्षि॑तम् शर्या॑भि॒र्न भर॑माणो॒ गभ॑स्त्योः
verses.transliteration: abhy-àbhi hí śrávasā tatárditha-  -útsaṃ ná káṃ cij janapā́nam ákṣitam  śáryābhir ná bháramāṇo gábhastyoḥ

translation.text: All round about hast thou with glory pierced for us as 'twere a never-failing well for men to drink, Borne on thy way in fragments from the presser's arms.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आदीं॒ के चि॒त्पश्य॑मानास॒ आप्यं॑ वसु॒रुचो॑ दि॒व्या अ॒भ्य॑नूषत वारं॒ न दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता व्यू॑र्णुते
verses.transliteration: ā́d īṃ ké cit páśyamānāsa ā́pyaṃ  vasurúco divyā́ abhy ànūṣata  vā́raṃ ná deváḥ savitā́ vy ū̀rṇute

translation.text: Then, beautifully radiant, certain Heavenly Ones, have sung to him their kinship as they looked thereon, And Savitar the God opens as 'twere a stall.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे सो॑म प्रथ॒मा वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषो म॒हे वाजा॑य॒ श्रव॑से॒ धियं॑ दधुः स त्वं नो॑ वीर वी॒र्या॑य चोदय
verses.transliteration: tvé soma prathamā́ vr̥ktábarhiṣo  mahé vā́jāya śrávase dhíyaṃ dadhuḥ  sá tváṃ no vīra vīryā̀ya codaya

translation.text: Soma, the men of old whose grass was trimmed addressed the hymn to thee for mighty strength and for renown: So, Hero, urge us onward to heroic power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वः पी॒यूषं॑ पू॒र्व्यं यदु॒क्थ्यं॑ म॒हो गा॒हाद्दि॒व आ निर॑धुक्षत इन्द्र॑म॒भि जाय॑मानं॒ सम॑स्वरन्
verses.transliteration: diváḥ pīyū́ṣam pūrvyáṃ yád ukthyàm  mahó gāhā́d divá ā́ nír adhukṣata  índram abhí jā́yamānaṃ sám asvaran

translation.text: They have drained forth from out the great depth of the sky the old primeval milk of heaven that claims the laud: They lifted up their voice to Indra athis birth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ यदि॒मे प॑वमान॒ रोद॑सी इ॒मा च॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒भि म॒ज्मना॑ यू॒थे न नि॒ष्ठा वृ॑ष॒भो वि ति॑ष्ठसे
verses.transliteration: ádha yád imé pavamāna ródasī  imā́ ca víśvā bhúvanābhí majmánā  yūthé ná niṣṭhā́ vr̥ṣabhó ví tiṣṭhase

translation.text: As long as thou, O Pavamâna, art above this earth and heaven and all existence in thy might, Thou standest like a Bull the chief amid the herd.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमः॑ पुना॒नो अ॒व्यये॒ वारे॒ शिशु॒र्न क्रीळ॒न्पव॑मानो अक्षाः स॒हस्र॑धारः श॒तवा॑ज॒ इन्दुः॑
verses.transliteration: sómaḥ punānó avyáye vā́re  śíśur ná krī́ḷan pávamāno akṣāḥ  sahásradhāraḥ śatávāja índur

translation.text: In the sheep's wool hath Soma Pavamâna flowed, while they cleanse him, like a playful infant, Indu with hundred powers and hundred currents.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष पु॑ना॒नो मधु॑माँ ऋ॒तावेन्द्रा॒येन्दुः॑ पवते स्वा॒दुरू॒र्मिः वा॒ज॒सनि॑र्वरिवो॒विद्व॑यो॒धाः
verses.transliteration: eṣá punānó mádhumām̐ r̥tā́vā-  -índrāyénduḥ pavate svādúr ūrmíḥ  vājasánir varivovíd vayodhā́ḥ

translation.text: Holy and sweet, while purified, this Indu flows on, a wave of pleasant taste, to Indra,– Strength-winner, Treasure-finder, Life. bestower.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स प॑वस्व॒ सह॑मानः पृत॒न्यून्त्सेध॒न्रक्षां॒स्यप॑ दु॒र्गहा॑णि स्वा॒यु॒धः सा॑स॒ह्वान्त्सो॑म॒ शत्रू॑न्
verses.transliteration: sá pavasva sáhamānaḥ pr̥tanyū́n  sédhan rákṣāṃsy ápa durgáhāṇi  svāyudháḥ sāsahvā́n soma śátrūn

translation.text: So flow thou on, subduing our assailants, chasing the demons hard to beencountered, Well-armed and conquering our foes, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒या रु॒चा हरि॑ण्या पुना॒नो विश्वा॒ द्वेषां॑सि तरति स्व॒युग्व॑भिः॒ सूरो॒ न स्व॒युग्व॑भिः धारा॑ सु॒तस्य॑ रोचते पुना॒नो अ॑रु॒षो हरिः॑ विश्वा॒ यद्रू॒पा प॑रि॒यात्यृक्व॑भिः स॒प्तास्ये॑भि॒र्ऋक्व॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ayā́ rucā́ háriṇyā punānó  víśvā dvéṣāṃsi tarati svayúgvabhiḥ  sū́ro ná svayúgvabhiḥ  dhā́rā sutásya rocate  punānó aruṣó háriḥ  víśvā yád rūpā́ pariyā́ty ŕ̥kvabhiḥ  saptā́syebhir ŕ̥kvabhiḥ

translation.text: WITH this his golden splendour purifying him, he with his own allies subdues all enemies, as Ṣarawith his own allies. Cleansing himself with stream of juice he shines forth yellow-hued and red, when with the praisers he encompasses all forms, with praisers having seven mouths.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं त्यत्प॑णी॒नां वि॑दो॒ वसु॒ सं मा॒तृभि॑र्मर्जयसि॒ स्व आ दम॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ धी॒तिभि॒र्दमे॑ प॒रा॒वतो॒ न साम॒ तद्यत्रा॒ रण॑न्ति धी॒तयः॑ त्रि॒धातु॑भि॒ररु॑षीभि॒र्वयो॑ दधे॒ रोच॑मानो॒ वयो॑ दधे
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tyát paṇīnā́ṃ vido vásu  sám mātŕ̥bhir marjayasi svá ā́ dáme-  r̥tásya dhītíbhir dáme  parāváto ná sā́ma tád  yátrā ráṇanti dhītáyaḥ  tridhā́tubhir áruṣībhir váyo dadhe  rócamāno váyo dadhe

translation.text: That treasure of the Paṇis thou discoveredst; thou with thy mothers deckest thee in thine abode, with songs of worship in thine home. As 'twere from far, the hymn is heard, where holy songs resound in joy. He with the ruddy-hued, threefold hath won life-power, he, glittering, hath won life-power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पूर्वा॒मनु॑ प्र॒दिशं॑ याति॒ चेकि॑त॒त्सं र॒श्मिभि॑र्यतते दर्श॒तो रथो॒ दैव्यो॑ दर्श॒तो रथः॑ अग्म॑न्नु॒क्थानि॒ पौंस्येन्द्रं॒ जैत्रा॑य हर्षयन् वज्र॑श्च॒ यद्भव॑थो॒ अन॑पच्युता स॒मत्स्वन॑पच्युता
verses.transliteration: pū́rvām ánu pradíśaṃ yāti cékitat  sáṃ raśmíbhir yatate darśató rátho  daívyo darśató ráthaḥ  ágmann ukthā́ni paúṃsyā-  -índraṃ jaítrāya harṣayan  vájraś ca yád bhávatho ánapacyutā  samátsv ánapacyutā

translation.text: He moves intelligent, directed to the East. The very beauteous car rivals the beams of light, the beautiful celestial car. Hymns, lauding manly valour, came, inciting Indra to success, that ye may be unconquered, both thy bolt and thou, both be unconquered in the war.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ना॒ना॒नं वा उ॑ नो॒ धियो॒ वि व्र॒तानि॒ जना॑नाम् तक्षा॑ रि॒ष्टं रु॒तं भि॒षग्ब्र॒ह्मा सु॒न्वन्त॑मिच्छ॒तीन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: nānānáṃ vā́ u no dhíyo  ví vratā́ni jánānām  tákṣā riṣṭáṃ rutám bhiṣág  brahmā́ sunvántam ichati-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: WE all have various thoughts and plans, and diverse are the ways of men. The Brahman seeks the worshipper, wright seeks the cracked, and leech the maimed. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जर॑तीभि॒रोष॑धीभिः प॒र्णेभिः॑ शकु॒नाना॑म् का॒र्मा॒रो अश्म॑भि॒र्द्युभि॒र्हिर॑ण्यवन्तमिच्छ॒तीन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: járatībhir óṣadhībhiḥ  parṇébhiḥ śakunā́nām  kārmāró áśmabhir dyúbhir  híraṇyavantam ichati-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: The smith with ripe and seasoned plants, with feathers of the birds of air, With stones, and with enkindled flames, seeks him who hath a store of gold. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: का॒रुर॒हं त॒तो भि॒षगु॑पलप्र॒क्षिणी॑ न॒ना नाना॑धियो वसू॒यवोऽनु॒ गा इ॑व तस्थि॒मेन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: kārúr aháṃ tató bhiṣág  upalaprakṣíṇī nanā́  nā́nādhiyo vasūyávaḥ-  -ánu gā́ iva tasthima-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: A bard am I, my dad's a leech, mammy lays corn upon the stones. Striving for wealth, with varied plans, we follow our desires like kine. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वो॒ वोळ्हा॑ सु॒खं रथं॑ हस॒नामु॑पम॒न्त्रिणः॑ शेपो॒ रोम॑ण्वन्तौ भे॒दौ वारिन्म॒ण्डूक॑ इच्छ॒तीन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: áśvo vóḷhā sukháṃ ráthaṃ  hasanā́m upamantríṇaḥ  śépo rómaṇvantau bhedaú  vā́r ín maṇḍū́ka ichati-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: The horse would draw an easy car, gay hosts attract the laugh and jest. The male desires his mate's approach, the frog is eager for the flood, Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒र्य॒णाव॑ति॒ सोम॒मिन्द्रः॑ पिबतु वृत्र॒हा बलं॒ दधा॑न आ॒त्मनि॑ करि॒ष्यन्वी॒र्यं॑ म॒हदिन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: śaryaṇā́vati sómam  índraḥ pibatu vr̥trahā́  bálaṃ dádhāna ātmáni  kariṣyán vīryàm mahád  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: LET Vr̥itra-slaying Indra drink Soma by Ṣaryaṇâvân's side, Storing up vigour in his heart, prepared to do heroic deeds. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प॑वस्व दिशां पत आर्जी॒कात्सो॑म मीढ्वः ऋ॒त॒वा॒केन॑ स॒त्येन॑ श्र॒द्धया॒ तप॑सा सु॒त इन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: ā́ pavasva diśām pate-  ārjīkā́t soma mīḍhvaḥ  r̥tavākéna satyéna  śraddháyā tápasā sutáḥ-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: Lord of the Quarters, flow thou on, boon Soma, from Ârjîka land, Effused with ardour and with faith, and the true hymn of sacrifice. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒र्जन्य॑वृद्धं महि॒षं तं सूर्य॑स्य दुहि॒ताभ॑रत् तं ग॑न्ध॒र्वाः प्रत्य॑गृभ्ण॒न्तं सोमे॒ रस॒माद॑धु॒रिन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: parjányavr̥ddham mahiṣáṃ  táṃ sū́ryasya duhitā́bharat  táṃ gandharvā́ḥ práty agr̥bhṇan  táṃ sóme rásam ā́dadhur  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: Hither hath Sûrya's Daughter brought the wild Steer whom Parjanya nursed. Gandharvas have seized bold of him, and in the Soma laid the juice. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तं वद॑न्नृतद्युम्न स॒त्यं वद॑न्त्सत्यकर्मन् श्र॒द्धां वद॑न्त्सोम राजन्धा॒त्रा सो॑म॒ परि॑ष्कृत॒ इन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: r̥táṃ vádann r̥tadyumna  satyáṃ vádan satyakarman  śraddhā́ṃ vádan soma rājan  dhātrā́ soma páriṣkr̥taḥ-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: Splendid by Law! declaring Law, truthspeaking, truthful in thy works, Enouncing faith, King Soma! thou, O Soma, whom thy maker decks. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्यमु॑ग्रस्य बृह॒तः सं स्र॑वन्ति संस्र॒वाः सं य॑न्ति र॒सिनो॒ रसाः॑ पुना॒नो ब्रह्म॑णा हर॒ इन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: satyámugrasya br̥hatáḥ  sáṃ sravanti saṃsravā́ḥ  sáṃ yanti rasíno rásāḥ  punānó bráhmaṇā hare-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: Together flow the meeting streams of him the Great and truly Strong. The juices of the juicy meet. Made pure by prayer, O Golden-hued, flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्र॑ ब्र॒ह्मा प॑वमान छन्द॒स्यां॒३॒॑ वाचं॒ वद॑न् ग्राव्णा॒ सोमे॑ मही॒यते॒ सोमे॑नान॒न्दं ज॒नय॒न्निन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: yátra brahmā́ pavamāna  chandasyā̀ṃ vā́caṃ vádan  grā́vṇā sóme mahīyáte  sómenānandáṃ janáyann  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: O Pavamâna, where the priest, as he recites the rhythmic prayer, Lords it o'er Soma with the stone, with Soma bringing forth delight, flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्र॒ ज्योति॒रज॑स्रं॒ यस्मिँ॑ल्लो॒के स्व॑र्हि॒तम् तस्मि॒न्मां धे॑हि पवमाना॒मृते॑ लो॒के अक्षि॑त॒ इन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: yátra jyótir ájasraṃ  yásmim̐ loké svàr hitám  tásmin mā́ṃ dhehi pavamāna-  -amŕ̥te loké ákṣite-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: O Pavarnana, place me in that deathless, undecaying world Wherein the light of heaven is set, and everlasting lustre shines. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्र॒ राजा॑ वैवस्व॒तो यत्रा॑व॒रोध॑नं दि॒वः यत्रा॒मूर्य॒ह्वती॒राप॒स्तत्र॒ माम॒मृतं॑ कृ॒धीन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: yátra rā́jā vaivasvató  yátrāvaródhanaṃ diváḥ  yátrāmū́r yahvátīr ā́pas  tátra mā́m amŕ̥taṃ kr̥dhi-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: Make me immortal in that realm where dwells the King, Vivasvan's Son, Where is the secret shrine of heaven, where are those waters young and fresh. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्रा॑नुका॒मं चर॑णं त्रिना॒के त्रि॑दि॒वे दि॒वः लो॒का यत्र॒ ज्योति॑ष्मन्त॒स्तत्र॒ माम॒मृतं॑ कृ॒धीन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: yátrānukāmáṃ cáraṇaṃ  trināké tridivé diváḥ  lokā́ yátra jyótiṣmantas  tátra mā́m amŕ̥taṃ kr̥dhi-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: Make me immortal in that realm where they move even as they list, In the third sphere of inmost heaven where lucid worlds are full of light. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्र॒ कामा॑ निका॒माश्च॒ यत्र॑ ब्र॒ध्नस्य॑ वि॒ष्टप॑म् स्व॒धा च॒ यत्र॒ तृप्ति॑श्च॒ तत्र॒ माम॒मृतं॑ कृ॒धीन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: yátra kā́mā nikāmā́ś ca  yátra bradhnásya viṣṭápam  svadhā́ ca yátra tŕ̥ptiś ca  tátra mā́m amŕ̥taṃ kr̥dhi-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: Make me immortal in that realm of eager wish and strong desire, The region of the radiant Moon, where food and full delight are found. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake:

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्रा॑न॒न्दाश्च॒ मोदा॑श्च॒ मुदः॑ प्र॒मुद॒ आस॑ते काम॑स्य॒ यत्रा॒प्ताः कामा॒स्तत्र॒ माम॒मृतं॑ कृ॒धीन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: yátrānandā́ś ca módāś ca  múdaḥ pramúda ā́sate  kā́masya yátrāptā́ḥ kā́mās  tátra mā́m amŕ̥taṃ kr̥dhi-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: Make me immortal in that realm where happiness and transports, where Joys and felicities combine, and longing wishes are fulfilled. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इन्दोः॒ पव॑मान॒स्यानु॒ धामा॒न्यक्र॑मीत् तमा॑हुः सुप्र॒जा इति॒ यस्ते॑ सो॒मावि॑ध॒न्मन॒ इन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: yá índoḥ pávamānasya-  -ánu dhā́māny ákramīt  tám āhuḥ suprajā́ íti  yás te somā́vidhan mánaḥ-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: THE man who waIketh as the Laws of Indu Pavamâna bid,– Men call him rich in children, him, O Soma, who hath met thy thought. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋषे॑ मन्त्र॒कृतां॒ स्तोमैः॒ कश्य॑पोद्व॒र्धय॒न्गिरः॑ सोमं॑ नमस्य॒ राजा॑नं॒ यो ज॒ज्ञे वी॒रुधां॒ पति॒रिन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥ṣe mantrakŕ̥tāṃ stómaiḥ  káśyapodvardháyan gíraḥ  sómaṃ namasya rā́jānaṃ  yó jajñé vīrúdhām pátir  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: Kaṣyapa, R̥ishi, lifting up thy voice with hymn-composers' lauds, Pay reverence to King Soma born the Sovran Ruler of the plants. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त दिशो॒ नाना॑सूर्याः स॒प्त होता॑र ऋ॒त्विजः॑ दे॒वा आ॑दि॒त्या ये स॒प्त तेभिः॑ सोमा॒भि र॑क्ष न॒ इन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: saptá díśo nā́nāsūryāḥ  saptá hótāra r̥tvíjaḥ  devā́ ādityā́ yé saptá  tébhiḥ somābhí rakṣa naḥ-  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: Seven regions have their several Suns; the ministering priests are seven; Seven are the Âditya Deities,– with these, O Soma, guard thou us. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॑ राजञ्छृ॒तं ह॒विस्तेन॑ सोमा॒भि र॑क्ष नः अ॒रा॒ती॒वा मा न॑स्तारी॒न्मो च॑ नः॒ किं च॒नाम॑म॒दिन्द्रा॑येन्दो॒ परि॑ स्रव
verses.transliteration: yát te rājañ chr̥táṃ havís  téna somābhí rakṣa naḥ  arātīvā́ mā́ nas tārīt-  mó ca naḥ kíṃ canā́mamad  -índrāyendo pári srava

translation.text: Guard us with this oblation which, King Soma, hath been dressed for thee. Let not malignity conquer us, let nothing evil do us harm. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
